56.description: I LOVE this pizzal. It's absolutely delicious. My favorite is the thin crust cheese. Cipriani's uses fresh ingredients and has the perfect thin crust pizza - not too thin or thick.  When I'm out that way and have a taste for pizza, I always head here first.

29.description: One of the best deep dish pizza's I've had. We ordered a medium stuffed pepperoni pizza. This is definitely enough food for two people, with 3 pieces leftover.  After ordering we watched the chef press out, toss, and form the dough. Clearly house-made dough, which is cool. This pizza isn't too heavy on the cheese (and as a result isn't greasy at all). The crust is fairly thin and was baked to a nice crispness (a great contrast with the gooey filling). My husband, who isn't normally a fan of deep dish, sang this pizza's praises. The sauce is tangy and flavorful. Overall, the result is a surprisingly light slice.Service was very good, and everyone was kind and helpful. It's a small place (only 5 booths), so I'd imagine if you go at a busy time you might want to choose carry out. Not a fancy place, just great pizza. We'll be back to try their thin crust :D

42.description: great pizza -especially for the price. a large pie plus an appetizer doesnt get too far over 20$. great crispy,bready crust- if you like that. I prefer a little sweeter sauce, but thats just me. not a place to really dine in in terms of decor and accomidations, but mama and papa cipriani always recognize a returning customer and treat you like family.

23.description: I was told awhile ago about this place and I don't know why I didn't try them sooner, thin crust pizza is awesome and I usually dine at downtowns pizzerias, soup was also delicious and perfectly proportioned.  The price was reasonable and staff very attentive. Great place!!!

47.description: Visiting family who just moved to the area, we found Cipriani's via Grub Hub.Thank Goodness! WOW.The delivery time was fairly speedy and the pizza was still very hot when it arrived. Then we started eating. Correction, then we started devouring it.Pizza needs to have a great crust and flavorful sauce and Cipriani delivered on both accounts.

8.description: Overall I have to say Cipriani's is my personal favorite pizza place. They don't just serve excellent pizza, but the way they make it is just incredible. Whether it's the thin crust or deep dish, simply can't go wrong to trying it out at least once. I've also tried the breaded steak sandwich which comes with fries or a soup if preferred. Delicious. This restaurant keeps me coming back for more which is why I would recommend this to my friends or anyone who never had Cipriani's before!

31.description: My favorite my place to get pizza this is a hidden gem. They have the best pizza in Chicago I always usually order a large thin crust with sausage, mushroom, and spinach. Comes out to about $20 with free pop is a bonus :) Both the thin and stuffed are amazing.

34.description: Can't complain about the pizza cause it's great. I order from here every weekend almost.  But I feel the sizes got smaller. I also feel that they people who answer the phone should get there times right.. When calling in an order they should tell you when and how long the deliver is gonna take. When you say 45 minutes to an hour and in reality it's more than an hour.. They should call there customers and say something.. Over all it's great pizza... Can't complain about the pizza..

16.description: This will be forever my favorite pizza place. Such a shame that this place isn't as well known as it should be. Everyone there is so nice. Especially the little old lady that's there working almost every single day and every time I'm in there. She is such a sweetheart. But the pizza is honestly so good. The sauce is just like my Ma's and the crust is flaky and perfectly golden. I highly suggest eating here. Please keep being great.

13.description: Pizza was average at best definitely needs some work. We live right down the street but plan on never going back.

11.description: The best pizza in the Clearing neighborhood. Wish it was more well known as other local pizzerias.

37.description: Clean and fast. Great place for a salad and slice.Great salad!Slice of cheese pizza and a side salad!Family owned closed on Tuesday.

0.description: Ordered a stuffed sausage, mushroom, spinach and fresh garlic pizza. Garlic was minced and put on top of the sauce and it sends you to instant flavor town for garlic lovers.  Like many other reviews I agree this place is very similar to Giordano's.  I personally think Cipriani's is much better then the over priced franchised Giordano's.

38.description: After working all day, we decided on pizza for dinner.  Cipriani's was our choice; ordered for pickup as it was much faster than waiting for delivery.  Loved the almost flaky crust and overall, we thoroughly enjoyed this pizza!

51.description: This place is awesome!!! One of the best places i visited in Chicago.

27.description: Best pizza place in the midway area by far. I have a ton to quality places to choose from around here but choose this place once a week for a reason. The staff is super nice. I always get the same thing though. The fries are good not the best but come fresh when I deliver. The delivery time is always under 45 min even during sporting events. The deep dish is very similar to Giordanos but not as thick. The thin crust is awesome

32.description: The Chicago style deep dish will blow your mind! Just try to eat more than two pieces!! I wasn't sure about sauce on top but wow this was the best pizza I ever had. Quite a few locals recommended it. Delicious!!

54.description: after moving to the northside i still debate driving south when i want pizza and to tell u the truth i do it is by far the best pizza in chicago

48.description: I'm Wayne from Wayne's World and the pizza is Cassandra. Drreeeeaaaam weaverrrrr. I can't get enough of their stuff pizza. Seriously. used to be on the Giordano's bandwagon, but now that I've tried Cipriani's, I totally "get" why everyone raves about it. They're currently on vacation and I am so sad because I'm craving their pizza!Staff is super friendly. Other food aside from the pizza is also delicious--beef, italian sausage, etc. Thumbs up all around.

44.description: Pizza is a food group if you are a born-and-raised Chicagoan.  When you compare stuffed pizza places you think of Giordano's, and  Edwardo's.  Now this review is about their stuffed pizza, not other meals you can order.If you are in the area, and want the best Stuff pizza.  This is a hidden gem, that will be hard to beat. This is now our go-to for a freaking DELICIOUS stuffed pizza.First time was tonight, ordered minestrone soup, large garden salad, half spinach/half sausage med stuff pizza.  All for $22.  Which is a great deal in my eyes.  The soup and salad are good, not great.  The pizza will have you coming back for years to come.  Thank you to our great neighbor who raved how great their pizza was!  Really should get her one, just for the advice to come here!One review wrote"but their lasagna, spaghetti, cannoli are just atrocious."  Let's be real, I do not order sandwiches, or meals from Pizza places.  Most pizza places I only order one style of pizza from them.  With that said, time for you to try the stuff pizza!

24.description: The best stuffed pizza in the neighborhood.   They also make excellent cannoli.  I LOVE this place.

7.description: One of the Best Pizza Family Owned Resturants on The Southside of Chicago.I love their food. Taste A+Quality A+Delivery A+Customer Service A+Portions A+Location A+WITH all that said ...This RESTAURANT is a Must Try..

49.description: Fantastic pizza!  I like them just as much if not better than giordanos!  Order it well done though!

40.description: Best pizza in the Garfield Ridge area. Stuffed and thin crust were delicious!

53.description: Unequivocally the best (best being relative of course) stuffed pizza in the universe. The Lady behind the counter and guy making the pizzas and doing the prep work own the place and just produce good quality product in general. The breaded steak which I can t even find outside of the south side is crunchy and gooey and spicy and just a sinful good time. The salads and sandwiches are simple and delicious. But the star of the show is the stuffed spinach and sausage pizza with fresh garlic. This pizza is what the gods dine on when pizza is their fancy. There are lots of good places for thin crust and Cip's is decent but this place should be a Mecca for those seeking the best Chicago style pizza there is.

30.description: The pizza was simply AMAZING! This was my first "Chicago style pizza" and it was so dang good!

46.description: Very good thin crust pizza and friendly staff. We usually get half sausage, half pepperoni, or sausage with jalapenos. Extremely small but clean dining area and polite service. It's mainly pickup or delivery, but their wait staff will accommodate you if you decide to eat there. They also have a highchair for babies. Good pizza!

1.description: Had it for the first time today and overall pretty good. Delivery was faster than expected. I had the thin crust sausage pizza.....it only needed a little more sauce but other than that no complaints will definitely order again!

55.description: I've been trying to order pizza from all the neighborhood pizza places, and the one thing they all have in common is rude people picking up the phone! Even though this girl lowered my expectations going in, I was pleasantly surprised once I had the pizza. I thought it was fantastic! And the owner of the restaurant gave me a free liter of soda. I would have given it a 4 because of the phone ettiquite, but the pizza was so good - it earned it's 5.

9.description: Love this place. It's in my area and we love their pepperoni pizza. But today is baked ravioli.

26.description: Wife and I are now big fans.   Have called in deep dish orders (one mushroom and another pepperoni)  prior to departing from Midway Airport twice now in May and June.   Ordered the 'half-baked'.   Nicely packaged with twine to help with carrying.    Once arriving at West Coast, finish the baking to Lydia's specification, and voila - great Chicago experience re-lived.Prices also seem fair.

25.description: amazing best pizza in Chicago definitely worth the price! I go there often and I tell you satisfaction! For people who want a good casual restaurant this is the best! Great staff friendly. And accompany to your needs. Would never go any place else!

12.description: One of the best deep dish pizza's I've had. We ordered a medium stuffed pepperoni pizza. This is definitely enough food for two people, with 3 pieces leftover.  After ordering we watched the chef press out, toss, and form the dough. Clearly house-made dough, which is cool. This pizza isn't too heavy on the cheese (and as a result isn't greasy at all). The crust is fairly thin and was baked to a nice crispness (a great contrast with the gooey filling). My husband, who isn't normally a fan of deep dish, sang this pizza's praises. The sauce is tangy and flavorful. Overall, the result is a surprisingly light slice.Service was very good, and everyone was kind and helpful. It's a small place (only 5 booths), so I'd imagine if you go at a busy time you might want to choose carry out. Not a fancy place, just great pizza. We'll be back to try their thin crust :D

21.description: This will be forever my favorite pizza place. Such a shame that this place isn't as well known as it should be. Everyone there is so nice. Especially the little old lady that's there working almost every single day and every time I'm in there. She is such a sweetheart. But the pizza is honestly so good. The sauce is just like my Ma's and the crust is flaky and perfectly golden. I highly suggest eating here. Please keep being great.

17.description: Love Cipriani's! Great pizza. They make you feel like family when you come in. Best pizza on the southwest side of Chicago!

10.description: Good pizza and they delivered quickly to my work which was awesome, we'll be keeping their menu on hand for future pizza orders :)

5.description: Love this Pizza!!! Always one of our top choices!! Customer service is great, which makes it even better!!!

3.description: Mine and my family's favorite pizza place in the town! Their pizzas are always freshly made so it tastes really good. Services are fast and friendly. I highly recommend them!

35.description: Everything is good here!  Five stars!  Pizza is superb.  As good as it gets in Chicago.

19.description: Probably my favorite pizza around. Delivery is fast as well as pickup. Reasonable prices and deals as well as friendly staff. Never seen anyone working the register not seem genuinely nice. Good thing I don't live over there because I would never leave that place, it's that good. The fact that they make pizza so well should be more than enough reason to go but even if you're not into pizza they have a ton of other foods that they make just as well

28.description: Wonderful showcase style thin crust pizza. Sausage was awesome. Very fresh Italian Poorboy (delicious tasty bread).  Pasta Fagioli was very flavorful.  Even the house oil/vinegar salad dressing was delicious.  Looking forward to trying the stuffed pizza soon.  A lot of people stop in for a slice to go.  Would definitely recommend.

45.description: I honestly wish I can give these people a higher review. They do have great pizza and i love the cheese and the crust on it. Their stuffed is very good, but their lasagna, spaghetti, cannoli are just atrocious. They need to focus on making better pasta and sandwiches just and make them just as  well as their pizza.

33.description: Ordered a stuffed and thin crust pizza last week and have to say it was some of the best pizza I have had in a long time. The stuffed was great and had so much flavor, and the kids loved the thin crust. Will order again and again.

43.description: I love this place. The prices are so affordable. The owners are the cutest couple and so very friendly, and hardworking. I appreciate local businesses and all they do for our town. Their pizza by the slice is conveniently quick, but it is worth it to order a whole pizza even if it's a small size, because it is so affordable. I have tried their stuffed pizza as well as thin crust, both are great!

2.description: Best deep dish on the south side hands down.  I Have had Ciprianis deep dish a few times and they don't disappoint.  Other places overdo it with the cheese and crust, but here they make sure you get lots of ingredients.  I was actually upset that I hadn't tried it before.  If you love deep dish pizza, you must try Ciprianis. Fait accompli.

18.description: Clean and fast. Great place for a salad and slice.Great salad!Slice of cheese pizza and a side salad!Family owned closed on Tuesday.

41.description: Heres an update - Stopped by during lunch to get a slice (to try their regular thin) Didnt have money on me but I did have my debit card (sadly they only accept it if you place an order of $10 or more) So I left. I went back after work and ordered a medium thin, half canadian bacon and a breaded steak.After 15 minutes they finally tell me they are out of steak? Huh, spluh, bluh? Now this is a FRIDAY at 4:45pm, your weekend is just starting and NO STEAK? Anyway, I ordered a beef sammy.This time around, their canadian bacon was DEF' LOWER QUALITY. No smokiness at all..in fact, it tasted like plain old ham. The cheese was def' on the cheaper side - nowhere near as quality tasting as Vince's just a few more blocks up. The crust was dry as heck and kinda disintigrated in my mouth..not in a good crispy way either.Their beef sammy was pretty decent.Probably wont be going back again as I like to get my sammies from the same place I get my pie and Ciprianis isnt it any longer.

52.description: amazing stuffed pizza.  we took the advice of a yelper and had the sausage spinach and fresh garlic.  it was great.  I hope the thin crust is equally as good. light flavorful sauce, not greasy, delicious sausage, yummy crust--- mmm mmmmmmm!I needed a salad..... which was actually my first question when I called in my order - I ordered the caesar salad.  fresh romaine with red onion, parm cheese and what tasted like homemade toasted assorted croutons and the most delicious dressing on the side. can't wait to order for friends and family... I love when I just know a take out order will be an absolute hit.fantastic.

50.description: Best pizza in the neighborhood by far.  The nicest people too.  Very affordable prices.  I grew up on this pizza.

4.description: Holy schnikes! Pizza, thin. The bomb. Baby stuffed. Check. Breaded steak? Oh, yea. Beef sammich? They got you. Want a canolli? Boom, you got it. Pasta? You want that awesome regular or baked to amazing? No works. When they close to go on vacation I need rehab. And everyone is soooooo oo oo friendly. The phone girls. The drivers. Lila, the owner. So much awesome. Back to that baby stuffed....if you havent, you should.

6.description: the pizza is great, but service not so much....who ever is the girl picking up the phone calls might want to be more polite to their customers. Keeps customers coming back, just saying.

22.description: Food is good. However if you order for delivery expect a long wait. I'm talking like over an hour and a half wait when you live only a mile away. I like the stuffed pizza and hot wings.

15.description: Oh yah, best meal of my ten day business trip.  I was by myself so I had the Baby Stuffed with sausage.  Very good.  I'll be back if I ever need to spend to night near Midway again.

57.description: I do not relish Chicago pizza as a whole.  Ninety percent of the pizza I eat is from Vito and Nicks,  the other ten percent comes from La Madia,  Spacca Napoli,  or similar places.  I am a snob,  too much of any ingredient and I am whining like a bitch.  I want the crust,  sauce,  and toppings to create one harmonious flavor profile.  I expect the texture to be complimentary to the pie,  a soft chewy dough will have enough  flavor to penetrate the dough,  and a crispy  "00" dough must have enough sauce and fat to dissolve this crust in your mouth,  you shouldn't have to guzzle half a bottle of Old Style to get the pie down.As I was reluctantly dragged into Ciprianis,  I noticed four "vice dicks"  they looked comfortable and were watching one of the many Sunday cop dramas on the boob tube.  Funny when I see cops eating in a restaurant,  there is a myth that this implies good food.  I believe it implies the best option within 4 blocks.  Sitting next to cops makes me feel uncomfortable,  so I usually have mixed feelings.  The waitress who took our order did not recognize me from late night WI bowling at a local watering hole,  I tend to have this kind of impact on people.  Ordering a medium thin crust with sausage and shrooms, (fresh shrooms we were told)  Two salads and a liter of RC.  The salads came quickly,  iceberg with a fair amount of real olives,  cukes,  tomato,  onion,  carrots and peperoncini.  Nothing mind blowing but much better than most salads in the neighborhood.The pizza came out quickly,  the crust looked odd,  I made Lurch sounds from the back of my throat,  the crust looked like it had been frozen,  pre-formed.  Looking over my shoulder it was plain as day that there was pizza makers tossing dough 15 feet away,  just beyond what was now six dicks.  The pie had a nice look to it,  well browned,  but not burnt,  evenly placed ingredients that were easily recognizable through the melted cheese.  The flavor,  excellent,  a strange pastry like crust,  I have had these before but always chalky,  crumbly,  and flavorless.  I took a couple of bites,  it was OK,  then as I ate the second piece,  I realized how much I was enjoying this pizza.  This crust to the eye looked thicker than I would like,  but it was flaky,  and airy like a pastry,  almost a pizza tart.  The sauce light,  tomatoey,  with a hint of herbs.  The sausage was rich,  moist,  the perfect size that doesn't dominate any mouthfuls.  Dare I  say this sausage was as good as I have had on a pizza.  The mushrooms still retained their flavor and a bit of texture.Table service was efficient but sparse,  it is a small dining room only six tables,  I imagine this place is geared for delivery.I saw a couple of stuffed pizzas,  that is what the Cops were digging into,  they looked good,  I admit I am not a fan in general.  As I polished off my final piece of pizza,  I turned and looked at Chicago's finest,  some had been there an hour,  watching actors play them on the TV.  One of the officers spoke up,  "yeah,  thats right carry your gun way out in front of you so someone can just take it outa your hands."  A communal chuckle followed as I carried my leftovers out into the cold.

20.description: I was one of there first customers.You really can't go wrong the service is great!They put on fresh ingredients and make your pizza the way pizza should be Chicago way!Highly recommended.Prices are very reasonable.Try the cipriani special! 5+stars

36.description: Honestly, this is the best pizza place I have ever ordered from. I have never had the stuffed crust, but I have had numerous thin crust pizzas here.  I absolutely love their pizzas and if you order a large pizza for pick up you get a free drink and you can ask for Parmesan cheese on side. They are not cheap with their ingredients there's never too little or never too much I really suggest you eat at this place! If you're a  pizza lover like me you will not regret it!!  By the way, you know those pizzas that make you feel sick after you eat them? Well this place does not serve pizzas like that! Dig in!

14.description: Great pizza and Italian ice. Can't beat the prices. May get a little busy during the weekends but keep calling. Definitely the new go to with Danny's pizza being out of operation.

12.description: I like shopping here because it's just down the street. The prices are good, and the stockers and facers have always been nothing but friendly. I wish the aisles were a little wider, and the end caps usually stick out too far so you can't see someone coming around until you just about hit their cart. The meat selection is okay, but the butcher counter is much better in terms of quality and price. The produce is just "meh".

3.description: I have a weird love-hate relationship with this place. On the plus side--they have a great selection of food items you wouldn't find at a Jewel or other food stores. The neighborhood is kind of mixed, yet they have great Italian foods, pastas, sauces, etc. A decent Mexican selection without going overboard. A really huge selection of stuff in the deli. And odd stuff like 5 lb. bags of mozzarella, and already made dough for pizza, a mix for making potato dumplings...The sale prices are really great, although they are oddly out of a lot of the things the day after a sale begins. That's kind of bullshit. The stuff that's not on sale is crazy expensive. Avoid any paper goods, cleaning solutions and pet food here. They are Beverly Hills priced. I guess they have to make up the difference somewhere. Now for the bad stuff....EVERYONE in the parking lot is either blind, zombies, senile, or stupid. No one here knows how to drive, or knows what one way is. Then in the store, they are completely oblivious to everyone. They don't move, block aisles(which is EASY to do), and even bump their carts into you. They are of carnival-folk-like hygiene and demeanor. I haven't noticed sanitation, probably because I didn't WANT to notice. I'm sure their deli has made many sick. Not so much because of bad meat, but the fact that they don't seem to wipe the slicers during use. Maybe just at the end of the day? I've never had a problem with the cashiers. They always say hi and are always very nice. And I'm not that young or good looking, so I don't know why they do. Fresh bakery too , which is awesome. Not many left in the hood, unless the just sell sweet Hispanic stuff. Go in the morning and get a loaf of bread still warm and soft and then try NOT to eat any on the way home. I think this place is worth at least one visit and take it from there.

1.description: This place deserves no stars at all, The owner is a complete jerk following people around as if your a thief. The deli meat is always rotting in less then 3 days in my refrigerator .The meat,poultry,and produce spoils rapidly. I know a few of the employees that are in the deli and stocking department and they have told me the reason why the food spoils is because it is outdated. They said that the owner makes them erase the original expiration date with rubbing alcohol and extend the date so that it fools the customers to think they are fresh products. i know its hard to believe but i truly think that its true. Why would more then 3 employees tell me the same story and why would the meat,poultry,and deli products spoil so fast. I have experienced buying hamburger meat,bacon,deli meat,pork ribs and had to return it the same day because of a foul rotten odor. My suggestion is if you shop here eat it that very same day or freeze it immediately.

2.description: I only go to FairShare for emergency items like milk, bread, eggs, sugar, oil etc... and I live 1/2 a block away (sad right). The produce and fruit isn't always fresh and the meat looks gross. Last time I bought chicken breast they smelled rotten. It was yelling Salmonella! I returned the smelly chicken got my money back. Haven't bought any meat from FairShare in years! Check expiration dates since FairShare is the King of selling expired food. Store can use a facelift and some upgrades. Cashiers are friendly. Store does have a parking lot.

9.description: Not a very good store I have been there a bunch of times because there's nothing else around that area.. And let me advise the produce looks the opposite of what you would expect

10.description: I shop here because it is close to home. An independent grocer with good selections and prices. My experiences at checkout have been positive, with the cashiers reasonably pleasant.

4.description: I will never buy produce at this place, or lunch meat. The people who shop here at weird, the people in this neighborhood are weird, trashy. The produce is rotten, the meat is not great either. I only buy the basics if i have to; they don't have a great bakery selection and the aisles are rather small and crowded. They're usually out of stuff that's on sale.

6.description: Great prices here but I wouldn't buy the bread or deli here mainly because of sanitary reasons. This place is nice except the hidden bathroom upstairs and sometimes there's mice running around. Also this place has been closed temporarily a few times because of failed health inspections.

15.description: They are convenient and they have an excellent delivery service.  In the past I had used this store for items which, in my opinion, have a fast turn over.  Never for their produce which looks like something salvaged from "second harvest".  I do not purchase their meat or poultry either which usually has a bad smell.   Then I started paying attention to expiration dates.  One day I returned to the service desk with items which were up to over 6 months past the date on the item.  These items included canned tomatoes, cream cheese and refrigerated rolls.  I also had to return the same damaged can of coffee to the service desk 5 different times.   I am amused by their method of stocking their shelves.  One item is placed in front and remainder is left empty.  I still purchase soda, chips, cleaning supplies and use their delivery service.  Should I purchase anything else I pay very close attention to the expiration date.   Although they have a service whereby you call in your order and they will deliver it I would rather use Peapod.

0.description: I usually come to Fair Share for meat, the deli, and regular items. The atmosphere is your regular grocery store. It's nothing different. The only thing different is that the aisles are small and crowded. It can be hard to pick what you want if the aisle is crowded. The selections for the bakery, deli, and the meat sections are just okay. It's not a huge selection of food. The meat tastes good, but it doesn't really have anything special about it. The cheese is pretty good. It tastes fresh. You should check out the ham and turkey in the deli. They are great for sandwiches. The service is good. The staff are friendly to me. They are helpful if you don't know the place well enough.All in all, pretty good service, okay selections for food, but the aisles are crowded and the atmosphere is average. I'll be back here though.

5.description: Took my mom shopping here today  End of aisles are ridiculous narrow...one person wide.  Some prices also ridiculous, like a jar of Miracle Whip for $8.  Some sale prices were pretty good; woman who checked us out was friendly.  Good if you don't want to drive too far or hike around a Walmart  to get some groceries.

13.description: Great prices, but the cashiers never greet the customers.  I have mentioned this to the people at the service counter, but it didn't seem to help.  They don't make eye contact with you until you pay.

11.description: Bought meat and fish from here that was spoiled . Their produce is usually rotten. The girls in the deli do not know how to slice, because one side of a slice is too thick and the other side is too thin. Last time I was there, there was flies flying around.

8.description: I agree with Katie! I just came from the store and the cashier didn't say two words to me. I actually had to say hi to her. Then I got to thinking - this has happened to me before. Completely rude. I immediately thought "I have to yelp this shit!"This store will do if you run out of something and need to run in and pick it up. I certainly wouldn't shop here for all of my weekly groceries. The produce is kind of shady and the meat always looks kind of fatty and slightly gross.The parking lot sucks if it's crowded and people like to park horizontally in the front near the store, which makes navigating even worse. The isles are probably half as wide as a normal grocery store. So if you're claustrophobic (or even if you're not) move on to another store.

14.description: A supermarket with decent produce & meat sections.

7.description: This store has value. Gnocchi for a $1 (Jewel $2.99), bulk spices, and other items that the chain stores rip the consumer off with. They have a great meat section and on site butchers. People that shop here know how to cook and save. Nice deli area that has all the usual treats. It gets busy and the aisles are a bit cramped. The old ladies that shop are strategically placed throughout the store to make you shop here longer than intended...so beware!

3.description: Ordered a calzone while visiting my mom; very tasty and not too expensive.  The garlic bread, on the other hand, was made with thin Italian bread and almost dried out.

1.description: I know they have better food here, but last night was awful. I ordered the breaded steak and wanted to give their buffalo wings a try. Never had neither. Such a disappointment. The breaded steak was like rubber, also the piece of steak they used was as thin as a slice of beef for a beef sandwich. The breading was massive and it was such a let down. Don't order the breaded steak. The buffalo wings, I ordered them spicy. They came bone dry. It's as if they took them out of the SAMs club bag and cooked them for you. Also they are $13.65 for a dozen. I know that's a lot for wings but I was expecting some thing special. What a waste. I threw them out after 2. They tasted awful. No sauce on them at all. Don't order the buffalo wings....All together if you check my reviews I love the small neighborhood spots but tonight just was a terrible selection on my part and I felt the need to warn people about these two selections. My job of sharing the information to you has come to an end, YELP ON my brothers and sisters.

2.description: Don't do the Buffalo Wings......horrible.Pizza is ok......nothing to write home about.Owner is obnoxious......yells at staff...in front of customers

9.description: Good pizza because of the fresh ingredients but nothing special nothing signature about it

10.description: Okay I guess tasted better pizza, but its convenient and not pricey at all. The cheese in my opinion tastes rubbery.

4.description: Pizza is good, sauce is perfect.  All the food here is pretty good. If you want a sweet tasting sauce Lena's sauce on the pizza isn't sweet. I personally do not like sweet pizza sauce so Lena's is my go to place around my house

6.description: This is less than a review about how they are and more about how they WERE. When the original owner had the place, it was a pretty good pizza. Now, even though I believe the owner is a long time worker at Lena's, it isn't the same. Things have slowly changed over the years. The few times I went in for slices, they weren't too good. They re-heat them in their oven and it dries the slices out. They ought to get a decent warmer like Positano's. It's too bad. The guys there are friendly, but this isn't about personality.

12.description: Great neighborhood place.  Hot pizza delivered quick.  A true Chicago pizza!

5.description: Delivery time was great. Delivery man couldn't be nicer. My problem was besides a bland taste the pizza stuck to the bottom. Not cool. I will give them another chance to win me back.

13.description: The pizza here is good.  Their thin crust can be a bit on the bready side at times, but it's an overall good pie.  The service is friendly and prompt for pick-ups and I have always gotten a good, hot pizza which is the one that I ordered and ready when they say it will be.  If all you want is a slice, they are happy to warm one up to fresh baked goodness in minutes.  As far as pizza goes, I order from here often.

11.description: I tried their pizza by the slice and was just "ok" it was pepperoni. The pepperoni was kinda cheap. The owner is really nice and they have really good Italian lemonade. So far thats all I tried. I noticed another joint across the street called Ciprianis and the reviews here say its pretty darn good. So far I tried their slice (sausage) and it was pretty decent. I hear their stuffed is close to Giordanos greatness so I will be ordering tonight to see. The review will be under Ciprianis in a few days.

8.description: Pizza wasn't that bad. I mean, the cheese tasted like rubber. Everything fell apart when we cut it. Un edible. Not very bad but clean restaurant. Except when they leave they're door open. Bugs crawling everywhere. :( just close the door!

0.description: This place is really close to my house.Slices = convenient.Pizza = good. For some reason, its not as good as the slices.Pasta = very good.Other food my husband and I have tried = very good.

7.description: The boyfriend & I wanted good, inexpensive non-gourmet pizza that wasn't too far away from home.  Giodano's is pricy & takes forever to deliver (yet they are closest to us) but we came across Lena's on one of our walks.  It smelled so good that we remembered the name of the place!  The following day, we decided to order.  We got our delivery a few minutes earlier than quoted, the pizza was pretty loaded & fresh.  The boyfriend loved their fresh-tasting sauce & the price was affordable.  It was a bit greasy but given all the problems we've come across with cheaper pizzas, this was a minor issue.  We plan on ordering them again & ordering more items to see if they are worth upgrading.

0.description: A good old fashioned haircut by Len. Old-school, no sports theme or cute stylists. Just ol' Len and a good haircut. Open 6-2, Tue-Sat, so don't go late! Walking distance from Midway Hotel Center.

3.description: An excellent Irish sausage shop conveniently located just a few blocks off the Midway station on the Orange line.  They have a great deli counter filled with rashers, black and white pudding, Irish sausages, and other delicious meats.  Winston's also stocks the usual Irish grocery fare and a delicious variety of soda bread.  I'm also happy to note that the service is friendly and knowledgeable.  My only regret is that the shop isn't in my neighborhood.If you've been having trouble finding good black and white pudding in Chicago, go to Winston's!  It's well worth the trip to the end of the Orange line.

1.description: CASH ONLY. (Or a check, for those like me who still live in the dark ages). But worth every penny. You know how I feel about breakfast. And my Irish-ness. And my love of Irish breakfast, for sure. I used to obsess over finding the best Irish breakfast in town...until I started making my own.The BF's fam is from Ireland. Legit, his parents grew up there. When they get Irish sausages, they always come from Winston's. And from there, the Irish fry was easy peasy. These puppies freeze well, and defrost just as easily. Black pudding, white pudding, and bangers. All my favorite treats. The shop is small, warehouse-y and everything I want in meat shopping. The prices can't be beat: I spent $30 for 5 packages of sausage, a package of Irish bacon, and a loaf of Irish soda bread. THE BEST.

2.description: I am as Irish as Irish gets - both of the parents are from western Eire. Most will say they will pass on one category of Ireland - the food.I say, "bunk".Granted, Irish cuisine is a little behind-the-curve of neighbors like Paris, Alsace or New York City. I will say this, however - Irish breakfasts (also called "fry-ups") are the stuff of legend. Eggs. Rashers (Irish bacon) Sassiges. Black or white puddin' over dere. Soda breads. Beans, toast, fried tomatoes and strong, strong black "tay". This isn't a daily breakfast per se - it a once or twice a month treat that keeps you under the spell of "a good feed" for most of the day. If you want the tools for enjoying the Irish breakfast - head to Winston's Sausage. This next-door neighbor to Midway Airport is a warehouse to a Winston's restaurant, which is in the SW burbs. The fresh stuff is made here, along the traditional Irish staples,from Weetabix to Cadbury Crunchies. What you can't miss are the Irish sausages.These badboys are 10 to a pound, finely ground with a super-smooth texture. They can work with any breakfast - but my secret is to have them on the grill. They take to grilling like a fish to water. I'm glad that I have a pound of them defrosting in the fridge for my first cookout of 2010.Winston's not the prettiest shop. It's a warehouse, for good Jaysus. Who cares as long as the meats are fresh. It isn't the most trendy Whole Foods in the world - or else these bangers would cost $10 a pound rather than $4.99. Wiston's Sausages IS the best Irish food shop in the city. No plastic. Bring your greenbacks.

5.description: It is hard to find good sausage rolls and meat pies in this country except at a bagpipe competition and I am not a fan of the bagpipes. Fortunately the pies and the rolls freeze well so when I go here I stock up. Since they are the only game in town they could get away with charging more and I would pay for it. I don't think the selection is good. I wish they had some soda pop selections such as Iron Bru and/or baked goods like trifle available. Also the store is seriously not attractively laid out. I am appreciative of the availability of what they offer. Bring cash no credit cards accepted.

0.description: First time here, Sausage was fresh and delicious! Picked up 3 lbs, cooked one and froze the other two. Definitely will be going back for some White and Black pudding.

4.description: We live in Arizona & sure miss our scottish pies & sausages also the Irish ones & when we do get to Chicago it has to be in winter it is too exp for shippingIs there any thing you can suggest please i am on my last package of sausages to day

0.description: This place has everything. It can be a bit costly over a typical grocery store but you're in and out and home before you'd find a parking spot at the grocery store. Liquor, soft drinks, ice, chips, matches, caned goods, frozen dinners, ice cream, milk, eggs, bread, candy.... they have pretty much everything. The owner is fairly nice. He knows most regulars by name and watches new customers like a hawk to prevent theft. It could be a bit cleaner and prices better on some things like milk or beer but a solid place.

1.description: Went here with reservations for Thanksgiving with the family.Might as well have gone to a soup kitchen for the homeless - and that may have been better.Upon entering, a musty smell hits your nose.  We were seated and the place was nearly empty.  We had two people taking care of our table, one spoke a little English but only knew Spanish, and the other only spoke Polish and knew very little english.  lucky my Dad spoke fluent Polish so we was able to communicate our needs.  I must note that the gentleman helping out at our table had a fully visible gash on his outer hand with dried blood all over it.  No bandage.  It was DISGUSTING.Some of my relatives were brave enough to try and order drinks.  My Aunt tried to order wine, but they didn't know what a white wine was or a red etc.  They managed to figure out after much commotion that they has "Pink Zinfandel" and "Pink Moscato" and 2 margarita options - "Strawberry or Mango" on the rocks.The wines were mixed up upon delivery and they were unhappy.  My other Aunt ordered a Strawberry Margarita.  It looked weird, and heavy on the bottom.  It looked like Strawberry jam caked up on the bottom and light red on the top.  Supposedly it tasted like pure tequila with strawberry jam mixed in, which settled on the bottom.  No good!The food:  Boxed mashed potatoes, the stuffed cabbage meat inside tasted REALLY FUNKY (took one bite - ABORT!) - the pierogies stuffed with meat tasted weird, the sliced ham tasted processed and plasticy.  Nothing was good.  As I was going to get the food, a woman is wiping down in between the food trays sitting inside the buffet "scoop yourself" areas with what looked like a used kinda dirty rag.  I was just disgusted with the entire experience.  There was also no handicapped parking spots in the lot, and I heard someone yelling for help in the woman's bathroom - another woman came out and said that someone was stuck and needed help because there's no safety rails or anything to cater to people that are disabled.  There were more than a few people dining here in wheel chairs.The bill for 7 people + 4 drinks was $185 and some change.  This place needs to be SHUT DOWN.

9.description: I went there for a breakfast few days ago and good was ridiculous.. Nothing was good , I never gonna come back there..

23.description: This place is awesome. i love polish food and i can never find  a polish buffet... and when i found this place, i was like omg! finally! from the outside it looks all old and crummy like its been there for like a million years in an old part of Chicago, but rlly, its nice! they have a section for smoking and nonsmoking, so thats good. crystal chandliers, and food!!!!!!soup, sauerkraut, pierogis, ham, beef, cod,veggies, cantoulope, watermelon, different colored jello, ice-cream, cakes, stuffed cabbage, and more!!!!!!!! BTW.... blueberry pierogis... YUMMMMMMM! try em! theyre AMAZING! NOT KIDDING! and also... the apple crepes! AMAZING!

12.description: This place is not the same as when I lived in the neighborhood 15 years ago.  Not paying too much attention to the dingy looking old decor, my family and I settled in for a Sunday buffet. Some of the food looked like it was sitting there for a while and not everything was available.  Besides the golabki (stuffed cabbage) and the chicken, (which are fantastic), I thought everything else was really mediocre at its best.  I should've known that this was probably not the best place to eat when very few cars were in the parking lot at 1 p.m. on a Sunday afternoon.  I wouldn't have minded paying $100 for 5 people and a small child, but the food was not that great.    One positive was the owner's daughter, our host, whom was very accommodating.  I surely hope they get this place running back up to par as they were really great years ago.

21.description: This is a polish american buffet that I especially enjoy during lunch. The facility is quite big and I believe that they host parties etc. as well as the lunch and dinner dining room menu. The food is very good. The menu includes all of the usual polish specialties as well as fried chicken and a fair salad bar. The prices are good and the staff is friendly.

16.description: The buffet has been excellent both times I have been there. Soups hot and delicious, not over-salted. Lots of vegetables/prepared salads (with typical mayonnaise dressings or oil. Beets, Bean Salad Cucumber salad (Miseria - Spelling?), etc. The buffet selection is a little limited compared to Jolly Inn or especially compared to Red Apple, however, the selections on the buffet are delicious. They had a dish of boiled, peeled potatoes fried in butter with dill and red & green pepper garnish. It tasted exactly like my Babcia (wearing a babushka) makes it!  Sauerkraut (Deutsch spelling) was not too overpowering but a delicious flavoring. Roast beef, meatballs, kielbasa, chicken kiev are all standard fare and New Warsaw does these fine. The desserts selection is a little scant but you usually can't get everything 100%. I opted for a Jello cube and a hot apple pancake from the buffet line. The servers were extremely polite. They were relatively attentive. Only 2 servers were expected to cover at least 12 occupied tables. They seates us on the far end and we got a view of the entire restaurant.I was sitting in the middle. I felt bad because Fr. Ralph sat on the end of the table and he kept getting up when the bishop and I stood up to get more food. I went around the other side of the table and that lying nun told everyone at the table (in a loud voice) that I kicked her as I went in back of her chair. Why would I kick a nun? Not me. May the lying nun go far away, perhaps to Antarctica.Summer 201 when my Aunt and cousins (Italians) were in town we went there. They had never been to a Polish smorgasbord. They found quite a bit of humor in the sign at the front door requesting that diners limit their eating time to 1.5 hours! Hilarious!

17.description: I feel horrible only giving this place 2 stars, as it seems like a struggling restaurant who have had to cut back to avoid going out of business.The building itself is a bit strange, and seems like it may have once been a funeral parlour before it was converted to a restaurant. Creepy.My wife and I walked in to a huge dining area, deserted aside from one other table, and no wait staff. After a few minutes of standing, we took our own seats, and after a few more minutes of waiting, we went to the buffet to grab our food. While we were returning to out table, the waitress finally appeared and took our drink order.The buffet itself is tiny compared to other chicago polish buffets: One small row of trays, some, filled with your standard polish fare. The best thing I tasted there was the soup. the rest was overbuttery, and fairly boring. The potato pancakes, for one, were so overbuttered that if you cut into them with your fork, a look of butter would coalesce on top. I guess for some people, this would be a benefit, but for someone with a bad gall bladder, it lead to a few hours of intense pain later that night :(I hate to give any polish buffet a bad review, because I love polish food and I love buffets. I also love underdogs, and would love to see this place come back from the brink and really start doing things better, but I fear it may be too late :(

10.description: Went here on a Saturday night to try it out. I should have known that this place was not good based in the lack of cars in the parking lot. We went it to find out that dinner was a buffet. Not a bad thing until we saw the buffet. Lack of quality food and lack of choices. It really was disgusting and is probably why nobody was here. What a disappointment. I really wanted to like this place and am surprised that it stays open. We ended up going to a place at 79th and Cicero which was very good and was crowded.

5.description: Aye!!!!Gads.  I shoulda known better, really, I shoulda.  When it's dinner time and there are three cars in the parking lot you have to ask the question.  When you walk in and it smells like an OLD building and dusty drywall, you should also take note.  But man, there were GOOD reviews on this place, so maybe the food is outta sight.Yes, it's outta sight... there's none of it.  In the steam table buffet, there were scant amounts of food, the soup was nearly drained, and it all just looked tired, just plain worn out.  And this was at 6p.  I cannot imagine how bad it looked at 8p.So, what I had was very average.  The meatballs with gravy were likely the best.  The mashed potatoes were obviously out of a box.  The cabbage soup was so mushy, it was almost embarrassing.  There were only 3 dumpings in the tray, and they seemed good, but very small.Even with no business, I had trouble getting my bill from the staff.  I feel bad leaving a bad review like this, but this place is awful.

11.description: I'm kind of surprised at all the negative reviews. The food is good. The one complaint I have is that it's too quiet. You have to have some music playing in the background. I approve.

22.description: I feel horrible only giving this place 2 stars, as it seems like a struggling restaurant who have had to cut back to avoid going out of business.The building itself is a bit strange, and seems like it may have once been a funeral parlour before it was converted to a restaurant. Creepy.My wife and I walked in to a huge dining area, deserted aside from one other table, and no wait staff. After a few minutes of standing, we took our own seats, and after a few more minutes of waiting, we went to the buffet to grab our food. While we were returning to out table, the waitress finally appeared and took our drink order.The buffet itself is tiny compared to other chicago polish buffets: One small row of trays, some, filled with your standard polish fare. The best thing I tasted there was the soup. the rest was overbuttery, and fairly boring. The potato pancakes, for one, were so overbuttered that if you cut into them with your fork, a look of butter would coalesce on top. I guess for some people, this would be a benefit, but for someone with a bad gall bladder, it lead to a few hours of intense pain later that night :(I hate to give any polish buffet a bad review, because I love polish food and I love buffets. I also love underdogs, and would love to see this place come back from the brink and really start doing things better, but I fear it may be too late :(

0.description: I've been here for a long time. It's an all you can eat Polish buffet. The service is pretty good. The servers are quick with what I need. The staff are also nice and friendly to me. The food is really good. I prefer the potato pancakes! I also prefer the sausage. Great taste of food! All in all, good buffet place. I will be back.

20.description: This is where you go when you are broke and hungry.Skip breakfast come for lunch and you won't be hungry at dinner time.For around $6 you can eat all the Kielbasa,Pierogies, and other polish cuisine  you want.You have to try the Apple Pancakes they are awesome.DO NOT order a drink though $7.50 for a rum and coke WTF?In a neighborhood where it should not cost more than $3.That's more than your meal.

19.description: Great Polish food in a very chill and calm atmosphere.Drinks are poured strong and the food is very good. Great place for accommodating large groups. Other reviews have stated that the waitstaff was rarely seen, this wasn't the case during my experience but it's also a buffet so there is no need for traditional service, right? I will definitely be heading back here when in the area.

2.description: "Let's do the time warp again."  Seriously this place has not changed one iota since I first came here as a kid back in the 80s.  If you are looking for this place, and are unfamiliar with the area, look for the building that suspiciously looks like an outdated funeral parlor.  The interior has a faint, musty, grandma's basement kind of smell to it, not the best for first impressions.  Please, do no let that deter you from enjoying the Polish fare here, offered up in a copious buffet.        If you come here with intentions of eating healthy, just go somewhere else.  Let the rest of us indulge in cholesterol-laden delicacies.  Yes, they have the basics (read: bare bones) to make a simple salad, but that is not what you came here for, is it?  The hot buffet is the highlight.  Even though there was only one other table occupied, the food was surprisingly fresh.  (You know there are a couple of Bushas in the kitchen preparing these masterpieces.) Blintzes stuffed with sweet cream filling, stuffed cabbage rolls, cheese, kraut, and meat perogi (that rival my own grandma's), sauerkraut, potato dumplings, fresh Polish sausage, and plenty of other Polish standards.  Also, be sure to try the best chicken noodle soup on this earth, located next to the cold bar.  As for the desert selection, skip it.  Nothing to see here: mediocre Kolachky, dried out cakes, soupy rice pudding, and a non-working soft-serve machine.

18.description: I have dined here a few times. Always a good selection of Polish dishes. Never a bad meal here.

13.description: This is where you go when you are broke and hungry.Skip breakfast come for lunch and you won't be hungry at dinner time.For around $6 you can eat all the Kielbasa,Pierogies, and other polish cuisine  you want.You have to try the Apple Pancakes they are awesome.DO NOT order a drink though $7.50 for a rum and coke WTF?In a neighborhood where it should not cost more than $3.That's more than your meal.

4.description: The quality of food has gone downhill.  My family & I popped in on a Sunday morning before church to delight in their reasonably priced breakfast especially the fresh potato pancakes.  We were sadly dissappointed since it seemed as though our potato pancakes tasted like re-heated leftovers.  They would of gotten one star but service is always good.  We unfortuantely won't be coming back here.

24.description: Free Tip:Don't eat for six days before coming here. Why? It's an all-you-can-eater. With homemade Polish food. And soup. The place may look old, but I call it homely. The place may smell like an old Polish lady in front of you at the local grocery store, but I call it great. There may be enough old people here that you may think a bingo game is happening, and I say damn. Really, that's the only down side to this, the old people who clog up the area where you get your food. They devoured the fresh pot of dumplings as I was fifth in line. FIFTH! fresh pot of dumplings gone. Man, those geezers know how to chow. Lunch was 7.50 per person, which really ain't bad. They had the typical Polish food and beet soup (I loathe beet soup). Hell, you swing by later you can see the Polish band they sometimes have, play in their Polish dress. Another great thing about this place, come here early enough, be nice to the waitstaff and they won't push you out the door. So you have a full two and a half hour gorge-a-thon. Just tip them well....and don't push the oldies outta the way.

6.description: I caught this place at noon on a Sunday, when they were just ending breakfast and starting the dinner cycle, so everything was fresh and plentiful. The old steamtable in the middle of the dining room held pork ribs (boiled, with a little BBQ sauce brushed on top), breaded chicken thighs and drumsticks, pork stew/"goulash," breaded boneless pork chop, sliced pork loin in gravy, boiled potatoes with parsley, meatballs in a creamy dill sauce, stuffed cabbage, green beans, blintzes, saurkraut, kielbasa, dumplings, and 3 kinds of pierogis.  Plus there was another large bar with a bunch of prepared cold salads. Oh, and two soups, chicken noodle and barley. And pieces of ham and beef under foil on a carving station (which I didn't try because they looked a little dry).The barley soup was extraordinary -- creamy, deeply flavored, and comforting -- a masterful rendition, obviously made from scratch, of a classic Polish American specialty. It had bits of dried mushroom, diced potato, bay leaf, allspice, finely shredded carrot, likely a little sour cream.  It was just a little too salty.  The breaded chicken pieces were really flavorful and good, the way chicken SHOULD taste, as were the plump pierogi filled with spiced ground meat.  Everything else was typical of places like Sawa's or Bobak's (or the late, lamented Tatra Inn on Pulaski) -- somewhat heavy, much of it sitting in too much butter/ oil -- but still, you got the impression it was all prepared with care and a deep sense of Polish American tradition. More importantly, everything I sampled was tasty. There was no pizza, mac and cheese, or ersatz Mexican like you find on the local Chinese buffet troughs; no awkward concessions to the changing neighborhood (Bobak's is now making chorizo).  I'm sure everyone in the kitchen is Polish, and it's Polish food you come here to eat. I had been wary of trying this place based on the earlier reviews.  Don't know if it would be as good on weekdays or off hours. It's one of those places that's rapidly becoming a little corner of the world that time forgot.  The decor is old fashioned, and the plates are this old Homer Laughlin variety -- commercial-heavy, off white, with a curvy gold pattern around the rim; check the photo I've posted -- that it seems like every "nice" restaurant on the South Side and south burbs had back in the 70s.  The clientele (and there wasn't much business for the large dining room; three or four tables) is older.  I suspect a lot of bachelors and widowers eat here.  There was, though, a larger gathering in the adjacent private room -- middle-aged and elderly, white haired Polish folks, the older men wearing what looked like suits and polyester ties they had purchased at the Ford City J.C. Penney back in 1979 but which they still wore with care and pride.  One old rooster was sporting what was apparently an old Polish military uniform.Sunday Buffet was $13.  Surprisingly, I found a $5 check-in offer on Foursquare for using AMEX.  I couldn't have imagined anyone at this place would know about Foursquare, and I had even wondered if they took credit cards. But I have to say, this was a delicious and satisfying (and, if you grew up in this area, nostalgic) meal. The place may look a little tired, but the food didn't reflect that.  You come here if you want authentic, stick-to-your-ribs, east European home cooking of the kind it's increasingly difficult to find.

15.description: For what it is, it works. This is a place to come for a CHEAP, Polish buffet. The hot items are really tasty. Fried chicken floating in grease and butter, pierogis floating in grease and butter, all manner of fried potato things (pancakes, dumplings), mashed potatoes, gravy with chicken gizzards floating in it, some sort of beef in a thick brown gravy, and of course a salad bar and two soups of the day. All of the above was good. The desert bar on the other hand, not so good. They had assorted jello and cookies, and they also had some nondescript cake type things. I opted for the cake type things and within a moment of biting into them, could tell that they had been sitting in a freezer somewhere for way too long and had recently been thawed out (or possibly, re-thawed). I realize for the $5 or $6 it cost for the buffet, I might be asking a little much in my request that the desert not taste freezer-burned beyond all recognition, but there you have it.The atmosphere is no-nonsense, utilitarian, with a smattering of polish posters, dolls, and other knickknacks throughout the place, and the service is straight out of the old country.

7.description: We just finish our breakfast here . Everything was really good. Apple pancakes are delicious, the best I ever ate. Everything was fresh and even if for a couple minutes some trays were empty , they were making everything instantly.

8.description: On Mother's Day we went there and it was absolutely ridiculous $17 per person horrible service. After 15 min. I had to ask the waitress for something to drink really? For the price they charged there was no special selection and I had breaded chicken that was absolutely horrible. I will never put my foot in that door again it's  really sad that u can find good polish food anymore or service.

3.description: Really didn't care too much for New Warsaw restaurant.Wasn't any better than the last time I was here.Choices are very limited.And the choices they do have aren't really all that good.I can think of 1,000 other places to have lunch at rather than here.I don't like writing bad reviews but sometimes I HAVE TO.Only way I'll come back is if I forget how much I didn't like it and happen to pop in say 5 YEARS FROM NOW.Yeah,disliked it THAT MUCH.

14.description: Very nice restaurant inside and out. It's 6:00PM, prime dinner time on a saturday night and there is only one table occupied. Very strange. Also was a man just slouched in a chair at the table closest to the door. He did not say anything or even offer a greeting. After sitting down, figured out he was not a customer. Still not sure what he was other than a slob.Stay to eat anyway as the main reason I'm here is to try Polish food. What better way than a buffet right? Well, if it were busy....yes. I forgot because of my hunger that when a buffet restaurant is not busy, the food is not fresh. The soup was good though....and piping hot. They have 2 soups to choose from and about 15-20 dishes...different pierogis and various meats. All were not fresh and nothing came out while I was there. Even the waitress was hardly to be seen. The food might have been really good if it were hot and fresh....I'll never know as I will not be back.

12.description: With the advent of 'trendy dive bars', it's really nice to come to a place that was, is, and always WILL be a great dive. Their selections are great. Nothing that you're gonna hold your pinkie up while drinking, but enough stuff so that even if you're not a Miller Lite fan, you'll have options. Nothing too highbrow, but you also won't see hipsters slinging back PBR's. As said before, it's usually a crew of locals here, and most of them are airline employees and police. Careful- YOU WILL MAKE FRIENDS. Douchebaggery is absolutely NOT tolerated here, and will be handled promptly.Grab a drink and meet some folks. Talk to the bartenders, they're all top-notch folks. And if you get too schmammernated there will probably be someone to give you a ride if you live nearby.

3.description: The atmosphere was reminiscent of somewhere I had spent years learning each customer and employee. However, I've only been here one time. This was immediately the most welcoming establishment I have ever been to in my life. Danny was attentive and friendly. I will undoubtedly come here again just for the atmosphere. Thanks for the experience!

1.description: Better bring a coat in the winter time....temp is set for just the guys and fat ass women

2.description: Best Damn bar ever great service neighborhood bar I suggest every one go here then get food at menolos tamales

9.description: best bar near the airport. open until 2 am and an inviting and  friendly staff. cheap drink. 3.50 Jameson shots, 3 dollar micro brews. couldn't be better for the layover from hell

10.description: Mr. Andy thank you for having such a wonderful bar!!!!! Came into town & my friends told me Mr. C's is the best dive in bar in the south side! I agree!!!! Prices are on point! I can't wait to be back and hit up Mr. C's. Btw try Andy's apple pie shot! It's so delicious!

4.description: The guy who owns this place, Andy, is a great character. He takes a huge amount of pride in this place and taking care of the customers. It's old, it's a dive, and it's got great drink prices. The people are usually talkative and there is often a good mix of locals and airline employees. You be surprised the brain power in this place and sometimes you end up in a great conversation about distant travels or local politics. It's always a great time.There are photos of yesteryear and the airplanes and pilots that frequented Midway back when it was the busiest airport in the world. You get a history lesson, a good time, and cheap drinks all in one. A good place to hang out for a while. Worth at least one visit.

6.description: If you're into a super authentic and fun Chicago experience, this is your place. Found this amazing hole in the wall after a guy at the airport recommended "Chilis or Applebee's"(HAHA) to watch our big game after getting into Midway. Yeah Right. So happy Yelp led us here! Amazing atmosphere, wonderful local people, cheap but delicious drinks and the owner behind the bar telling amazing life stories. Plus TONS of huge TVs we watched the Game on! Such a great experience. Couldn't be more happy. tip: Try his Apple Pie shot.

0.description: Best little hole-in-the-wall around Midway! They have cheap drinks that are good. It's a small place, not a lot of seats and no kitchen but they let you bring food inside. It's all about the drinks, music (provided by a electronic jukebox) and good company and conversation.

5.description: What a trendy little dive back... reminds me of the dives I love so much back home in Baltimore, hon! I enjoyed the service, the drinks and the overall vibe. I frequent into Chicago for business and I plan to make Mr. C's a personal staple stop. Plus, you really can't beat the prices here - when you're throwing back a couple of mixed drinks and catching a game!

13.description: Great Beer Selection

11.description: Great tiny dive bar next to midway. Im born and raised in da neighborhood and have been drinking with Andy for the past 10 years. It's always a crapshoot walking in there but there's almost always a crowd. Drinks are prolly some of the cheapest you'll find in the city. He makes a couple signature drinks and shots that are yummy. Very eclectic mix of people from locals to city workers to the airline industry. Don't get your hopes up like your going to a club. It's a shot and beer joint and they're about having a good time... ALL THE TIME!!

8.description: Bartender was awesome. Bar felt safe and inviting. Enjoyed chatting with him!! Can't wait to come back. !!!

14.description: A GREAT HOLE IN THE WALL DIVE!This is one of the most fun bars I have been too.  Besides the smoke, it is a blast.  The clientele is Airline folks, Police, and a gang of regulars.  Some random nights are more packed than others, and it is always fun when the music is goin, and drinks are flowin.As far as what to wear, whatever.  There is a mix of people getting off work and locals with jeans and Ts.  Wear something you wouldn't mind having to wash the next day to get the smoke out of.Andy, the owner, is a great bartender and makes damn good shots.  Try the Jaeger Bomb, or Southern Blues, or a Red Headed Slut. Enjoy the good time.

7.description: Mr. Cs is a great place. Friendly locals, great atmosphere, and great selection of snacks. My favorite part was the chilled Yagr. Mr. Cs is a must stop for everyone!

29.description: Love, these tamales! Always delicious and fresh. The staff is friendly and helpful. I can easily preorder the same day, and they will promptly have my order ready.

42.description: Very good little Mom and Pop stand.

23.description: I love Manolos green chicken tamales. The besttamale I've ever had in chicago. Their service is fastand great prices too. I can't wait to try other items on the menu.

8.description: I do enjoy tamales whenever I want them, but you need to bring cash since they do not accept credit cards. Almost every time I go there I see people freaked out when they are told they don't accept cards. It's simple really, the establishment is family run for the most  part and I wAs told they just want to cut out the middle man, which of course makes sense in every aspect. The rajas con queso is quite tasty with just a nice kick go it, or maybe you would like pollo verde tamales, whatever you decide- you really can't go wrong. I have not read pay reviews only because I want my review to be fair and impartial, and although I see a few lower stars, I can't understand why. I personally feel that they have quality as well as bite to them so it's only obvious that with no wait for the weekend tamales, this is the place to get your fix during the week. Their champurado is also good so you may want to try that also. For the price, you really can't go wrong and at least you know that here (unlike street vendors) you will get a better quality.

31.description: Everyone has a place for tamales...don't they...well I do! It is Manolo's. This place consistently makes a wide variety of tamales fresh and has chicken, pork, jalapeno, etc. with both the red or green sauce. Go early because they do run out towards the evening. Open late and they serve other Mexican food as well, but get a tamale please.

34.description: The tamales were pretty good. There wasn't too much meat in my pork ones and the pork wasn't as shredded as I like but all in all they were really good.The place is located in the gas station parking lot so there isn't much parking. The place could use a good mopping and cleaning but sometimes the little dive places are the best. I'd probably return, when craving tamales!

16.description: Best tamales ever!!!! Omg! Good old Mexican cuisine and they are open 24/7! So when u get a craving I can just drive over and fill my heart with the great taste! Totally recommend everyone to try the green chicken tamales!

13.description: It's at a gas station ...... jeez!!!  For a quick fix, because grandma's tamales are gone, and ma is to tried to make a fresh batch; besides who makes tamales during the summer? ....... this is the place to be!!!    Honestly, where do you think your favorite "Roach Coach" gets them from ......  the red, green, elote and rajas tamales are very good, period!!!!   THAT IS ALL!!

11.description: Pretty close to my mom's house; we had family in town for the holidays and got lunch here.  Torta, gorditas, and veggie burrito all so good.  Our son, visiting from DC, couldn't believe how much food we got for $24!

39.description: this time it's ok.....Manolo's when they started off good tamales were always good, yet at times they would always run out. I got a dozen of (rojos) red pork, half corn and half pink (dulce). Pork tamales lacked flavor and meat. More fat than any other thing. I would say the sauced needed more flavor. The dulce tamales lacked flavor. Champurrao was good as always. I may try them again, but let's see what happens.

37.description: I love tamales and they love me. This is where I go to buy them.

0.description: This place is a hidden lil gem. I was in town visiting from California and had a craving for Mexican food. Though the name of this place suggest that it's a tamale place, it also has an extended menu consisting of tacos, quesadillas, tortas, burritos and a few other items. The place is really small and only has bar style seating facing the windows. It can get really crowded, but it's well worth it. The ladies at the front were super friendly and helpful. I ordered a 2 tacos, one with chorizo and the other with chicharro. Both were really delicious and very similar to a street taco. I also had a tamal with cheese and pepper strips which was also good. I highly recommend this place and will be back.

38.description: Love it!! Awesome tamales!  A few friends recommended them to me for a party I was going to on NYE.  I went there at 8:30 in the morning and the line was already to the door.  I bought (4) dozen, Pork (Red), Chicken (Green), and Pepper & Cheese.  They were all very good, but the Chicken was my favorite.  These are nice size tamales with a lot of filling, not just all corn.  Very tasty.  I have been told the other location on Kedzie is just as good, if not better but I'm assuming they are the same tamales at both places.  It's not really a sit down kind of place, though they do sell other items besides tamales, more of a to go spot.  I would get there early on the weekend though, I would imagine they sell out quick.  I would definitely recommend.  Almost forgot the best part...  $9 a dozen!!  You cannot beat that!

27.description: First time here. I LOVED the atole de guayaba and the champurrado. My BF had a sope de azada. The sope itself was soggy, but the taste was "ok". I had a tamal Oaxaqueño and again, it was just "ok." We weren't expecting much though, so we were fine with our purchase. Although the reason why I came, was because a coworker was raving about the tamales. I tried a red tamale, it was nothing special. We were disappointed on a few things.  We ordered a cheese and beans tamale, but they were out. We tried ordering a quesadilla de flor de calabaza, they were out. We were going to opt for a quesadilla de papa, nothing. Well, how about a regular chicken tamale? OUT. Hmmm, how about a quezadilla de huitlacoche? OUT! LOL! I finally just said, "what DO you have? That's how we ended up with only a sope and a tamale Oaxaqueño :)

32.description: I always get their tamales for parties at work but for myself I always get the Oaxacenos & their sweet tamales

44.description: Good place for tamales!  The gorditas are also good however, like Paul F. says anything besides tamales usually takes 15 minutes to make.

24.description: We used to stay at a hotel in Mexico that had multiple tamal stands at the end of the driveway, before you swing out onto the Mex 1. Those were good. These were better.Highlights:Bean and cheese tamal was off. the. chain. The beans taste like they were cooked from scratch, not just dumped out of cans.The pork (carne de puerco) with salsa rojo also excellent.Elote also had great flavor, but was more dry--definitely grab some salsa if you like your tamales with more sauce.Also, the tamales were less than a dollar each? whaaaaaat. They tasted so freaking good, they could charge three times that and I'd still go.My husband got an asada torta, also excellent. I may have eaten almost half of it, idk.Go go go. Go all the time.

7.description: First off: CASH ONLY! Secondly, I have eaten at this place more than once so I feel like I can give a decent review. And lastly, it's been a while since I did a review so this is who I picked to get back into Yelping. Anyway, the food itself is really good. I love the burritos and the tostadas. The place is at a gas station so the decor isn't five-star. It's a 24-hour mom-and-pop (or madre & padre in this case) restaurant that is no-frills but is delicious with their food. Sometimes they do run out of tamales (and other items but they are known for their tamales) because people buy them up so much that they seem to not be able to keep up with the demand. But that actually doesn't bother me as much because I had a tamale from there one time that was dry and I felt like it had been an older one. So the fact that they run out is fine with me because it means the food is fresh. The place doesn't look the cleanest but it makes up for it in taste. If this review was just on the taste of the food then it would be 5 stars but I am taking into account that sometimes they run out of food.

40.description: Tamales by midway. I love it. The best part is that they are opened 24 hours. They have delicious tamales of different kinds from green chicken to sweet ones. My favorite is the rajas con queso which is  cheese and jalapeño pepper. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because when I've gone around midnight for my tamale crave, they wouldn't have all of the choices because they ran out. But besides that this place is awesome!

30.description: Where have you people been getting your tamales from to give this place 4 and 5 stars.I have been here about 4 times. More out of need than because I wanted to come here. When you have a craving for tamales and this is the closest place around you go for it.Well, not anymore, I have learned my lesson. Even if I have to drive a little more or in worst case scenario, go for something different, not comming back here. And the god of  tamales help me keep my word.Everytime I have been here, their tamales are dry, mostly spongy masa and very little meat. And again, I don't know where you been getting your tamales but that is not the way it is supposed to be. Today, I wanted tamales and there I go. I noticed that they have chiles rellenos as well so decided to do a plate of chiles rellenos and tamales.When I ordered they informed me that ther chilles rellenos would take a long time because the cook was not there yet (2:30 pm and the cook is not there) and they were out of the 2 kinds of tamales that I wanted.So I just left, went back to work without food and in a bad mood provided by the bad customer service at Manolos.Manolo's not again

1.description: It's convenient to go pick up some tamales on the go. Nothing compared to at home tamales you make with family but will do.

9.description: The tamales are great but the customer service is HORRIBLE! They won't even let you place an order for pick up either. Doesn't make any sense.

26.description: Not the best tamales we have had but they were good. Good enough to be had again, nothing super to brag about. We will return as this is closest to Garfield Ridge for a decent tamale.

25.description: If you like to wait 25 minutes to get a few tacos, this is the place for you!  Next time I'll pass and go to Taco Bell... They may not be authentic but at least you'll be fed and not fed up!!

12.description: We used to stay at a hotel in Mexico that had multiple tamal stands at the end of the driveway, before you swing out onto the Mex 1. Those were good. These were better.Highlights:Bean and cheese tamal was off. the. chain. The beans taste like they were cooked from scratch, not just dumped out of cans.The pork (carne de puerco) with salsa rojo also excellent.Elote also had great flavor, but was more dry--definitely grab some salsa if you like your tamales with more sauce.Also, the tamales were less than a dollar each? whaaaaaat. They tasted so freaking good, they could charge three times that and I'd still go.My husband got an asada torta, also excellent. I may have eaten almost half of it, idk.Go go go. Go all the time.

21.description: The pepper tamales are good. But, the bean tamales are mostly masa... As are the pork... Which left a lot to be desired. If you are trying to find it for the first time it's attached to a gas station, we had seen the reviews and were from out of town, but didn't find it until we stopped and asked about it. The lady behind the counter didn't understand having 3 types of tamales on an order of 12 (4 of each kind). It took her 10 minutes to comprehend my request and then she had given us 7 bean tamales (not what we had requested).

17.description: My regular tamale guy is on an extended vacation in Mexico so I have been exploring alternatives. I heard a lot about Manolo's so I finally tried it.
