I guess I have been spoiled by my tamale guy because the tamales here seemed smaller and less generous with the fillings. But they were tasty and I would probably stop by again if I am in the area. They are right around the corner from Midway airport.

10.description: Do not be afraid to try this place because it looks like a dive. Tamales are great and cheap and they give you tons of guac for a fair price.

5.description: Very small and crowded, pricey are okay, the tamales had nothing to them. They had a tiny piece of pepper in them and were very dry. I don't like how you can't see the kitchen in the back. My veggie burrito was fine, but smaller than what I would get any where else. They take cash only, all the time! Parking can be hard to find since this is also attached to a small strip along with a gas station.

3.description: Drunk? Got two bucks and change? Then you can snag a couple tamales here 24/7. Not the cleanest joint and it's hot inside, but they are quick. Theres not much to these babies as they are small with little filling, but they were fresh. About 6 stools and a small counter. I wouldn't return, because I have access to better tamales, but I'm hungover and needed sustenance before a stop at Midway airport; typing this from the cell lot. Such Yelp devotion!! CASH ONLY. IRS loves that..lol Gas station snacks that'll do in a pinche, Puta.Ay!! Annoying Gringa humor...

35.description: Awesome tamales!!! Place is very small! :) Awesome , tasty and delicious Champurrado!

19.description: A few weeks ago, I stopped by late afternoon for sum brkfst for the next day. This place never disappoints! They hav a variety of great tamales & warm drinks. Must try!

28.description: HERE IS THE KEY TO THIS PLACE-------- Go between 500-700AM...... INCREDIBLE MELT IN YOUR MOUTH FRESH TAMALES.... The oaxaqueńos are to die for and so are the beans and cheese. you will not be disappointed. Granted it's not the greatest location, it's adjacent to a gas station. Nevertheless get there early, it's worth the experience... So if your in the midway area late night with munchies, this is the spot!

45.description: One of the first things I noticed was that the Hungry Hound beat me to Manolo's.  In his high school spanish "Bien Provecha!   Gracias para los tamales y champurrado".   Not that I mean to hate....Manolo's specializes in Tamales and offers chicken, pork, green and red sauce as well as sweet tamales with strawberries and, my personal favorite, Oaxaquenas which are huge and wrapped in a banana leaf.  Champurrado is also delicious, but not always available.  The only real flaw at Manolo's is the other food.  I guess its my fault for tryna make someone give me tacos and tortas too, but given their focus on tamales the other food takes twenty minutes and doesnt quite hold up to their outstanding tamales.  but damn, if you need to pick up four dozen tamales before work to impress everyone and you only have thirty dollars at 6am, Manolo's is your new christ.

33.description: A few weeks ago, I stopped by late afternoon for sum brkfst for the next day. This place never disappoints! They hav a variety of great tamales & warm drinks. Must try!

43.description: I ate at Manolo's twice in two days, having the same thing both times -- Tacos Al Pastor!  I found these tacos to be excellent, in fact, the best Tacos Al Pastor I've ever had.  They seasoning was great, not too mild and not too spicy.  They serve them Mexican style with onions and cilantro.  You have your choice of green or red sauce.The place is connected with a run-down gas station and there are few seats to eat in house.  Aside from that, the food is great and I highly recommend giving it a try.

2.description: I really dont like writing bad reviews.But these guys finally MADE ME DO IT.Its like everytime I try to come and eat here they just SCREW UP.Not like I didnt try to actually give them a shot.How the hell do you take my order and then tell me 20 minutes later youre OUT of lengua?? I mean,I've been sitting there the whole time WAITING.That was on my LAST visit.This time I ordered two gorditas and you tried to give me 2 burritos.And one was de asada!!! I never said NOT ONE WORD about asada!!!! Im just tired.Only reason Im even here now is cause Im STARVING and I live right down the street.Im not even that picky but COME ON,guys!!!!

18.description: Tacos good torta good tamales good --I wanna know why they heck they wouldn't put SALSA in your to go bag?! That is so disappointing! Workers are rough around the edges but I guess that's the kinda of service you get at midnight

41.description: Absolutely love this place!! The tamales are fantastic, and I have tasted a good variety of tamales coming from a large Mexican family.  The chicken and green salsa ones are to die for. If you want to try real authentic mexican tamales, this is the place! I have not really tried much of the rest of their menu, mainly because the tamales are so good i cant go in there without ordering a dozen!

4.description: It's cheap, and fast to pick up after everything else is closed. They rarely have what's on the menu available.  Not the tastiest ... If not that hungry and have other options I would pass

6.description: I rarely give a one star review. I've tried eating here a few times with zero success. How do you run a restaurant when everything on the menu is out of stock?On my most recent visit I again tried to order some of the delicious sounding dessert tamales. While previous visits resulted in no stock on dessert tamales this time I was lucky to find that had strawberry tamales available. To my dismay when I got them home and the family dug in to them all we had was dry lightly flavored corn meal. We ended up throwing them out without finishing any of them. Also on this most recent visit I was hopeful to get some chicken green sauce tamales and some beans and cheese tamales. They had neither. Really?!? The tamale store again is out of all the tamales I was planning on. I decided on an al pastor taco. The taco was very dry and the cilantro dark and wilted. Complete disappointment. Previously when I've stopped and they had no tamales I have gotten a burrito that would be considered marginal at best. On this visit I witnessed the front glass door tied all the way open by a rope, the screen door was only partly closed but was missing most of it screen, and plenty of flys, bees, and wasps flying throughout the seating/waiting area and in to the open kitchen. Not at all sanitary. Yuck. The woman who has helped me every time is not overly friendly and when I show surprise that they are out of the tamales I want she just scowls at me. Talk about customer service. You're out of what I want (again and again) and you give me attitude. Pretty sad really.

22.description: I rarely give a one star review. I've tried eating here a few times with zero success. How do you run a restaurant when everything on the menu is out of stock?On my most recent visit I again tried to order some of the delicious sounding dessert tamales. While previous visits resulted in no stock on dessert tamales this time I was lucky to find that had strawberry tamales available. To my dismay when I got them home and the family dug in to them all we had was dry lightly flavored corn meal. We ended up throwing them out without finishing any of them. Also on this most recent visit I was hopeful to get some chicken green sauce tamales and some beans and cheese tamales. They had neither. Really?!? The tamale store again is out of all the tamales I was planning on. I decided on an al pastor taco. The taco was very dry and the cilantro dark and wilted. Complete disappointment. Previously when I've stopped and they had no tamales I have gotten a burrito that would be considered marginal at best. On this visit I witnessed the front glass door tied all the way open by a rope, the screen door was only partly closed but was missing most of it screen, and plenty of flys, bees, and wasps flying throughout the seating/waiting area and in to the open kitchen. Not at all sanitary. Yuck. The woman who has helped me every time is not overly friendly and when I show surprise that they are out of the tamales I want she just scowls at me. Talk about customer service. You're out of what I want (again and again) and you give me attitude. Pretty sad really.

15.description: Where have you people been getting your tamales from to give this place 4 and 5 stars.I have been here about 4 times. More out of need than because I wanted to come here. When you have a craving for tamales and this is the closest place around you go for it.Well, not anymore, I have learned my lesson. Even if I have to drive a little more or in worst case scenario, go for something different, not comming back here. And the god of  tamales help me keep my word.Everytime I have been here, their tamales are dry, mostly spongy masa and very little meat. And again, I don't know where you been getting your tamales but that is not the way it is supposed to be. Today, I wanted tamales and there I go. I noticed that they have chiles rellenos as well so decided to do a plate of chiles rellenos and tamales.When I ordered they informed me that ther chilles rellenos would take a long time because the cook was not there yet (2:30 pm and the cook is not there) and they were out of the 2 kinds of tamales that I wanted.So I just left, went back to work without food and in a bad mood provided by the bad customer service at Manolos.Manolo's not again

20.description: My regular tamale guy is on an extended vacation in Mexico so I have been exploring alternatives. I heard a lot about Manolo's so I finally tried it. I guess I have been spoiled by my tamale guy because the tamales here seemed smaller and less generous with the fillings. But they were tasty and I would probably stop by again if I am in the area. They are right around the corner from Midway airport.

36.description: The tamales here look and taste like something your grandma would make. Aside from the tamales I have had their chicken and beef quesadillas which were great as well. They were huge, well seasoned and very reasonably priced. A great place to try if you are in the area.

14.description: A dozen fresh hot tamales for $10 and they are open 24 hours. No waiting, you just pay and they bag them up and get out are on your way and their pepper and cheese tamales are the best.

3.description: Love this place!

1.description: This place was the highest rated pizza place within three miles so I figured it was a good bet. I'm truly disappointed in my pizza, the one employee in the place, and the cleanliness.I called in advance to order a large thin crust ham and mushroom pizza. While on the phone with the employee trying to place the order he had me repeat my order three times. And twice during the call he asked if I was ordering a pizza from Giorginos or Giordanos. Really? How many people make that mistake that you then need to make every customer who calls to feel like an idiot?When I arrived in the quoted 25 minutes there were two customers in front of me waiting while just one employee ran crazy around the kitchen preparing different things. While I waited I took note of a few things. First was that all the lights in the place were off except for the kitchen. It was dinner time, not a slow period in between lunch and dinner. Next was the cleanliness of the kitchen. I wouldn't even call it a level of cleanliness but a mass of filth. Food sitting open like Italian beef, some ground beef or burgers, and what looked like a bag of shredded white cheese - all things that need to be kept refrigerated. And then I watched the employee go from handling money to open food without washing his hands or putting on gloves. Now let me talk about the thin crust pizza. Not so thin. The crust was more like a hand tossed Pizza Hut or Papa John's crust. There was an ample amount of sauce and cheese. The ham was OK but really didn't have much taste. Then we get to the mushrooms... I've never had anything other than fresh mushrooms on a pizza. These mushrooms were the kind that come in a can and are smaller "Pieces and Stems" and were quite mushy. Last time I looked the fresh mushrooms were a lot less expensive than canned stems. It took the flavor and texture of the pizza right down. So the only slightly good aspect I can mention here is that the Family Dollar allows Giorginos customers to park in their lot. I can't honestly see a reason to try this place again. So many issues I can't see all of them being fixed. How disappointing for a local place that isn't a chain company.

2.description: My friends and I literally live about two blocks away from this little pizza place. For the past two or three summers, this has been our hang out spot. The food here is delicious as well as affordable. Though there is only one employee at a time, he does his best to work as fast as possible. Yes, the food might take a little longer than usual, but we don't mind sitting and talking. No one really goes into the little pizza place, but I love that no one is there to judge us. it opens pretty early, and closes pretty late and is open on most holidays for a decent amount of time. I totally recommend!

5.description: The pizza is good,  your typical Chicago style Pie,  delivery has been consistent and my family really enjoys it.Adam mentioned them running out of pizza,  that is great.  If I owned a pizza joint that is how I would do it.They have a very good fried chicken,  cheep and crispy,  I was not sure how it would hold up for delivery,  but on two occasions it has been crispy and seasoned well.  Maybe a touch much on the breading,  but good none the less.

6.description: we order from there like 2 a week, the food is fast, and good... The pizza was great, but my only complain is that there is only 1 person working in there, I think there is the cook, and the delivery man.. they need to hire more staff

7.description: I would looooove to give this place 5-stars for their food, but their delivery service / speed is usually not so great.The pizza is fantastic! Thinnish crust, but not super thin; very crispy without being burnt (although sometimes the middle is slightly undercooked); and they do NOT skimp on (sweetish) sauce, meat, cheese or other ingredients.A few of your mates not interested in pizza? The rest of Giorgino's diverse menu is just as tasty! I've ordered the beef burrito before and it is HUGE and delicious! The ribs are also tres amazing and portions of everything on the menu are very large.Plus, if you are a Royal-Crown fan, you will be happy to note that they serve RC sodas, and depending on the size of your order you get a free liter of RC (if you want Diet or something else, mention it on the phone).On the other hand, while the delivery guys are really friendly, they are often really late - maybe it's their fault, maybe it's the kitchen's fault, maybe it's a little bit of both. If they tell you 45 minutes to an hour - it's likely going to be 90 minutes. Still the food comes hot and ready to chow without a visit to the microwave. (PS - delivery fee is $2.50.)You can also walk in and order, but I've never actually been there, so I don't know if you can stay and eat or if you order, pick-up, then skedaddle.They have great coupons on their carryout menus, so if you need to save your pennies, check out the coupons first.I keep going back for the tasty tasty pizza - just have patience, and you might love it, too.

0.description: This small restaurant has very nice staff with good food at reasonable prices. I suggest you give it a try.

4.description: I can't give the pizza any review because when I walked in I was told they where out of pizza.WTF?????How does a Pizzeria run out of pizza?One more place I will never go back to.It does not deserve a star but I have no choice according to the Yelp Gods

3.description: Liars both of you.  Reffering to previous Yelpers.There are not plenty of seats,  and the ones there are,  are claimed by the apparitions of Charles Buchowsky.  What I mean is they appear to be Buchowsky yet have nothing to offer except their stink,  foul disposition and an inability to sneeze without covering their mouth.  I did not hear one chuckle unaccompanied by hacking in my 45 minute stay.  Not a total loss,  the service was pleasant which to me was a miracle considering the belligerent attitudes from the clientelle.  There is a smell,  the kind of smell when you are an alky you get used too.  Maybe I am not a drunk because the thought of stepping into this dump again makes me squeamish.There are plenty of bars in walking distance,  yet only a few are as dilapidated as this one,  but even with a fresh coat of paint,  some dental work and new lighting,  you couldn't cover up the hopelessness.

1.description: If you like to smell urine, while drinking a skunky draft beer this is the place to go. If you need to use the washroom I would suggest to just pee in your pants and sit in your own urine.......  When I first walked into Duffy's Place I noticed a very funky smell. While waiting for the bartender to notice me, I took a look around at the ugliest mucus green color paint I have ever seen. It  took the drunk bartender over five minutes to come over to me and take my beer order. I had to wait for her because she was to busy taking shots and giggling with her customers. After I had a few sips of my flat skunky draft beer I needed to use the restroom. When I opened up the door I finally figured out were the smell was coming from. I felt like I was stepping into hell. I don't think they have ever cleaned the bathroom, ever. There was puddles of urine on the floor. I decided to pack up my stuff and leave. In my opinion no one should ever step foot in this place unless your life hit rock bottom.

2.description: A terrible dive bar near Midway airport. One of the last bars I havn't been to in this part of city and after visiting here I was really missing nothing. A small bar with a really unintelligent drunk local clientle. There is little room in this and I can't imagine the number of fights that occured in this place from people bumping into each other. A foul smell along with stick counters and chairs make this place a no go zone.

0.description: Wow...i didnt know little old men went to bars

58.description: Took half-an-hour to get pad Thai and egg rolls. Ordered the pad Thai without egg and they still put egg in it. Pad Thai was decent, but not amazing or anything.

56.description: I can't stress this enough: THIS IS THE BEST RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER EATEN AT...EVER!!! Every single bite of every single item I tried was the best version of that dish I've ever tried. The pad thai, tortas, tacos, horchata, all the most amazing fresh handmade foods, even down to the sauces and hot chilies! I'm at a loss for words...no amount of money I've ever spent at a restaurant even comes close to the quality of this food. If you're lucky enough to eat here you've found the holy grail!!!

29.description: My husband  and I wanted to try something different that was close by. We saw the good reviews and decided to come here. It was great once we came in a young man greeted us he was very friendly he gave us some suggestions on what to try. We got the avocado roll the burrito with shrimp and it was all very delicious and different I love the mixture of spices. Definitely we will be coming back!

42.description: This place gets 5 stars on uniqueness alone! You can easily pass right by this since it's very unassuming, but that would be your loss. Not much parking and the inside is tiny but the food is creative and excellent. The cook and other person working there were very friendly and helpful also. We had the avocado rolls which come with aioli on the side and they were delicious. It might be slightly bland without the aioli but that really gave it a kick. Next I had the burrito fusion tempura with steak teriyaki. Normally I don't care for rice in a burrito but this just seemed right considering the fusion fare, and it wasn't too much just to be filler like some places use. The flavor was great and everything seemed so fresh. Love the hot sauce that the cook brought out also. Spicy but not overpowering. We also had a spicy Hawaiian pork taco and this was probably the best pork taco that I ever had. The chunks of pork were much larger than a typical taco and there was plenty of it. To wash it down we tried the coconut kiss which is coconut water with chunks of the fruit and a splash of cherry juice that added a small element of sweetness which left it very refreshing. Next time I find myself near Midway I will definitely stop, even if I'm not hungry!

23.description: Very friendly service to start. I had a Korean BBQ burrito and it was outstanding, really great.

47.description: Good food but really slow service make sure you place your order before you arrive or you'll be spending 30+ min for your dish.

8.description: Well, where do I begin? Let me first go over each item I sampled. Burrito Fusion (Beef w/Mandarin)  ***Tasty and quite good. The down part was the rice and the amount of it versus the meat. Very filling, but needs more protein, especially for the price.Kung Pau Chicken. **Okay, but really not that great. I wouldn't order it again. I really wasn't happy to see the pre-cooked rice come out of a big bag, instead fresh out of a rice cooker. If you want to cook Asian, then cook Asian. The meal was just okay, nothing special. It tasted like a packet you'd get at the grocery store. Korean BBQ Steak Taco ****Outstanding! Very flavorful and well made. Although a bit small and lacking a goodly amount of meat, it was delicious. If I had stopped with just this, my overall rating would have been different.Atmosphere  *Very small, with seating inside of only 4 very small round tables. No AC made it extremely  hot inside. It was 81 degrees outside and with no AC or ventilation, I was sweating like a BBQ'd pig! At least they should invest in a fan to get some circulation. After the taco, I got the rest to go just so I wouldn't pass out due to heat exhaustion. Location  *Right next to a VERY busy road. Be careful on the sidewalk.Staff & Friendliness  *****Outstanding! Very friendly and helpful. It was nice to be able to watch the chef cook. He is obviously very dedicated and loves his work. Overall  ***Suggestion: Drop the fusion and do what you do best, Mexican. While what I had was okay, it is not truly a fusion and they're better off sticking to one method. At least get the spelling right  (See photo)

31.description: We were looking for the tastiest most interesting food near the airport as possible and Dos Ricos nailed it. Their Hawaiian pork tacos were so amazing and my boyfriends chicken pad tai was spicy enough for us even (we've been hitting the ghost peppers these days). Would absolutely go back and recommend!

34.description: The only downside to this place is it's too small (and often busy) and the hours can be a bit erratic - especially on Sundays. That said, the food is great and definitely try the Korean BBQ tacos and pineapple lemonade - you won't regret it.

16.description: Love this small place, it is cheap and yummy! Had the avocado rolls which I could have ordered so many more because it is that good. Had the chipotle chicken taco which was so tasty and the korean bbq beef taco which was also tasty, yet spicy for all you spicy lovers.

13.description: This place is merely awesome!The location is very close the Midway Airport, about two (2)-minute driving distance south of the airport.  However, walking to this place from Midway is feasible.  Be careful while you're driving because you most likely will miss it!  The exterior is extremely nondescript.  They do have a private parking lot; there are two (2) vehicle spaces available.  Nevertheless, the rest of the parking lot is up to you at what position you would like to park.  Thus it's a free-style parking, like a long program in figure skating.  Once you've overcome all of the difficulties prior entering into the restaurant, you will experience one of the most amazing fusion dishes you would ever find in the city of Chicago limit.  We ordered the avocado rolls, two (2) fried bean tacos, and two (2) orders of horchata.  Let me tell you.  You have to try all of them if you get a chance.  The horchata was super on point!  It's one of the best I've had, comparing to the ones I've had in Logan Square and Albany Park.  The avocado rolls were crunchy (very creative use of the wonton wrappers), and the avocado paste was rich and creamy.  By the way, the southwestern dipping sauce for the avocado rolls was so delicious.  We dipped the tacos with it as well.  The bean tacos were filling even though there was no meat in there whatsoever.Vegetarians will enjoy themselves in this joint.  Some items on the menu have the "VF" as the indicators that they can accommodate your vegetarian requests if you desire.  The service was friendly.  The young man behind the counter knows all of his regulars.  This place is a GEM in the neighborhood.  Forget the generic airport food.  Get your orders to-go since you get these gourmet-quality items at very reasonable prices.  If you have time, there are a few tables to sit down and chill.

11.description: I heard so many good things about this place, and found a groupon, so I was definitely in to come here. To be honest though, I just wasn't blown away. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. The place is tiny and hot inside, with only one picnic table outside along Cicero Ave. I was OK with dealing with this, but you have been warned!Food- after reading reviews, I ordered avocado egg rolls, chicken jalapeno pad thai, and the pineapple lemonade. The egg rolls were good- decent (medium) size, loaded with avocado and lettuce, but without the spicy aioli (which was amahzing!), they were pretty bland. Cost was around $5.50. If you are against mayo-type dressings, you may want to skip this. The pad thai was good, but offered ZERO spice. I found pieces of jalapeno in mine, but all seeds were removed so it was nothing more than pad thai with a pepper in it. I rated it a 0.5/10 on the heat scale. I can get pad thai that is even better a lot closer to home. The pineapple lemonade was fantastic though. I thought it was a perfect balance of lemon and pineapple flavors; no flavor won. I would definitely want that again!My guy got the Asian wings and steak pad thai.  He said the meat was not really like steak, more of a beef cut. He enjoyed his wings. The total for both of us was about $27 before using the groupon. I enjoyed what I ate, but again, it's a little far for just good.

39.description: Tasty, fast food!  We enjoyed the dumplings, mango lemonade, and burritos.  The eating area is small, bit who cares?  We'll definitely go again.

37.description: Great food!Great food!Great food!Minimal seatingMinimal parkingDid I sayGreat food?

0.description: AMAZING- A Diamond Amongst A Multitude Of Sub Par Eating Establishments In The Clearing,Stickney And Garfield Ridge Area.Do Not Pass The Chance To Eat Here ,You Will Not Be Disappointed.Order The Fried WanTon -Its,Crisp,Light Breading Encases A Mixture Of Crab And Peppers And It's Complimented By A Sweet Chili Glaze Sauce.Then Get The Fusion Burrito.I Had The Steak Seasoned With Teriyaki Sauce.You Know Good Food When You Can Taste The Multiple Ingredients That Come Together In Fusion. Every Bite Beat The Last Especially If You Done The In House Salsa Sauce.This Dish Does Not Disappoint.Steak,Rice With A Semi Spicy Mayonnaise Sauce.Awesome.Then Try A Best Seller Here,The Korean Barbecue Taco-Steak. Its Seasoned With Barbecue And Complimented With Cheese & Topped With Siracha Sauce.DELICIOUS!!!Very Clean,Decent Seating For Quick Dine In Experience And Omar & Isaac Will Be Prompt As Well As Professional With Your Order.I'll Definitely Be Back

38.description: I heard so many good things about this place, and found a groupon, so I was definitely in to come here. To be honest though, I just wasn't blown away. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could. I would definitely want that again!My guy got the Asian wings and steak pad thai.  He said the meat was not really like steak, more of a beef cut. He enjoyed his wings. The total for both of us was about $27 before using the groupon. I enjoyed what I ate, but again, it's a little far for just good.

51.description: No one ever picks up the phone. How do they want business than? I've called at least 5 times and still nothing. Oh well, their loss.

27.description: The service at Dos Ricco's was friendly and thoughtful, and the fusion inspired menu is fun. This place boasts Mexican and Thai food on their signage. But, I'm pretty sure the Korean bbq steak tacos were inspired by Korean food. Nevertheless, there are many good things to try. My friends and I ordered the chicken wings (sticky, sweet with some heat), avocado egg rolls (could have used more avocados than lettuce) with a spicy sriracha aioli, and an oversized crab rangoon (overflows with melty cream cheese, lobster and crab meat goodness) to share. Then we each dove into our entrees. The tempura shrimp taco was good but could have used actual tempura batter to make it less heavy. The Korean bbq steak in the taco could have been marinated with the sauce before grilling instead of tossing the meat in the sauce after it was cooked which made the sauce taste like an afterthought. The pickled onions on the taco were a nice touch though. My friends raved about the Korean bbq steak burrito bowls (ask for sauce on the side or no sauce at all if you don't know if you can take the heat), and the orange chicken rice bowl.The horchata was good. A couple of us upgraded to add white chocolate to the drink. While tasty, I'm not sure how much it added to the overall drink ... let alone calories, but I digress. The dining room is small, with a few café style rounds. Al fresco dining is available. While there, the restaurant was consistently busy which is great. On my next trip, I may consider ordering the pad Thai burrito bowl. It looked delicious!

32.description: Great avocado rolls ! The ceviche I liked but it has a little hint of bbq infusion to it.You have to have the tea and lemonade !

The meal was just okay, nothing special. It tasted like a packet you'd get at the grocery store. Korean BBQ Steak Taco ****Outstanding! Very flavorful and well made. Very friendly and helpful. It was nice to be able to watch the chef cook. He is obviously very dedicated and loves his work. Overall  ***Suggestion: Drop the fusion and do what you do best, Mexican. While what I had was okay, it is not truly a fusion and they're better off sticking to one method. At least get the spelling right  (See photo)

48.description: really good tacos. i had the shrimp and the steak. very good. also partook of the pork dumplings. they were good as well. service was a little dicey. place was small bit had outside seating. stop in here if your in the vicinity of midway.

44.description: Seriously, some of the best food I have ever eaten in my entire life!!! If you are in the area, this is a must! It is a small restaurant, we missed it the first time and had to go around the block. There are only a few parking spots here and most patrons seem to order take out. They do have a few tables inside and outside to dine at. But whether you dine in or take out, you need to try Dos Ricco's!!!The waitstaff are very friendly and will talk through the menu with you. This was very helpful as we wanted to order one of everything ;)We ended up ordered the avocado egg rolls, Korean BBQ Beef burrito, and the Chicken Fusion Burrito with mandarin sauce for food and the Coconut Kiss and Japanese Lemonade to drink.1) Avocado Egg Rolls - A MUST!!!! Like OMG drop what you are doing right now and get at least 2 orders! The aioli dipping sauce is also the bomb.2) Korean BBQ Beef Burrito - Fabulous!! Why is it so good?!? Tender Korean BBQ in a burrito form, blessed with a kiss from heaven. A little zippy.3) Chicken Fusion Burrito with Mandarin Sauce - It was a tough call between this and the Korean BBQ burrito but I'm going to have to say this one was EVEN BETTER than the BBQ beef. HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE?!?! Talk about blowing one's mind with an amazingly awesome flavor explosion. Also a little zippy but ugh, I want it in my belly right now!--two sauces are available to enhance your fusion experience: a red sauce and a green sauce. Both are very flavorful and neither is overly spicy.4) Coconut Kiss - if you like coconut water, then you will love this drink! Coconut water with a "kiss" of cherry and fresh coconut pieces. Yummy, refreshing, and healthy!5) Japanese lemonade - this was so good I was only able to try 1 sip before my fiancee drank it all. Refreshing, tasty, delicious. We need more of this in our lives.Dos Ricco's may not be close to downtown/touristy areas, but I will make a point to come here when I am in Chicagoland. They are located just east of Midway airport. They also cater; this would be the best catering ever for a wedding (my wedding, yes yes yes! lol).If you want to try something new, that is not overly crazy and extremely delicious, than you need Dos Ricco's in your life!

24.description: Ok, I found this place on Yelp and decided to try it out after picking up friends from Midway.  Let me say, when we located the place, I was a bit taken back.  This is not the kind of a place I would stop by without seeing the raving Yelp reviews.  I have to say it was one of the best meals, and best service I have ever received.  Upon entering this tiny establishment, we were welcomed and asked if it was our first time.  After affirming, the owner gave us a rundown of the food and what the idea was behind it - Mexican/Asian fusion.  They make this concept work.  The avocado Rolls were stunning.  It was the first time I have had avocado hot, and the flavor and texture were simply brilliant.  The kids had the Orange Chicken which was better than I have had at any high end Asian restaurant, and had me eating off of their plate quite a bit.  I had two tacos - the tempura fish and the korean bbq beef.  Both were unique in their flavor profile and presented perfectly.  Prices very reasonable.  Service perfect and attentive from start to finish.  This is a high end dining experience in the least likely place you'd expect.  Go there.  I regret the years of driving to Midway and not frequenting this establishment sooner.

49.description: Been a fan of Ricardo and his food since he opened. Unfortunately I learned two valuable lessons today. 1. Don't go there when he's not there. 2. Plan on waiting a long time for your food.

40.description: Legit fusion spot with reasonable prices. Everything was fresh and made to order. Had the avocado egg rolls and 3 different tacos. All delicious. The people are friendly and the food is great. Hidden gem that I will definitely be back to visit when I'm in/out of MDW!

53.description: Stopped by there today after purchasing a groupon. First off the staff was pleasant, answered any and all questions and even made recommendations. The owner I'm assuming was a tall Hispanic man who frequently asked if we needed anything else, we dined inside since they have about 4 small tables. I had seen on another yelpers review the spicy Hawaiian pork tacos but they were not on the menu, when I asked for them they happily made them for me. All together we got the Hawaiian spicy tacos, Thai chicken wings, jalapeño pad Thai, avocado rolls, pork egg rolls, and a coconut drink...amazing!!! I will definitely be returning!

30.description: korean tacos and kung pao are great. I thought the avocado rolls were a bit overrated as they need some spice or seasoning in with the avocado... but the drinks were great as well (mango one and the pineapple lemonade one).  My son got a fusion burrito of some kind and the vinegared sushi rice and bulgogi'esque meat were great in a burrito.

46.description: Very tasty tacos. The Korean and the Hawaiian were the ones I tried, liked them both. Decently priced!

1.description: I placed a phone order with a menu we had at work. Ordered the fusion burrito with shrimp and teriyaki sauce. I also ordered the wontons. The person at the restaurant quoted me what sounded like $17.10 but I figured I misheard since the menu had these items priced at $8 and $3.99 respectively. Well, I get to the establishment and the wall menu showed $9.10 and $6.10 each. Obviously I had an old menu but even the take out menu in the restaurant had lower prices than the updated wall. I explained to them that the menu I had didn't have the wontons for that much and asked them to remove the wontons from my order (I can't see paying over $1.25 for 1). I expected that they would possibly honor the price on the menu they had but they didn't offer. So they lose stars for what I consider poor customer service.Now as far the burrito, it wasn't bad. But it tastes more like teriyaki rice. It was rare when I bit into a shrimp. So they lose stars for that.I won't be back...

55.description: We ordered the avocado egg rolls and split the Korean BBQ tacos and burritos. The avocado egg rolls came with some sort of siracha mayo for dipping. The sauce does have a little spice to it! The burrito is a good size while the taco lacked a little in size. Just because I've had tacos in the past where they have been stacked high!  the more the merrier right? Flavor wise definitely a nice mix between Korean and Mexican...

9.description: While waiting for a family members flight to arrive we ended up at this little place thanks to yelp.  First of all the service was good we weren't sure what to get and they were friendly and helpful.  However once we got our food it went downhill,  we ordered the fusion burritos one steak and one chicken teriyaki. It was the sweetest teriyaki I've ever had, and it was more of a rice burrito with a garnish of meat.  For $9 burrito I would hope for more meat so disappointing.  The only plus was the lemonade and the mango lemonade but very disappointing meal overall for $35 bucks.

26.description: First time trying this place and it definitely lived up to expectations. I had the Japanese lemonade after having a sample and it was amazing! Highly recommend trying it. For the appetizer we tried the avocado rolls which were unique and tasty and the steak salad which was surprisingly filling. The best part about the place is how nice the owner was. After we ate he came out to ask how the food was and offered us dessert. Definitely will be coming back

25.description: I popped in here today for a late lunch.  I'm not very familiar with the area, so I relied on the positive Yelp reviews to help me find Dos Ricco's.It is one of those hole-in-wall type places, as I drove past it and had to park in the McDonald's parking lot across the street (their parking lot only has enough spaces for 5-6 cars.I was very pleased with how nice and helpful the employees were.  I ordered my meal to go and had to wait only a few minutes.  I had the Spicy Hawaiian Pork Burrito, Dumplings and a special mixed fruit lemonade (Mangonada).  All were fantastic!  I love how they mix together two of my favorite cuisines perfectly!  Great concept and executed phenomenally!

12.description: Okay, here is the deal...this place is a whole in the wall.  A real dump.  However, it is clean inside.  The food is amazing.  Everything is full of flavor.  The Mexican food has a hint of Asian influence and vice-versa.  If you went to a haute cuisine restaurant and were served this food, you would gladly pay ten times the price they charge.

59.description: My rating is 3.5 stars. I love Del Seoul and will go to no other place for asian tacos so I have been skeptical to eat here but my boyfriend wanted to come here. No regrets, the last three times I've been here for the past 2 years the tacos were really good. I've eaten the korean BBQ taco and shrimp taco and chicken wings. The meat has the right amount of sweetness and spicy. The chicken wings are hot and crispy and the taste is comparable to korean wings I've eaten in the northside.

21.description: Phenomenal fusion food! The perfect combination of Asian and mexican food.Definitely recommend the chipotle chicken tacos, they are my favorite

17.description: This place was an absolutely fabulous find near Chicago Midway airport.  I was staying at the Holiday Inn near the airport and I thought my only options for food would be hotel bars.  I consulted my trusty Yelp app and was elated to find Dos Ricco's was an easy walk across the street.  If you blink, you may miss this place.  Look for the auto body shop; it's right next door.  You won't want to eat inside because it's really small and hot, so be prepared to make a take out order. I ordered a Korean barbeque taco and the chicken pad thai.  I was not expecting the portions to be so huge!  The pad thai was two meals worth for me and it was filled with huge chicken chunks and tasty cilantro.  The Korean barbeque taco was juicy steak, bbq sauce, onions and cilantro.  Everything melded nicely and the onions were a great contrast to the sweet bbq sauce. If you have the misfortune of having to stay in one of the hotels next to Midway airport, do yourself a favor and make lemons into lemonade (Pineapple lemonade in Ricco's case!) and walk on over to Ricco's!

10.description: In my pervious review I praised this restaurant. The Mexican Asian fusion was delicious. It was unlike anything I have ever tasted. Recently went it in to grab some more grub and some delicious pineapple lemonade and was disappointed. The price of all items increased but the taste and quality of the food decreased immensely. My wife ordered Mandarin Chicken and it was uninspiring. My sweet and sour chicken burrito was bland and I regretted the choice. Sadly the pineapple lemonade did not save the meal either. The wantons were the best part I just wish they were bigger and had more filling.

5.description: Love love love the food!! The kung pao chicken is to die for. Make sure you order a pineapple lemonade to go with your meal.

3.description: Whoa!We had a layover at the Midway Airport and the Uber here was worth every cent! We had the steak nachos... So good! My husband got the steak burrito fusion with sweet n sour sauce that was so stinking good I'll have dreams about it! I tried one steak and one Teriyaki chicken taco and I never wanted them to end. If you are in the area, you have to check it out!

35.description: This place was an absolutely fabulous find near Chicago Midway airport.  I was staying at the Holiday Inn near the airport and I thought my only options for food would be hotel bars.  I consulted my trusty Yelp app and was elated to find Dos Ricco's was an easy walk across the street.  If you blink, you may miss this place.  Look for the auto body shop; it's right next door.  You won't want to eat inside because it's really small and hot, so be prepared to make a take out order. I ordered a Korean barbeque taco and the chicken pad thai.  I was not expecting the portions to be so huge!  The pad thai was two meals worth for me and it was filled with huge chicken chunks and tasty cilantro.  The Korean barbeque taco was juicy steak, bbq sauce, onions and cilantro.  Everything melded nicely and the onions were a great contrast to the sweet bbq sauce. If you have the misfortune of having to stay in one of the hotels next to Midway airport, do yourself a favor and make lemons into lemonade (Pineapple lemonade in Ricco's case!) and walk on over to Ricco's!

19.description: The owner is offended that I didn't like his food. To bad so sad food is subjective and I'm not the only one who thinks your business is a candy factory instead of a culinary experience. Fact, most people from out of town talk about how gross and over priced your food really is....Like I said I'm a south side native with a travel companion pass because my spouse works for the airlines and avid businesses traveler. As a matter if fact I flew 155 times last year. My expense account has allowed me to try all kinds off food all over the U.S. I'm not rich just have a road warrior job that allows me those spoils. No matter how you spin it your food is gross to me and many other people. When your client base is primary Mexican and the only Chinese food they ever had comes from their local "Chop Suey" grease spoon your food taste good. Relax.... Your not the only Chef that has ever been criticized. There is entire TV shows, magazines and  web sites were food is criticized. Nothing personal, you think your food is awesome and I think it's garbage let's just agree to disagree. You are nowhere near 5 starts it's your location and fusion that makes you popular. Your food is gimmick there is no culinary talent attached to your dishes. It's nothing personal I just don't agree that your food is any good and so do many more people. I hope there is never a shortage of teriyaki sauce because you will be in big trouble.

28.description: This spot is tiny. You have to be looking for it in order to find it. Nothing fancy. A local restaurant conveniently located a few blocks from MDW. The Korean BBQ taco is superb. I left more than satisfied. Don't forget to wash your meal down with a Pineapple Lemonade. You will not be disappointed.

45.description: There passion tea is awesome but I was a little disappointed that the menu on the wall was not there full menu . I ask for a menu to go after we were already done eating if I had know they had California rolls I would of order them . We got normal tacos they were good

33.description: I read a few reviews prior to coming here that said this place was overrated - and I agree with them. This place is completely overrated. First of all, the price isn't "$"  as listed by its name. Each dish is roughly around $10+ and realistically, for fried rice or a burrito, $10 is a lot. Secondly, the wait time was ridiculous. It's a fast-food joint and no one was waiting for their order. All the same, it took about 30 minutes for us to get our four dishes. We had to sit and watch our burrito sit on a counter for about 10 minutes for no particular reason. If it takes about 30 minutes to cook fried rice, something is wrong.Third, the quality of the food is poor. Everything (by that I mean the "famous" shrimp fried rice and the jalapeno pad thai) were soaked in teriyaki sauce. Our fried rice tasted like teriyaki soup with rice in it because it was that saturated. All the food looked bright and colorful, but the actual taste was totally compromised with standard sauce. The chicken in our pad thai (as another reviewer had commented) was stiff and dry. The burrito tasted standard. The Korean BBQ tacos were okay but not as mindblowing as everyone said. While people mentioned the outstanding service, I didn't really experience any of it. The only time they were actually proactive about their service was when we were on our way out and they asked if we could review them on yelp. Multiple times during our meal, we asked them for knives. The woman would refer us to the cabinet behind us, but there weren't any knives in them! We used forks to cut up our foods out of exacerbation.   This place is no where near 5 stars and I would not recommend driving out just to eat here. It's mediocre at its best.

43.description: Great food!! This place is very small and would not have expected the quality of food from the outside.

2.description: Went here with my coworkers and we were all very disappointed. The reviews are nuts and it does not add up.The food took foreverIt was ridiculously expensive for the amount of food we gotThe chicken wings were disgusting, it looked worst than McDonald's chicken - I don't see why they have a sign claiming their Thai chicken wings have an award.Nothing impressed me, probably wouldn't return unless I was starving and in the mood to spend lots of money on cold food made with little effort to impress customers.Service wasn't all that either.

18.description: This place has absolutely fantastic food. Yes it's small in size but big on everything else. They have a different take Mexican tacos and tortas. They offer so much in there menu. I recommend the avocado rolls.

41.description: I don't even know where to begin. I never knew how badly I needed a restaurant like this in my life, until I found Dos Riccos. Asian and Mexican fusion? My husband and I were sold on that alone, I mean what could that possibly entail?The food was OUTSTANDING! I now know where I will be eating at the end of every trip from Midway. You are led to believe the avocado rolls are the best, because of all the pictures on this yelp page, and you'd be correct. If you order anything order them, then order the Mexican egg rolls, because you can never have too many egg rolls. Then please order the Jalapeño pad Thai, because it will put most Thai restaurants to shame it's so good! Lastly, put an end to your dream like meal experience with their beverages, either the mangonada or pineapple lemonade. Do it. You will not regret it!

52.description: It took me several visit to Chicago to finally convince someone to try this.  Well, the best crab ragon I have ever had.  We also had the  pork egg rolls and the avocado egg rolls and they hit the spot. Also had the infusion burrito(chicken) and it was so fresh and spot on.  They have very few main stream drinks.  But the y make a pineapple lemonade that was crazy good.  Had the flan it was good but a little pricey.  Overall, we would return and try other great looking things on the menu.

50.description: Came in right before closing, which is always a bad idea.I had purchased a groupon for this location, and ordered a steak burrito, tacos, avocado rolls and an horchata. For the most part, food was cold and the burrito as well as the tacos could've used more meat. Horchata was yummy. I'm pretty sure if we stopped by earlier, the avocado rolls would have tastes better. They tasted like they were refried a couple times. Def need to give this place a try on a better day.Not sure why they are closed on Sunday's. The Asian Mexican fusion sounds like a yummy concept.

4.description: I popped in here today for a late lunch.  I'm not very familiar with the area, so I relied on the positive Yelp reviews to help me find Dos Ricco's.It is one of those hole-in-wall type places, as I drove past it and had to park in the McDonald's parking lot across the street (their parking lot only has enough spaces for 5-6 cars.I was very pleased with how nice and helpful the employees were.  I ordered my meal to go and had to wait only a few minutes.  I had the Spicy Hawaiian Pork Burrito, Dumplings and a special mixed fruit lemonade (Mangonada).  All were fantastic!  I love how they mix together two of my favorite cuisines perfectly!  Great concept and executed phenomenally!

6.description: I read a few reviews prior to coming here that said this place was overrated - and I agree with them. This place is completely overrated. First of all, the price isn't "$"  as listed by its name. Each dish is roughly around $10+ and realistically, for fried rice or a burrito, $10 is a lot. Secondly, the wait time was ridiculous. It's a fast-food joint and no one was waiting for their order. All the same, it took about 30 minutes for us to get our four dishes. We had to sit and watch our burrito sit on a counter for about 10 minutes for no particular reason. If it takes about 30 minutes to cook fried rice, something is wrong.Third, the quality of the food is poor. Everything (by that I mean the "famous" shrimp fried rice and the jalapeno pad thai) were soaked in teriyaki sauce. Our fried rice tasted like teriyaki soup with rice in it because it was that saturated. All the food looked bright and colorful, but the actual taste was totally compromised with standard sauce. The chicken in our pad thai (as another reviewer had commented) was stiff and dry. The burrito tasted standard. The Korean BBQ tacos were okay but not as mindblowing as everyone said. While people mentioned the outstanding service, I didn't really experience any of it. The only time they were actually proactive about their service was when we were on our way out and they asked if we could review them on yelp. Multiple times during our meal, we asked them for knives. The woman would refer us to the cabinet behind us, but there weren't any knives in them! We used forks to cut up our foods out of exacerbation.   This place is no where near 5 stars and I would not recommend driving out just to eat here. It's mediocre at its best.

22.description: This has to be my 5th time here and I get something different every time. So now it's time for a reviewThis place may not look to appealing from a distance but let me tell you this. You have never seen or tasted burritos like this following more of a Asian style with there ingredients.Let me start with there drinks from there coconut kiss to there pineapple lemonade.They are  all perfect not to sweet nor to watered down. There appetizer as well are  appealing from there avocado tools to there Thai wings(not to meaty) but the flaver is all there. Now for there main course. I personally love there chipotle chicken and there Korean bbq steak. That being said I hope you give this greatly combined Mex and Asian style food joint a try.. there owners are just simply the best very attentive and friendly.

15.description: We ordered the avocado egg rolls and split the Korean BBQ tacos and burritos. The avocado egg rolls came with some sort of siracha mayo for dipping. The sauce does have a little spice to it! The burrito is a good size while the taco lacked a little in size. Just because I've had tacos in the past where they have been stacked high!  the more the merrier right? Flavor wise definitely a nice mix between Korean and Mexican...

57.description: Everytime I drove on Cicero to get to Midway, I spied Dos Ricco's with the Asian/Mexican sign out in front. Having moved from Orange County California, I'm familiar with the combination from some of the best food trucks around - two of my favorites are Dos Chinos (shout out to Hop) and Kogi BBQ. So when I tried Dos Ricco's the standard is high. I tried the burrito with bulgogi (Korean beef), rice, cabbage and cheese, and sriracha sauce. Overall, it was very good! My only suggestion would be to give it a bit of the vinegary kimchi "taste" to give it a nice contrast. But overall it was solid and I plan to return to try a few more items on the menu!

20.description: This place is tiny and the parking is scarce, but we luckily went during a slow time.  It was worth it.  My girlfriend had beef, chicken, and fried shrimp tacos, which were delicious.  My favorite was the burrito with Korean BBQ beef- not a flavor that I would normally associate with a burrito, but it really works.  I'm definitely coming back here.

36.description: Small local place with a real unique twist on Mexican / Asian. Not much room to sit and dine in but definitely worth a stop - food is excellent. Would recommend the avocado rolls and you should also try the home made drinks. We liked the passion tea and pineapple lemonade but the horchata was also also very good.

14.description: The service at Dos Ricco's was friendly and thoughtful, and the fusion inspired menu is fun. This place boasts Mexican and Thai food on their signage. But, I'm pretty sure the Korean bbq steak tacos were inspired by Korean food. Nevertheless, there are many good things to try. My friends and I ordered the chicken wings (sticky, sweet with some heat), avocado egg rolls (could have used more avocados than lettuce) with a spicy sriracha aioli, and an oversized crab rangoon (overflows with melty cream cheese, lobster and crab meat goodness) to share. Then we each dove into our entrees. The tempura shrimp taco was good but could have used actual tempura batter to make it less heavy. The Korean bbq steak in the taco could have been marinated with the sauce before grilling instead of tossing the meat in the sauce after it was cooked which made the sauce taste like an afterthought. The pickled onions on the taco were a nice touch though. My friends raved about the Korean bbq steak burrito bowls (ask for sauce on the side or no sauce at all if you don't know if you can take the heat), and the orange chicken rice bowl.The horchata was good. A couple of us upgraded to add white chocolate to the drink. While tasty, I'm not sure how much it added to the overall drink ... let alone calories, but I digress. The dining room is small, with a few café style rounds. Al fresco dining is available. While there, the restaurant was consistently busy which is great. On my next trip, I may consider ordering the pad Thai burrito bowl. It looked delicious!

1.description: This was fantastic. The staff here was very genuine about how they fiddled with your hair. It was a professional style, I loved it.

0.description: Right on West 63rd Street is a small haircut place called Life With Style.  I have been coming here for a few years now. I like this place and its location. I came for a haircut, so let's look at my experience!The service is pretty good. The workers usually speak Spanish to each other, but they are great with their English. They basically understand everything in English and Spanish. Don't be fooled! They are nice and friendly to you as well. My haircut turned out perfect. I like the way my hairstylist made my hair. It's a bit different from a regular version of doing someone's hair. All in all, good service, good location, and perfect haircut! I will be back here.

3.description: I use to go there frequently with work associates after a weeks work on Fridays. Only had the chili which was decent enough I guess. Beers and shots are cheap. Total shit hole with small piss filled toilets and bathrooms. Gotta pay for pool now which is bogus, even though it's only a $1 still a rip off. All and all a nice place to go and get blacked out drunk and forget about your problems. Will be going there until I die.

1.description: Went to this place back when I was living near Midway, eating cereal in the morning while watching Southwest Airlines beach ball themed aircraft taking off from outside my window. It's on a desolate 2 block strip of Central ave between 63rd and 65th streets. You blink, you miss it. From the outside it looked more like a penitentiary than a bar. But after walking in I was pleasantly surprised. Never tried the food but for these reasons it's worth a visit,1) It has an unofficial jail-like gimmick, not really any windows but cozy.2) Flat Screen TVs for sports viewing pleasure.3) $1 PBR pints in a frosty glass, SOLD!The Bear is definitely a diamond in the rough. A cool little neighborhood bar that I would even recommend for anyone picking up friends or family at Midway. Stop in and have a brew, it beats the hell out of waiting in a cell phone lot!

2.description: Once again I am thoroughly disappointed.I came in for a burger and was unable to succeed at getting one.Of the 6 times I have been in here I have been able to eat what I wanted once.I feel bad about writing this because I really do like the place but am upset by the lack of service.The staff is always friendly and apologetic but I can't eat a fucking apology.

5.description: A typical after work neigborhood bar,  but it may be the only one where a 737 may land on its roof, seated directly under the flight path of Midway Airport, it is a fun place to take visitors to before or after their flight. Decent cheap eats and most of the staff will throw you a freebie once in a while.

0.description: Can't beat The Bear Sports Bar for a friendly drink or a great Chicago Bear Hamburger or Beef sandwich. Been to this establishment often and will definitely go back; as it is very close to Midway airport great place to wait until a loved one arrives - beats the heck out of that cell phone lot and why circle the terminal when you can have a cocktail instead. Bear You Rock!

4.description: Ok you name a bar after the local NFL team and people will come. This is a big dive dump bar near Midway airport that somewhow has not been sued yet for having this name. The food was not too bad, but the place seemed like a typical young college bar except there is not a college within miles of this place. A very beer smelling place I don't think anybody who misses this hard to find bar is not really missing anything.

3.description: Small and simple fast food diner. Was a tad dissappointed that they do not carry a grilled chicken breast on the menu. Instead I ordered the Tuna on Pita with lettuce and tomato. The sandwich was fully loaded and decent. Make sure to have plenty of napkins on standby, the tuna gets a little drippy. Oh and their is no public restrooms whether you are a paying customer or not. That sucks :(

1.description: Andrisi's proudly claims a family business that has been around since 1977. Place an order & the counter help are superb offering anticipation. I was impressed with friendly customer service. That's what makes this tough.This place has a handful of Yelp reviews and I have to be the one to drop the bomb of reality? The Marquee sign clearly makes a statement... "Italian Beef" with the assumption this is their signature dish. "Hey, this is Chicago"!The "Italian Beef" is terrible. Apparently, Andrisi's is the middle man for a big box Chicago based food vendor (just my opinion). and not made in-house.The bread is good, the sweet peppers are cooked appropriately however the juice is as salty as the ocean. I'm talking lip puckering with a backdrop tongue shrivel. I'm talking waves of saline just messing with your taste buds.Have a gallon of water ready to chug after chocking down this disappointment.

2.description: This is a relic of a small, one person, greasy spoon kind of operation. I mean that in a positive and respectful way. They have great cheeseburgers and fries. All the usual suspects like pizza puffs etc. are made here. I like this place.

0.description: I love this place, they have amazing breakfast sandwiches, Bacon, Egg & Cheese are the bomb, and lunch they have great burgers and malts. I have been going here since I was a young kid and will be going here for as long as I live in the neighborhood. Great friendly service with fresh tasty food!

4.description: Great place to grab a quick hot dog.  Beef isn't that bad either.  Totally a little greasy hot dog joint, but in a good way.  The owner and the lady behind the counter are real nice.

3.description: I hate slamming a place like this,  but it must be done.The soul has risen,  and the pulse beats on,  barely.A sweat woman will bring your watered down java on time,  she will keep you full.  She will bring your pale yolked eggs and skimpy bacon with a smile.  If they fail to execute your omelet to your liking,  it will not be in your best interest to have it redone.  The atmosphere is like what you see on Kitchen Nightmares,  I will not sit it out waiting for Gorden Ramsey to save this joint.

1.description: I was there with my family today for breakfast. It is conveniently located for me. The staff was all very friendly and accommodating! The breakfast was good! I enjoyed the experience. I will not hesitate to go back!

2.description: The restaurant recently got new owners and supposedly a new menu, etc..  I thought I would give it another shot.  Yeah, umm..  still horrible.  Sorry!  :0(

5.description: the dining area smelled like sewer gas and my corned beef hash tasted spoiled.  one of the worst meals ive ever purchased. i ate here with a friend and he hated it too

0.description: The meal was quite good, but make no mistake-- this is no high-end ristorante. Essentially it is just a little local diner. The sausages were plentiful, the eggs were surprisingly well cooked, the hash browns were a bit oily for my taste, but overall quite good and filling. It is a quaint neighborhood restaurant.

4.description: Outrageously cheap for the constant quality food. Breakfast is the bestest!

3.description: I am a Chinese food enthusiast. I love to visit new Chinese food spot around Chicago. Just when I thought I find my favorite, I come across a hidden gem in my back yard. Their orange chicken is the best I've tasted. Rice not the best but the orange chicken definitely makes up for that.

1.description: Food is normal Chop Suey grease spoon but I like it.....Place is ugly and the wait is horrendous. Close to were I commute to and from and a good fill of grease when I'm in the mood. Don't recommend unless your starving

0.description: finally discovered a good place......For years our place was 1st Chop Suey.......but after many times stop ordering from there....We were told about this place from a friend who orders from them.  Ordered from them several times and normally the entrees are good.Fried rice is fried, egg rolls good as well. Seasame chicken is a but bland.....They also DELIVER!!!

2.description: I haven'tbeen to this place in a while because its hit or miss with some menu items. However the salt and.pepper shrimp is pretty dam good.

5.description: I would give a zero if I could. Food was beyond horrible. I ate a few bites and threw the rest away. Chicken had the poultry smell. Felt like I was going to throw up. Please please please do yourself a favor and skip this joint. Prices are good & portions are good, but you will not be able to eat the food. Panda Express is 100 times better than this place.

6.description: I've ordered from this place about a dozen times in the last year. The food itself is your standard Chinese-American fast food. I usually get a combo plate which includes shrimp friend rice, a main entree and a egg roll. PROS: Inexpensive, fast pick up times and large portions.CONS: One particular day I had to wait 2 hours for my food to be delivered and they didn't even offer me a discount or a waiver. Some options are worse than others. For example, last time I ordered the beef with broccoli combo and it was terrible. The beef tasted like it was microwaved and I was honestly disappointed. I would suggest to stay with the orange/tsuo's chicken options. Overall it's mediocre and it will continue to be unless it gets competition. There is the buffet on 71st Pulaski and New China Tea on 55th, but they are too far.

7.description: Warning this place is not safe to eat at, worst quality food ever. My orange chicken was brown on the inside. it tasted more like pork, i took only 1 bite and was disgusted. so then i had to settle for the shrimp fried rice which had absolutely no flavor. i had a gut feeling to just run away once i walked through the door but wanted to give them a chance, i wish i hadn't wasted my money here. trust me once you walk through the door you'll have the same feeling that this place is a dump just from appearances. anyone giving this place a good review either works there or are being paid to say so. worst Chinese food i ever ate, i would not recommend even to my enemies. after eating here i had immediate diarrhea.

8.description: My transplanted barber's shop is across the street from Kings and he said the food was good and cheap.  It certainly was and is.  They have an amazing 12 item Super Value Lunch for only $4.50 (3/12) and includes a fried rice side, it was enough for 2 people!  This is from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., egg rolls were not included but were good.  They will charge a little extra for adding spice and I had to do this with the beef/green pepper chop suey which I found a little bland.  They were fairly quick preparing my order and I had a short wait for my take out meal and also ordered ahead of which they were on time.  The vegetables are almost always crisp and fresh, not wilty or old.  Convient off street parking in front of their shop.

9.description: My coworker orders this once a week.  Most of the food isn't really good at all.  There's only one safe item I have.  No. 12 Hunan Chicken.  Otherwise, I've ordered some of the Sesame Chicken and it was undercooked.  Other coworkers have had the same problem.  But we have the one who always orders from there who loves it.   But IMO, go to another Chinese food restaurant.  They under cook the food and that's why some of it isn't very good.  The Hunan Chicken is the safe one because it's not breaded and you can tell if it's cooked or not.  Lots of sauce and it'll cook it afterwards.

10.description: GOOD FOOD!!This place is a good hole in the wall.  The decor is blah, and the prices are a bit high, but the food is good.  A great place to call ahead or have deliver.  The price is high but you do get A LOT of food.  I had it for dinner, and lunch the next day.  Gotta love leftovers.I know a lot of people that eat here, and no complaints from them either.  No hurt stomach after Chinese food is a plus.  you know what i mean.

4.description: Best Chinese Food on the Planet! I love to come here for a treat and it's great to feed all my family on a budget!

3.description: I have been coming to this Walgreens for over 10 years and never had a bad experience.  The pharmacy is fast, courteous and prompt.  The store is clean, well lit, well stocked and well staffed.  The staff is courteous, helpful and welcoming. The only not so good thing are their sandwiches - those were a little yucky.  Yet I wouldn't take a star away for that reason, if you really have to rely on Walgreens for a sandwich, then that's what you get.  :)Other than that everything here is top rate. Thank you my Walgreens!

1.description: This is the Walgreens I usually go to. This location is great for me to get some things. There is a new ICEE machine to get an ICEE. There is a Slurpee station across the street from Walgreens. It's at a place called 7 Eleven. There are some cool toys for your kids to choose at the toy section. There is also a decent selection of food, but there are some other places for groceries, too. I don't mind though. The staff are great and the service is good too. All in all, great choices for this Walgreens, and the staff are nice and friendly. I'll be at this Walgreens again.

2.description: This is my go-to Walgreens. All the other nearby locations require crossing busy freight train tracks so I avoid those. Lisa has been helpful a number of times and seems to sometimes be a shift manager. While she helps customers with a smile I've observed her be a bit nasty to employees when she is managing them. Levi is often at the register when I check out and is by far the friendliest employee in the store. A smile to each customer goes a long way. Two things I wish this store offered is to be open 24 hours and a greater depth in how many of any one item they have. If it's on sale how about having more than one or two on the shelf when the store opens on the first sale day. Clearly a logistical breakdown somewhere. The food options from dairy, fresh fruit, coffee, packaged meats and cheeses, to beer and wine is great to have so close to home. Some of these food prices are a bit high and they get a tax break from the state for covering a food desert for Link customers without a car the least Walgreens could do is pass the breaks down to the food needy people. Fine place for quick greeting cards or OTC drugs but for major shopping try to head to WalMart or Fair Share for better food prices.

5.description: This place honestly is not good for buying any snacks or certain drinks; mainly because I find that most of it is tampered with and opened like a bag of chips. Do yourself a favor and don't risk being poisoned by an opened ice tea.

6.description: Nice location, good parking, and the employees are helpful.

0.description: Had an awesome experience with this Walgreens. Donna the women working the register was beyond helpful and patient. My grandma is 90 years old and sometime it's hard for her to get her coupons and items together and Donna was so patient and caring. Such a sweet heart. Store is clean, parking is usually filled only bad part.

4.description: Every time I step into this Walgreens I immediately regret it. Staff is inconsiderate, on numerous occasions I've witnessed them have conversations with each other rather than their customers. Not very helpful either. Management is self sufficient. In all not a very reliable location. Keep driving to the next one!

28.description: Great food.  The steak burrito, horchata, and guac are my favorites.  Bring cash with you-they don't take credit cards.

1.description: Decent little spot near my crib.I've always enjoyed my meals here.Not bad.Service is decent.Always find street parking no problem.Prices are pretty much the same as other taquerias.Nothing really stands out but always hit the spot when I'm hungry and in the area.I've been coming here for years.Enjoyed their Tampiquena today.It was GOOOOD!!!!

9.description: Had steak burrito and it was runny with juice/grease and the meat was grizzled and chewy. Not happy. Will go to summit for burritos from now on.  El faro and el famous destroy this place.

29.description: The food is excellent. AWSOME selection. The burritos are the shit. Service is excellent. The lady at the register cut our burritos in half which is what we wanted, and we didn't even tell her to. So they are food smart also. They have a good selection of drinks also. GOOD FOOD, SERVICE, & QUALITY.

23.description: Stopped here with friends on a whim after seeing the good reviews. I'll definitely be back if/when I am in the area and craving Mexican food. Huge fan of this place - the al pastor tacos with cilantro and onion were very tasty. Brought me back to memories of some tacos I had in Puerto Vallarta. Rice and beans were good too. The guys were friendly and cooked up our take-out order quickly. Yum!*Cash only*

5.description: I was here, again.This time at 1:30 am on a Sunday. Shame on me. What the hell?We went after a wake in my husbands ole neighborhood. This may sound strange if you are not aware of the Southsiders native customs. Be assured that although to all non-southsiders this seems strange perhaps even in appropriate to be out boozing untill the middle of the night after a wake; to the Southsider it is not.The review:The good part, it was open. The bad part, apparently they do not believe in any sort of seasoning. The guys were nice, and they fed me which was sorely needed, so thanks for that. Come on though, how about some seasoning, even salt!?The pickled carrots and jalapenos were great, biggest darn carrot slices I have ever seen. I commented to the guys, they laughed at the little blond exclaiming about the HUGE carrots. The innuendo was there. Whatever, I will fill stereotypes for a laugh.

25.description: the chips!!!! the salsa!!!mmmm. there is something about southside kids and late night mexican runs. my friends and i have frequented this place so many times. the food = excellentethe crowd is also really interesting, hahaha sometimes you get undercover cops and people from the bar right next door and just random random people. i've even run into friends here unexpectedly... at like 1-2 am. the bottom line... whoever is there, we are all there united for  the same reason... delish mexican food.i usually get the veggie burrito ;-) although if you like spicy try the chicken!!! the steak is also yum.

12.description: So my wife, a friend and I all had a hankering for some Mexican. El Gallo Tapatio is two blocks from my house, but we never tried it. All the reviews say the steak burritos are orgasmic. Who am I to argue?! The quality of the steak is excellent, not fatty or rubbery. The tamale are great too. Cash $$$ only!

21.description: Great local place and it's open late.  They have great guacamole; it's pretty spicey!  Only complaint is that it's a little on the pricey side for a quick carry-out burrito place.

16.description: Stopped here with friends on a whim after seeing the good reviews. I'll definitely be back if/when I am in the area and craving Mexican food. Huge fan of this place - the al pastor tacos with cilantro and onion were very tasty. Brought me back to memories of some tacos I had in Puerto Vallarta. Rice and beans were good too. The guys were friendly and cooked up our take-out order quickly. Yum!*Cash only*

17.description: Really good tacos! So glad I've found a place close to my friend's house! I'll be back!

10.description: Others opinions think this is what GOOD food is. Mine is that El Gallo Tapatio is NOT it.Reading between the lines of the reviews it seems most rave about this joint cuz its late and they are drunk....ahem..well, I tried this place SOBER and early and it SUCKS - BIG TIME. All I tried was the much tauted El Pastor...I gagged on the first bite. It tasted like it was marinating and mixed in with cheap chorizo..Its hard to find good chorizo btw, and to me, most of it is like eating dog food flavored with lime. Worst ethnic sausage known to man.The pork was greasy and too finely chopped. WAYYY overkill on the cilantro.NOTE: If places like Lalos and Altotonicos is one's idea of what good mexican food is - then I fear your obviously D.O.A tastebuds just might hit another jackpot with this joint - Y.U.C.KOnce again, for an overall great variety of mexican food go to LA Fiesta just before 87th Cicero, (they also have really great three milk cake slices) Zaca Tacos and even Pepes is better than then El Gallo, Lalos and Altotonicos.

11.description: The food is great I usually like to get there sopes and they have real good guacamole.

26.description: What a great joint.  The tortas are outstanding.  They only accept cash, so make sure you've got it on you... No credit or debit.

27.description: Their freaking food was so good, small little place to go and sit down with a couple of friends and chill out.  Perfect little mexican food shack.

0.description: Delicious! Cheap! Authentic! I had the chile rellenos and horchata and my sig fig got the combo burrito. The portions were large and it was a very satisfying meal!

20.description: There are not many places you can go to get great Mexican food anytime at night... as long as you can handle the neighborhood it's worth the trip.the food is always good and we visited again this past weekend after our night out. The steak burrito is great and is bigger than anyone can finish! If you're in the area it's a great place for a late night Mexican feast.

19.description: I have been going to this place for years and it is awesome for late night. Growing up on the Southside we used to go to Riley's Daughter on a 111th and Pulaski then head over to El Gallo on 111th. Needless to say I was excited when they opened this place in my old stomping grounds. Service is good but I don't come here for the service. I come here for the steak tacos! These things melt in your mouth! Salsa and chips are great too and very cheap. Reminds of the old days. I don't go here as often as I want to, but when I do it is always a treat.

2.description: Not bad. Had the Carne Asada Tampiquena to go and had a bite of the Torta de Milanesa. Decently priced and the salsas were good.

18.description: There are not many places you can go to get great Mexican food anytime at night... as long as you can handle the neighborhood it's worth the trip.the food is always good and we visited again this past weekend after our night out. The steak burrito is great and is bigger than anyone can finish! If you're in the area it's a great place for a late night Mexican feast.
