13.description: Very bland food. Taco meat was grissely. Going back to El Patron on Archer!!!

4.description: Food was just ok, nothing I would order again. Service was awful. The only words the woman behind the counter said was"cash only", no greating, no thank you. In 2014 it's annoying when you don't take credit cards.  There are plenty of other places in the neighborhood so we won't be back.

24.description: So my wife, a friend and I all had a hankering for some Mexican. El Gallo Tapatio is two blocks from my house, but we never tried it. All the reviews say the steak burritos are orgasmic. Who am I to argue?! The quality of the steak is excellent, not fatty or rubbery. The tamale are great too. Cash $$$ only!

6.description: Food is extremely flavorful and made fresh right infront of you! The service is very friendly and they suggest items to get with your meals. It's very small, but home-y. I love it. They do only take cash which is fine by me, why should I care? Cash is king baby! I've been a fan for years as well. Keep up the great work!

22.description: If it weren't for these fantastic yelp reviews, I would have continued to pass by this place like I have for the past 3 1/2 years that I've lived in this neighborhood. I would have passed by because it really doesn't look like much on the outside. Plus there are a ton of mom and pop Mexican places in the area.The El Pastor tacos are amazing. Sometimes the pork can be fatty, but not here! It shows that the quality of meat is a lot better. I think it was $1.75 for each taco. My friend got the 3 taco meal for $7. You get a lot of food for the money.The guys were really nice and friendly. Since it was our first time here, we had to look at the menu for a while and we felt no pressure to order quickly or anything. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes!Open until 2am! YAY for yummy drunk Mexican food!

15.description: I remember coming to this place all the time during high school back in the day. The food was so clutch here that I once ATE AROUND a dead moth I found in my taco dinner. IDGAF. Real niggas finish their food like a fucking Spartan! Till this day my friends still tell the tale of when I ate around "The Moth". That was the night I retired this place and took my talents somewhere else. Food was prettaaay good though.

7.description: I love El Gallo, it's cheap and delicious. To those if you who claim it is in a bad location, you're nuts! The neighborhood is not bad and the location is great. The service is usually quick and the waitress is friendly. Go to Ell Gallo!!!

8.description: If it weren't for these fantastic yelp reviews, I would have continued to pass by this place like I have for the past 3 1/2 years that I've lived in this neighborhood. I would have passed by because it really doesn't look like much on the outside. Plus there are a ton of mom and pop Mexican places in the area.The El Pastor tacos are amazing. Sometimes the pork can be fatty, but not here! It shows that the quality of meat is a lot better. I think it was $1.75 for each taco. My friend got the 3 taco meal for $7. You get a lot of food for the money.The guys were really nice and friendly. Since it was our first time here, we had to look at the menu for a while and we felt no pressure to order quickly or anything. The food was ready in less than 10 minutes!Open until 2am! YAY for yummy drunk Mexican food!

3.description: After the absolutely rudest service I have ever had to experience, the burrito was just  ok. Won't go back.

14.description: I've been going here since high school. They're open late and their food always hits the spot any time of day. Location kinda sucks when your on the wrong side of the tracks and freight trains are usually long. Aside from the location, the food is delicious and affordable. Hits the spot when your craving Mexican food.

3.description: Me and my boyfriend walk into this 7-eleven to get a slurpee and we're making one. By the way, there was already a mess on the floor from someone else making a slurpee and the guy comes over to us and says "why the BLEEP did you make a mess on the floor!! come on guys!!! what the BLEEP" Ummm...excuse me?!?! I was OUTRAGED!! Who the hell does this man think he is swearing at me like that? Oh hell no. Me and my boyfriend threw our huge slurpees on the ground said there's a mess for you and walked out. I won't ever go back there again. I'll be damned if I get treated like that ANYWHERE. He'll be working at 7-11 till he dies and I will move on to bigger and better places in life because I know how to be a decent human being!

1.description: This is the closest 7-Eleven to my house. This is also the 7-Eleven that I usually go to. It's a clean store, and the workers are nice. I get a Slurpee with loaded Doritos here. The Slurpee has fruity flavors. It's delicious, but some of the flavors are broken sometimes. Their loaded Doritos are good. It's crunchy and cheesy! The service is good, and friendly employees. I will come back.

2.description: Love how they basically sell anything you need for survival especially since they are always open.

5.description: I have been to this store like I have been to my house.. And I got to say sometimes they have a friendly person behind the counter and sometimes they have a clown.. I really don't care that much as long as they have but I'm looking for (snacks and beer most of the time) I'm ok with that.. I do recommend not going late at night you could find less than reputable people hanging in the parking lot.

0.description: There have been a number of owner changes here in the last two years. The long time owners were fantastic people and always had a smile. The current owners started off a bit shaky I believe because they hadn't been business owners before with such great physical demands and the really long work hours. As the months have gone on they have settled in to a routine and become a bit friendlier. The stock here is always pretty full and I wouldn't hesitate to pick up a Slurpee or a gallon of milk here. The keep the coffee fresh and customer spill areas pretty clean. If they have failed you before I say give them another chance.

4.description: People who work there are not friendly and owner is rude.

3.description: I have been coming here for a few years now, and they have been my go to place since they're literally down the block from me.  Sucks to say that the last few times I came in the service was swift and sloppy.  I spent over $200 within a 6-week period. Me and my daughter had to get our nails done and wax for a wedding. Her nail beds are small but the acrylics were wide and thick and uneven. That trip alone was over $100. I came back a couple of times for wax, which she always does a good job on. Lastly I had a "NO-CHIP" manicure. I had to get my previous gels nails removed and I decided to get a "no-chip" so they would have a nice strong coat.  She (wife) started without a base coat. I noticed right away as she started to apply the color that it was looking streaky. I mentioned it to her. She blamed that on the color I picked (a soft sheer pink) and also she said my nail beds were uneven from having the gel nails. This was not true as she had just filed them down smooth and even. She seemed tired from the moment I got there I was the 2nd customer of the day just after opening. I spent $45 for the removal and "NO-CHIP" manicure, and 2 of my nails chipped after 2 days! I never went back due to work schedule and me not wanting to waste my time. I hate to admit it, I have given them several tries but the service is not up to par AT ALL. I will take my hard earned money elsewhere in the neighborhood

1.description: My daughter is a regular customer here.  I kept hearing how visiting with this family was so much fun for her.  She very much appreciated how close they are and how hard they work.  I've now been there a few times in the last 12 months and I can say that it is as enjoyable an experience as my daughter (a VERY opinionated person) promised.  I've seen these less than favorable reviews.  It's sad to think someone would miss a good mani-pedi at a great price, with people worth knowing because of them.  I would encourage someone to give them a try and draw your own conclusion.The posted closing time tonight was 8pm. At 7:45 there were already 3 of us, two more clients arrived separately and were greeted with smiles and a friendly hello.  As I said, friendly.

2.description: It seems Lisa nails has given up. The energy in this place is just get  to get out ASAP. I've been coming here for years but the last 3 or 4 times was just a bust. My nails had way to much polish and were not cut even with the other hand. When I asked that man to fix it he said they look FINE. I left with a weight in my shoulders and headed to another nail salon to get the nail fixed. I will not be returning to Lisa nails.

0.description: i use to love this place. tom the father is so funny choi the daughter is very friendly but ive always had a bad experience with the mom. 2 weeks ago was the last time. i had been waiting and waiting then she approaches me and says are you getting your nails done if not i will take next person. i actually walked out and said forget it. she said, yea come back tomorrow. lost me as a customer. now i must find a new place. womp womp womp i am so big on customer serviceALSO IM IN THE MEDICAL FIELD (WASH MY HANDS SEVERAL TIMES A DAY) AND EVERYTIME SHE WOULD DO MY MANICURE I HEARD ABOUT HOW MUCH DEAD SKIN I HAVE ON MY NAILS AFTER 2 WEEKS. OK OK OK I GET IT NO NEED TO HOLD UP MY DEAD AND TELL ME ABOUT IT 5X.......FUNNY NOW THAT I THINK ABOUT IT

4.description: I been coming here for about 5 years now. The owners are a married couple(Lauren and Tom)who are the funniest and sweetest business owners I've met in a long time. They both do manicures and pedicures along with there their daughter who also does an amazing job.  The owners make sure you have a great experience and that you're comfortable. Lauren does the waxing and does a fantastic job! Eyebrows are always on point! THANK YOU FOR THE GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!

3.description: If authentic Mexican fare at a reasonable price is on the docket for you than I heartily recommend a trip to La Vina del Mar. Clean atmosphere, family friendly feel welcomes the casual dinner to a homey type restaurant that serves up a slice of real Mexico. The owner asked me if i had ever been to Mexico and i recanted trips to Cabo San Lucas, Puerto ,  Vallarta, and Cancun. Laughter ensued as she cautioned me that i have never "really"been to Mexico! Feeling empowered by the thought that impending real Mexico was about to be on my plate I told the waitress "Bring me what i should eat"  She began with a wonderful flaunta  that had an ample supply of tasty goodies highlighted by avocado.  Next tacos arrived that were absolutely wonderful. Service was good ...(quiet afternoon though) and prices were very fair. Not a dress up dine out but good food at a nice price point. Well done La Vina del Ray

1.description: I love the food here and I just wished they has delivery so that I could enjoy it straight from home.

2.description: Love this place! We used to frequent their location on archer years back. When they closed up shop suddenly we were heartbroken. Glad they are back! The parrillada is the best in Chicago! We tried many locations looking for something similar and no restaurant compares.

5.description: One star is being generous-1) tortilla chips from a bag2) tostada shell from a bag3) pork dinner contained bones that were hidden in gobs of sauce4) there was a group of 5 there and my family...and service was slow. Never checked on us5) rice was bland

6.description: Authentic ,good food!

7.description: I absolutely LOVED my experience here! 1st off it's B.Y.O.B!!! They have 3 big tvs and they asked if I wanted to watch anything in particuar... Football it was. My girlfriend and I ordered 'The Parillada" The food was @#%% GREAT!!! There was so much food that we were able to eat and get stuffed again the next day! Read the other reviews and completely disagreed with the whole bad service. The service was great! They let us eat comfortably, they didnt sit over our shoulder watching us eat. Whenever we needed anything we'd look over and they'd come over right away... Oh, and Real tortilla chips! Someone must have been expecting Taco Bell. lol This is now my Sunday Spot!

0.description: Delicious and affordable! I highly recommend it! I do not eat seafood and ordered chicken flautas. My friend ordered chicken tacos and was pleased as well. Will definitely go again.

4.description: This place plain out sucks. The service is horrible and the food sucks. I ordered a large Coctel (shrimp cocktail), and only 4-5 pieces of shrimp were in it. My girlfriend had Camarones a la diabla, and the rice was plain with no flavor. The Camarones were hard and no flavor to them with the sauce next to it. The tortilla chips were stale, and even the horchata(rice water) had no flavor. The service sucked, we were the only family there and got no service in between, not even for a refill. Very disappointed with this Sea Food restaurant. Don't even bother going there, waste of money and waste of time.

29.description: All I have had from there is the breakfast which is done well. Good prompt service

42.description: Soooooo,  I am on a quest to find good breakfast eats all around Chicago.  Preferably brunch-on-Saturday-type places.  I was near Midway airport today and decided to dine at Top View.  Decor?  Not that hot.  Service?  Great, my daughter had the waitresses "fighting" over her for "kisses" and smiles. Food?  I took the advice of another Yelper and had a corned beef hash skillet.  DELICIOUS!!!! I will be back. Bathroom?  Needs work and there was no diaper changing rack installed in there.  Not cool. Parking?  Small lot but it was okay to park in for me and for the time of day I dined there.

23.description: We came into town to hit the Notre Dame game and were staying near the airport to make it easier but needed some respite on a Sunday morning.  We decided to catch breakfast at the Top View Diner, which was close by.  The place was packed and had a 20 min wait so we headed to the back countertop that gives you a great view of the cooks and the servers as they dance around in a complicated ballet.  Though we had to wait a bit to be served it was worth the wait.  We both ordered omelets (one sausage and cheese - the sausage was very flavorful, and a bacon onion) they came hot and served up with homemade hashbrowns.  If you want true crispiness we'd recommend ordering them well done.  People were doing it all around us and when we got ours we understood why.  Though they were good they would have been extra good had there been more crispy edges.  I got pancakes for my side and I consider myself a pancake connoisseur, they were light fluffy with buttery edges - just the way heaven intended.  The most entertaining part was watching the controlled chaos of the kitchen and serving area.  They danced around each other, bearing heavy loads of plates, bowls and coffee pots, never a movement wasted.  And when one of our meals went missing and we got the wrong omelet the server turned on the kitchen staff with a stern, "I need a sausage and cheese up right now."   It reminded us of an emergency room, "I need a bandage stat!" The error was quickly remedied and the right food was in front of him before I had taken a few bites of my own.  Overall I'd say this was a great little place with good food and a busy staff.  We'll definitely make this a repeat location the next time we are in town for a game.

47.description: Their corned beef skillet is so old school and I love it. Not the corned beef you get out of a can but the way it was done back in the day by slices. I had a skillet of corned beef with sunny side up egg that consisted of various yum yums within the skillet. It was absolutely lovely to see that any restaurant still keeps it old school and that they don't skim on food. I also had their iced tea that was rather nice. So if you want old time foods at really decent prices and you are near Midway Airport, this place is the one.

8.description: Eh...Don't wanna be mean. A lot of people I know like eating here. ....I think it's just okay.

31.description: My only regret was that the meal was about to end.Nothing really stands out about the restaurant when you walk in.  They have some older decor, ceramic dishes and cups, booths along the wall and in the middle with round tables filling in the rest.  There's a bar in the back along the kitchen which made me wish I'd seen it before the waitress started serving us.Corn Beef Hash Skillet:This was pretty great.  Upon arrival it comes covered in cheddar (not my favorite) but it was actually VERY good.  All seemed well prepared, not oily or greasy, just some really great potatoes & eggs.Orange Juice:No pulp, it was ok.Steak & 2 Eggs:Steak well prepared, juicy, tender. French toast:It was ok.The prices are average, I think about $11 per person, you can keep it below $10 if you only order water.  The corn beef hash was pretty fantastic, I wanted more.  Thus far the dishes seemed between good & great.  Service was kind.

34.description: Whats the difference between this place and Huck Finn?  This restaurant is located closer to the airport.  But seriously, it's a decent diner and appears clean.  Go to Sammy's on 55th if you want the same quality food but at a better value.

16.description: Breakfast specials are good for price.  Atmosphere is somewhat old and bathroom could be improved but overall it's ok.  I've been a customer for years and food and service have been consistent.  Some staff are less friendly than others but overall ok.  No WiFi.

13.description: Nice restaurant. Food is ok. Prices are good. Soup tastes pretty plain. Hash browns were dry. Friendly staff.

11.description: Doesn't look promising from the outside - but sure is yummy on the inside. Great breakfast for great price!

39.description: A small, good, and cheap diner. Food was really good and soup was better. For two it was $9 (split a sandwich). Really clean place with nice service.

37.description: I have to compliment this place. It had some halloween decorations up to celebrate the month of October, the staff was friendly, the prices were competitive, the portions were enough, I left full, the quality was decent. I asked my waitress if she would change the channel on the television, the show on at the time was not good "dining" T.V. , she didnt hesitate at all and smiled , agreed with me and fulfilled my request. My water glass was always full, as was the coffee cup, waitress came around just often enough. It's not fine dining, but if your in the midway airport area and want a sandwich, it's a comfortable place.

0.description: I love Top View!  This family restaurant has been in the neighborhood for years.  Let's keep it that way by going there.  Everybody in your party can order a different type of meal.  We need this family restaurant to stay right here.  We wouldn't have any other restaurant like it.  There is a variety of foods, not just one ethnic type!!!'  Getting sick of just restaurants that just serve one ethnic style, sick of it!!!  Please go there for breakfast, lunch and dinner!  Everything is home made!

38.description: Very good homemade soups (chicken & dumpling)... I also liked the corn beef sandwich.

27.description: We were staying at the holiday inn at midway, googled breakfast and found this place it was a great little place, we had eggs Benedict , pancakes and an omelette everything was delicious. I love home cooking diners so it was perfect! Would definitely recommend and go back!

32.description: The South Side seems to be experiencing an identity crisis & as a result, people out here have let go of things with grit & character in exchange for large chains & cookie-cutter decor.  YES, this place is a true greasy spoon diner!  It has all the charms of an out-of-date look, mom-like waitresses, locals frequenting the joint...but like all diners, the food is satisfying & cheap!  I thought I would have to go up north just to get gritty diner service but I soon found a little gem of my own right by home.  This place was the ONLY one to get me to eat after my cat passed away!  My brother took me to 4 places & had no luck.  We came in out of the rain to have coffee when, after sitting in there smelling all the goods, I began to feel hunger.

48.description: the fact that they had Belgium waffles sold me on this place. whenever i get the chance to have a belgium waffle i make sure i order one. the waffle was nice and fluffy but still had a nice crisp shell. i wished that they had a belgium place in grand rapids, mi because i would serious have an addiction problem. the place is clean and the service is top notch.

44.description: 5 stars for the Club House sandwich and the cream of chicken soup!!

24.description: Great family breakfast place. Super friendly staff, huge portions, great value for any family visiting the area.  Lots of breakfast choices, too!  Conveniently located by Midway and hotels.

7.description: It can be really busy here! They have quick service and the food doesn't take that long to be served. My favorites are the veggie skillet and the Popeye omelet. Both come with your choice of a side of toast or pancakes, they also are served with hash browns. My family has been coming here for a long time, we always get breakfast any time of the day when we come.

49.description: If you are looking for a good neighborhood, family-friendly restaurant with great service this is the place. My family meets there once a week for breakfast. (Chandra is the best!) It has become a meeting place because we run into neighborhood people we have not seen in years. Great soup too!

40.description: For business travelers like me staying at the fortress of midrange hotels near Midway Airport, the Top View is a much-needed refuge from overpriced, prefab hotel breakfasts.  Only a short distance from the hotels by car or (safely) on foot, the Top View provides a well-prepared breakfast using high-quality ingredients, in a clean and friendly environment.  And the price is about half what you'll pay in one of the hotels, with food that's at least twice as good.I've only been here once, and just for breakfast.  So far I'm completely satisfied and I'll be back.  I had the Eggs Florentine and my companion had bacon, fried eggs and potatoes.  All our food was first-rate quality and inexpensive.

30.description: My friend was staying near the airport and wanted to get breakfast before she left. This place had good reviews on Yelp, so we went. This is a standard American diner. There are skillets and eggs and pancakes. I had two eggs with pancakes, which were good, and the coffee, which was a little weak (which is why I deducted a star), but unlimited refills. My friend had their French toast, which she said was delicious. She also said the OJ was good.Personally, I thought this place was dirt cheap.  Two breakfasts with drinks for under $20 for Sunday brunch is dirt cheap in my book. I'd definitely go back if I wanted to get breakfast near the airport, but I wouldn't make a special trip there.

46.description: Almost everything I've had from this place has been nothing short of awesome, and I have yet to even try half of everything on their huge, variety filled menu because Top View has a lot of choices from different cuisines - very hard to find this kind of a big selection menu nowadays. *I completely agree with the previous rave reviews- their breakfast is the best around for taste, portion, price and service! Lunch menu and service is great too, the paninis in particular; heaping portions of meat and add ons.Biggest new perk- They just started a delivery service!

1.description: First time here and gave it a try. Not disappointed at all! Amazing food and great service. If you are in the area and looking for great inexpensive breakfast, look no further. Prices are great and did I mention the food is fantastic! Will definitely be coming back again for breakfast. Try the hobo skillet which was amazing and their French toast is really good.

9.description: I like the food here , usually we go after church with my entire family. Aunts, uncles, cousins, sister, kids the works . Great service and the food so delicious! !

26.description: We tried this on our way home from a Chicago weekend visit. I had a skillet breakfast which was extremely large and pretty delicious. This was way too much food for me, I probably should have split with someone! My boyfriend tried the French toast and he agreed that it was also pretty good. Parking was terrible! There are very few spots to park, and people were very rude to us in the parking lot. We ended up parking across 4 lanes of traffic and walking over.

25.description: Tried their country fried steak with gravy, it was great. Very friendly hostess. Great place to go for brunch with family!

12.description: Great American diner! I had the Belgian waffle and the person i went with had the steak fajitas. Both were excellent!

21.description: I had a short stack with sausage. Really good prices, good diner atmosphere. Friendly and prompt service. Watery coffee.  Fun place for breakfast....

17.description: What I like about this place is the staff! And taste too. They have a great breakfast menu and the are very family friendly. The only thing they would need to update is their deco but hey as long as food and service are great they can look outdated. ;)

10.description: This is a great diner. They have very good coffee if you are a coffee snob like I am. The breakfast food is great.  Very good omelettes and skillets. Very good prices. We eat here when we visit our on ar Uchicago. They have Greek gyro omelettes and skillets and Mexican themed items as well. The hard part s choosing. It is all good.

5.description: Love to go here for breakfast. It's the usual eggs and pancakes type of place but very affordable and good portions. Coffee is awesome too!

3.description: This place it's great! I've never personally eaten at the restaurant itself but I have ordered breakfast for delivery. The food is amazing!! Their French toast are nice and buttery and their Mexican skillet is delicious!!! Thumbs up for their food and friendly customer service over the phone. :)

35.description: This is a good breakfast place. Do not try the T Bone steak. It is watery and not tasty at all. The rest is good.

19.description: Great service. Food was good. Hardly any wait at all for a table. And the food was inexpensive. Will definitely visit here again next time I'm in Chicago. I felt like a local :)

28.description: Great food. Took a gamble on this place based on other yelp reviews and im glad i did!! Highly recommend this mom and pop restaurant if in the midway area. Skip the chain restaurants like IHOP. Top View has a huge variety and everything is cooked to order. Small, family type atmosphere, very attentive servers. I will come back.

45.description: What can I say, this place was DA BOOOOMB! Breakfast was GRRRRRRRRREAT! The menu had a very good selection and the food was plenty.. they were not skimpy at all. I will come back to this place when I visit Chicago. I thank all you Yelpers for making this breakfast a dream come true, hahaha.

33.description: Good food. Close to Midway Airport.

43.description: We came here for a post flight lunch. The place was crowded, which seemed promising, but it was a false promise. The food was awful. For the first time in her life, my mother sent a dish back. I choked down a few bites of some terrible "meatloaf," and waited to leave; unlike my mother, I didn't want to try another dish. Never again.

2.description: So I am stuck at home today . No groceries and hungry. So checked out Yelp to see who delivers. Read the great reviews and ordered. Delivery was fast ! Had the cream of chicken soup and the half chicken , with mashed potatoes, dressing and veggies. It was fabulous! Tender and juiciest chicken ever. The soup was also fabulous. My son had the grilled corned beef sandwich and soup also fabulous. They sent every condiment  you can imagine with. I will 100% be ordering again.  Can't wait to stop in also!

18.description: Just had a great breakfast here. The service was outstanding and the meal top notch. I would definitely recommend this for an anytime meal.

41.description: Top ViewI am not a morning person. But I do enjoy going to breakfast specially with good company and good food.I have been here few times and have tried different things, and everything is good.I have tried omelets, skillets, pancakes, french toast and everything is better the other places around here. Service is nice and quick. The place is simple and unpretentious.Price wise, I thing it is a deal. Check it out if in the hood.

4.description: I like the breakfast here, delicious. Decent environment and the food is fast and good.

6.description: Top View may strike you as a simple, run-of-the-mill diner, but in actuality, their food is very good and they're always packed! I usually just come here for breakfast whenever I stay with family in the Southwest side of town. They are a no-frills diner-style place, but their menu is vast. From crepes to pancakes to blintzes to waffles, they do it all. Not to mention omelettes, skillets and (my favorite) Country Fried Steak! They also have lunch and dinner options such as burgers, sandwiches, etc. I've been here a handful of times and have never had anything I didn't like. They are reasonably priced and give you good portions of food. The servers are quick and good at their jobs. No complaints there! Decent spot to grab a quick bite while you're near Midway. Good job, Top View. You got breakfast right.

22.description: It can be really busy here! They have quick service and the food doesn't take that long to be served. My favorites are the veggie skillet and the Popeye omelet. Both come with your choice of a side of toast or pancakes, they also are served with hash browns. My family has been coming here for a long time, we always get breakfast any time of the day when we come.

15.description: I love this Place,the staff is so nice and friendly and service is spot on.The food -portions are large enough to take a doggie bag.The taste soooooo GOOD!!!! I give this place  AAA+++    It has been in the neighborhood for a long time -so thats means YOU and your family and friends rest asure thats it GREAT!!

20.description: I liked out waitress.. Good people good food. However, it lacks cleanliness.  The floors needed vacuuming.

36.description: WTH!!!! I cant believe Im JUST NOW writing a review for Topview.OMG!!! Ive only been coming here for years.LOL!!! GREAT place to stop in for breakfast.The prices are relatively low compared to other places in the neighborhood.And aside from the food,its always nice to come in and be greeted by the assortment of "characters" that work here!!!! Topview is totally one of my favorite places for breakfast.Im pretty sure I'll be coming back over and over again!!!!

14.description: OK the food was good but your typical diner meal n the price was not bad either considering I had 4 mouths to feed haha. Their bacon and sausage omelets was to die for. Pancakes were good..coffee alright not great...the wait was a little long for my hungry jacks... Might come back if in the neighborhood...

12.description: This nail place is busy! We came in when they first opened at 10am and there were already full! But they took care of us right away. Very friendly staff and gave me what I wanted. My friend came with a design and they did it perfect. Bonus to this place is they have a special princess little chair for a little girl to get a pedicure soo cute!!

7.description: This place has horrible customer service ! I have had so many issues with the owner and still continued to go because of convenience.  Today was last straw.  The 1st incident was , I went in with my 7 year old daughter and her friend I wanted a fill-in and the girls there nails painted. They totally disregarded us and took other clients so I told the girls lets go they obviously don't want are money. Second incident they charge my little 13 year old cousin 40 dollars for a full set when I told them just a regular full set but instead they give her the most expensive since she does not know better, they shld have asked me! And today I go for a polish change and one broken nail and he wants to charge me $25!!!! Who the hell do they think they are. On top of tht they are rude and give u dirty looks. The owner must not get none to often. THIS PLACE SUCKS !!!

19.description: Decor was nice and the chairs are awesome!!!!  I didn't realize until I got home that I still had a lot of cracks and dead skin left.  That's the main reason I went in the first place.  Not sure I would go back, I wasn't all that impressed in general.

1.description: They were super sweet. I have gone a couple of times. The owners are always friendly and offer add-ons (free the first time, to see if you like it). They take their time to get to know their customers. Wish I could go there more often however they are slightly more expensive than other places in the area.

2.description: This salon is so bad and technicians dont know what customers requests. I will not being anyone here.Owner dont speak English and dont understand.

9.description: I came here for a no chip ($35) after a few girls from work came here and liked it. I have passed by this place before but was unsure how good of a place it was. I can walk here on my break and get my nails done! Perfect!The nail lady wasn't overly friendly at first, just talking with the other employees but eventually she made more conversation with me. She was pretty fast and they look good so far. They have a HUGE selection of no-chip colors! The lady asked if I wanted my brows waxed also but I declined. She told me it was $10, which isn't too bad.On my way out, I noticed the large amount of pedi chairs available. They also have an adorable pink princess chair for the little girls when they get pedi's. So cute. I'll be back!

6.description: My favorite neighborhood place to get a simple mani-pedi at a decent price. The staff are super nice and always make sure I'm comfortable. You can also bring in your own nail polish from home and still get a regular or no-chip mani. However, it's usually the older snobby neighborhood women (customers) who often make the experience uncomfortable. I know tattoos and piercings are still "unusual" for some people but I'd rather not be stared at the entire hour I'm trying to relax.

18.description: I haven't gone to Elegant Nails in several months and my daughter picked me up after work and treated me to a pedicure.  Sadly, my nails looked better prior to the Upgraded/Premium and over priced ($32) pedicure received.  The so called "premium" pedicure is no more than salt scrub, lotion, and hot towel that is received for regular ($18) every where else.  The leg massage was lacking as well.  I was not impressed with the service, the pedicurist continued to converse with the owner during my service and proceeded to cut one of my toe nails crooked.  The polish was not neat, you can see brush marks and some of the polish goes over the cuticle.  I told my daughter on the way there, that I couldn't remember why I didn't go there anymore, now I remember! (Last visit, requested "squared nails" and got one big toe squared and the other big toe "rounded".) Normally, I support ALL neighborhood businesses and try to frequent them as much as possible, but I am disgusted with the outcome of my visit to Elegant Nails and will not return.  Won't forget my pain again.

10.description: Favorite nail spa. I always request an appt with Jade for my no chip manicure, she is the best by far! She's fast and sometimes I file my nails to my liking when i get home but my no chip never chips. Nice owner (Shelly) usually answers the phone, she's good too.

13.description: I went in there today with a friend.  We were taken care of right away. When I told them I was on a time crunch, there had someone doing my no chip manicure and someone else working on my pedicure.  They were very friendly.  I will definitely go back here.

16.description: I've been to Elegant a few times, but this is my first time in about a year. Sad to say it will be my last too. While the owner and the salon are nice, the experience I had was less than enjoyable. I had a young male pedicurist who simply pulled and tugged at me. Also, I could be wrong but he had a timer going to ensure he hit the 30 min mark and when he did the pedicure came to an abrupt stop. This is the first time I've actually want the pedicure to end.I was tugged and pulled at throughout my whole manicure as well. The manicurist missed complete edges of my nails and didn't even ask which nail shape I preferred. I ended up with an indistinguishable shape.Ending on an optimistic note, at least the mani-pedi was only $35

17.description: Shelly does the best eyebrow waxing in the neighborhood and you can get a pretty decent mani/pedi for $35.

15.description: Yes I am writing a review for a manicure. I hope the guys on my softball team don't see this. Well anyhoo...I took my little girl here because daddy can't seem to say no for a manicure and took the liberty to get my hands cleaned up. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our needs. My daughter sat in a butterfly mani/pedi chair and got the works. She plays the princess role very well and was very pleased with her nails. I sat there and smiled politely while other customers took notice and admired our date.

0.description: Clean and modern place with a friendly and professional staffs. I had to wait about 10 minutes until my turn because i didn't make appointment when i came but it's definitely worth the wait. They warmly greeted and treated me with great care which made me very happy.  I got Spa Pedicure and it was so relaxing. The lady who took care of me was very easy to communicate with and knew exactly what she was doing. She took time to go through all the details on my nails and did a perfect job. So love it!!! Price was affordable for what i had. Definitely be back for other services soon!

5.description: Customer service was terrible i was telling a male manicurist what design I wanted and he started saying annoying comments about me then he started playing with the price of a simple plain white nails with one design saying it will be $90 after he was making fun of me. Then he was really rough with my hands pulling and tugging and didn't even do a good job on my nails. He was very rude and was not gentle at all. first and last time I go there

11.description: Customer service sucks and the nail jobs are inconsistent. First time I received an excellent no chip manicure with a friendly manicurist. Second time I came in for a regular manicure and to take off the no chip. I wanted short nails and the lady snapped asking why did I do the no chip if I didn't like long nails. Didn't realize I needed to explain my preferences and dislikes to anyone whom I'm paying for a service. In the end the manicure was good and last an entire 10 days without chipping. I returned for the third time to receive a male manicurist who already seemed annoyed to begin with. He rushed me to pick my color, rushed through everything. I paid $15 with a $5 tip for a 20 min experience. The manicure was mediocre and I smudged a nail on the way out. Didn't feel comfortable to annoy him any further with my business. Thus, my last visit to this place.

8.description: I loved this place! First time being here and nothing but praise! I had Lee and he was so wonderful, he did a great job and then some. Beautiful place and great atmosphere, very clean and nice staff. Will be coming back and I definitely recommend!!

3.description: It's my first time here and my experience was really good. They sure know how to run their business and make sure they customers will have to keep coming back for the good quality. Went in today with my friend who is a regular. Everyone is very nice and professional. They are also very easy to communicate with. I had a pedicure and manicure and the lady who did my nails did an amazing job. She took her time and did not rush. She also patiently showed me their great selection of good quality products. The place is clean and very organized. Sanitation procedures are strictly followed. Nothing to complain about this place, very happy after my visit. If you are in the area, you really should try this place if you have a chance. Highly recommended !

14.description: Not terrible, not great.  My mom and I came here for a manicure/pedicure on Labor Day.  Was happy to see that they were open and not busy.  It looks like the inside is having an identity crisis.  The manicure stations look pretty dated and the pedicure section looks recently redone.  Manicure/pedicure was $35/pp, which is A-ok in my book. Pedicure was alright- nails look good, leg massage was just long enough, but they did no work on calluses (which is one of the main reasons people get pedicures isn't it??). Manicure was alright. Usually do my own and will probably continue to in the future.  I will say my polish lasted about 3 days before it started chipping, which is about average for how long mine have lasted in the past.

4.description: Jade is the best here. She's my girl!! I love when she does my nails. The best of the best. I can't speak for the rest of the team here but nobody compares. She's sweet and gentle and very attentive. Request her! I made the mistake today of not requesting her and the male manicurist was not kind . I know how I want my nails and he kept insisting on me getting long nails when I explained I can't because I work out . And he was very pushy . He was in a rush and was pulling my fingers and over buffing where it felt like it burned . The nailed came out OK. They were too thick but I can live with it.

3.description: Decent selection,  decent prices,  but kind a smelly.There is a bar attached,  and it used to be the source of the smell,  now the smell is kind old and permanent.  I prefer going to the Tobacco shop or Archer liquors.

1.description: only had to use it two times; it's a good last-minute-I-need-tobring-something-to-the-dinner-party stop!

2.description: I was looking for a keg for my brother's 30th birthday party, but I wanted something better than disgusting miller or bud lite.  So, since Miska's is a few blocks from my house I decided to get it from here.I went in and asked about prices of other brand of beers for kegs and they looked at me like I had 3 eyes.  "You want what?  You don't just want Miller lite?"  So the manager came out and had to call to get prices for the other beers.  I decided on one and put a $10 deposit down.The day we went to get the keg, my husband was running around trying to find an ATM because they did not inform us that the tapper deposit had to be cash.  Lame.  Also, the price of the keg was $16 more than originally quoted.  We got the keg home and all was good, until later in the evening when the liquid in bucket that the keg was sitting in was starting to turn a suspicious beerish color.  Either there was a hole in the keg or the tapper was leaking beer.  Awesome.Today my husband returned the keg armed with the picture of the beer/ice water still sitting in the bucket.  After he explained what happened the manager looked at him like "what do you want me to do about it".  Then he proceeded to tell my husband that he should have brought the keg back as soon as he saw that it was leaking.  First of all they weren't open at 1 in the morning and second, is my husband really going to drive drunk to return the leaking keg.  What a moron!Next time we will go somewhere else!

5.description: It's allright for beer and liquor but I'll never buy another bottle of wine there.  3/3 bottles that I bought were spoiled.

0.description: There is a good enough selection and the one employee usually there is willing to locate something if asked (second employee during busy times). I don't often make my larger purchases here as I can save by going to Costco or Kenwood Liquors (107th and Cicero). I'm not a fan of getting wine here. Bottles are pretty dusty and more expensive. If I want great wine service I visit Mainstreet Wine shop on LaGrange at 54th place in Countryside. Same prices but true wine experts. If you're in a rush then this is surely the place to go with a large easy parking lot and there's rarely a line of more than one person in front of you. Kenwood has a small lot and gets very busy. And while the employee that is usually behind the counter is nice, he never goes out of his way to smile. Just a neighborhood liquor store without much personality. I'm not trying to talk anyone out of going here. It has it's place and doesn't have glaring issues.

4.description: Nice neighborhood store.  Decent selection of beer, wine, and spirits.

1.description: R's Looking Good Chicago Beauty Salon is amazing. Rachel is so warm, kind and friendly and made us feel comfortable about getting our hair styled at her salon. The location is centralized near Midway airport and the prices are great. Rachel has been styling hair for many years and she provided u with honest advice the hair style and what is best fit for me and my family.We highly recommend this place and she has a good price for what she does, highly recommend this place to everyone!

0.description: This is a great place for getting hairstyles, I brought my wife here and she loves it. The people that work here are very friendly and the styles are pretty unique, the hairdresser has over 30 years of experience in styling hair, great job we really recommend this place.

12.description: I really like Wing Wah and have been going here for years. It has the best chinese food on the southwest side and can argueably compete with chinatown. Unfortunately, this is not a restaurant where you are served, but you can order your food and sit inside. The employees are generally nice and if you get your meal delivered expect to have it in about 10 minutes. Wing Wah has to have the fastest deliveries out of any place I've ever ordered from. Great food, convenient, and quick.

3.description: The food was disappointing. The portions were large however everything we had was either flavorless or tasted weird.  I ordered the orange chicken, Singapore noodles, wonton soup,  and crab rangoon.   I've tried almost every Chinese place in the Garfield Ridge neighborhood, and this is probably the worst. Sorry it's true.

1.description: I went here for dinner today. This is near where I live, so we decided to go here. Good service, and fast timing. I ordered chicken noodles, which is noodles and chicken. I also ordered crab rangoon. I loved crab rangoon all my life. Crab Rangoon tasted good. The noodles were bland on my entree and the chicken had some flavor. I also tried beef and noodles. Beef was tender and had good flavor. Noodles tasted good too. I had a good experience, but the place needs to have more flavor in the noodles. Otherwise, I will come back again.

2.description: I like this place because of the convenience and the food is okay too.  I really like the egg foo young. I don't mind the beef chop Suey either it's probably what I order the most from this restaurant.

9.description: Thank you for delivering my pipping hot food in 10 minutes (even though you quoted 30 minutes) after my attempt at dinner at home ended in disgustingness and my tummy was growling with hunger.P.S. Closed on Monday

10.description: A nice little carryout Chinese place.  Very quick service and the food is pretty good.  They have decent lunch specials.

4.description: Been going here for years. Not fast food...good food fast. Always generous portions and fair prices.

6.description: This place is awesome and amazingly cheap. I used to live in South Loop so I used to go to China town all the time. As I grew up in this hood, My parents always went to Wayne Moy down the street. They changed owners and it wasn't the same since so this place opened up. The chicken fried rice is the best I ever tasted. Cooked to a golden brown and great chicken and egg ratio. Soooo good. We have ordered all dishes and are all equally good but the Chicken fried rice is too good. There was a comment on here that the Egg Rolls are the best in the city and I couldn't agree more. they are awesome and include Sweet and Sour packets. This may seem normal but a lot of places I went to don't carry Sweet and Sour (yes, weird). Very fast for pickup. you could order an eggroll or a feast and it is always 10 minutes.Very cheap. This is definitely my top place for Chinese food. Don't tell anyone!! :)

0.description: The lunch specials are pretty decent and better that they taste so good! The crab Rangoons are so delicious.. Just make sure to eat right away or else the crab Rangoon gets a little hard

5.description: I am not going to lie - for delivery food - they are pretty good. My issue is the "price subject to change without notice" policy they apply when ordering.It is also very clear on GrubHub they do not charge a delivery fee. So when the bill was $7.00 more than I budgeted - I couldn't tip the driver.  Oh wait; he got the delivery fee after I was told there wasn't one so that is his tip. Too much competition to be this shoddy and dishonest.The food was pretty good though.

13.description: Very quick on the delivery.

11.description: Got the $5.25 lunch special - beef with brocoli (white rice, but comes with fried rice), egg roll, and a drink.  Tastes yummy and fresh.  Enough for lunch leftovers tomorrow.

8.description: I've been here multiple times and it's always AMAZING! Quick service, delicious, great sized portions. The orange chicken comes with little pieces of orange in it. YUM!I was suprised to find such good food in this neighborhood. Happy I live close by.

14.description: Lunch specials are a great bargain. Seasame chicken is best in Garfield Ridge. Egg rolls are best in the city. Fast and fresh.

7.description: Wing Wah is one of the best Chinese places in town! The chicken fried rice is beyond delicious! They also serve a pretty mean sweet and sour chicken! If you happen to be in the neighborhood, you should definitely check this place out!!! Don't let the rude lady who works there turn you off, she means well!!! :D

0.description: This is an out of the way neighborhoody store located in a strip mall. The prices are OUT RAGEOUS for the quality. All of their vintage clothing is grouped together and for some reason they think it is all made out of gold since it is from the 50's or 60's. Some of the vintage dresses were marked anywhere from $15-$40. WHAT? A complete joke of a coat selection, apparently leather cost about $50/ yard? Really? Really. The rest of their items are raggedy. And by raggedy I mean that I have seen better clothing in my garbage can. I know all of the items are donated but Salvation Army's have distribution and get their merchandise not just from local donations. I would be curious to know where the good stuff they get goes......because it is definitely NOT on the sales floor.

28.description: Always looks a little dirty and gross.  SUPER sweaty servers when the weather's really hot... or even when it's not.... BUT, all in all, a good neighborhood place that you can walk up to for a decent and affordable burger and milkshake.

1.description: I've lived in Garfield Ridge for 30 years (eating there easily 3 times a week)and in that time Parisi's has had 3 different owners. Parisi's was once the place to go for a quick take out and sit by the park. They had the best hot dogs, polish, maxwell style polish, chilli cheese dogs and fries. Their chilli is still good but the beef is dry and flavorless. They used to have a big poster touting Vienna beef products but it's no longer hanging there and sadly I believe they no longer use the quality Vienna products of the past. Rick is the latest owner. Rick, I've loved eating at Parisi's for 30 years, but the quality of the aforementioned products has really gone downhill. The hot dogs are no longer red as in red hots, but now a dismal beige grey.   The 2 mopes you have working there, especially  when your not there, are going to ruin your business. They screw up orders left and right, leaving off toppings requested, adding toppings not requested. Gone are the personalities from the 80's and 90's like Laurie, who despite her age showed enthusiasm making up orders. Your current counter help look like parolees from the Cook County jail work release program, who take no pride in their work or in trying to get order out correctly. And sadly, as other reviewers have noted, they really need to take a class on food handling. I really hope you'll read this review and bring back the quality of food and service you've had in the past. I would like to be a regular again.

9.description: Great food. Friendly workers. Great place to stop in the summer for their soft serve ice cream and shakes!

29.description: Jason is clearly out of his mind. I am a Chicago south side native with a passion for beef and Parisi's is tops. I've been going for years. Although I lean more to the Dog side of things, I know good beef when I taste it.And it's not very cute to knock something as amazing as the sauce bread. For 1 little dollar you get a sammie sized piece of bread dipped and seasoned. It's totally delicious and I often buy it even when I have more than enough money for the real thing. Not because I'm CHEAP or POOR, because it's awesome!Top it off with a chocolate malt and you have a helluva dinner.

23.description: Today was the first time I ever stopped at Parisi's and it will be the last. I've past it for years but never stopped in. Well my experience was one to remember. I went it for 3 cheeseburgers and some onion rings and came out with NOTHING..... I was discusted by what I saw. My order was taken by one of the three employees. He was taking orders plus handling cash and MInd You Food as awell. That's a NO NO... So I didn't say anything thought let me observe a little more and I sure did. While I was observing the female employee sneezed she didnt sneeze in her hand she turned around and sneezed without covering her mouth right on the open package of hamburger buns. So then she called up someone for their order to pay and tendered his sale . She DID NOT wash her hands and went right back handeling food to be exact my cheese for my cheesburgers. I said I saw enough went back to the order window and called the older employee to the window to tell him Please cancel my order because I saw your employees handel food and money and No washing of the hands. All he said was oh ok. Wow ! No sorry NOthing.....Must be normal service here...

5.description: I've been heading to Parisi's for years. My first visit was in 1977 that I can remember. Not many things have changed here since that first visit and I assumed that was for the best. It wasn't. I understand the nostalgia here and that my first visit here was with my grandmother who's been gone almost 20 years. Same windows, doors, mesh screens, grill.... just all the same. This time was our first visit this year and I'm not including the good and bad visits we had in years past as we need to focus on their current quality and service. We had an awful small cheese fry order! Less than 20 total fries and cold solidified cheese. We popped the cheese in the microwave for 20 seconds and ended up with the same cold solid cheese encased by a melted plastic cheese cup. Disgusting. The Italian Beef with red sauce and sweet peppers had tasteless beef and the cheese burger was just a 1/8th lb patty (weight not listed anywhere on paper or board menus) that was much too flat and over cooked. Our meal was useless. The guy handling the food without gloves (as many cooks or chefs would if ONLY handling food) was also the guy who took our money and gave us change. Imagine the germ transfer to the food. A huge city health code violation. Their order window is OK but the pick up window sucks where they don't call a number or your name, just one food item from the order and hope no one else waiting ordered the same thing. This hasn't changed for years and is logistically ridiculous in my opinion. I've seen many people pay and leave with the wrong order. Only real strong advantage here is that it's a block south of the large Hale public park and rec center and has a huge amount of parking. Many other hotdog/burger stands in our area can't say these things and this place is lucky they have a great location as they would have long since gone out of business. I think I'll wait a bit to try them again.

31.description: Very good food....but expensive and can somebody tell me why I wait 15 minutes for a burger and fries?  And that's when there's no one before me.

25.description: Dirty, mediocre food, disgruntled employees, cash only, handling food with their hands, smell of garbage.Sounds appetizing!

12.description: Half the fun of ball games at Hale Park was getting Parisis after. Love their burgers and their fries are the best, crunchy on the outside and soft in. Whenever I'm craving a good burger, I pass Mickey Ds and Burger King and head right to Parisis. I did not grow up out here, but my kids did, and we all love the place. It's an old fashioned, neighborhood hamburger, fries and shake place that are quickly disappearing in this city. You can't go wrong.

21.description: Two words: PARISI'S FRIES. The only downside I have is that they only accept cash and sometimes it feel likes forever before you get your food. But definitely get a bag of their Fries.

16.description: I have been going to Parisi's since I was a kid going to Hale Park to swim (back when they had Girls Days and Boys Days).  I have since moved to the burbs, but go there every chance I get.  Luckily my family is still in the neighborhood.  Fries are the BEST!!  Freshly cooked to order which is why you might have to wait a few extra minutes.  Red sauce sandwich is the best .. even as adult.  My kids are teenagers and have brought their friends to Parisi's to eat.  It's a neighborhood establishment that has been around forever.

17.description: I never ever would have known this place existed if my best friend had not showed me. I was skeptical at first but after trying a hot dog and cheese fries I was hooked. Even my dad had never tried this hidden gem and he's lived in the city most of his life. They're cheese is different from everywhere else in the neighborhood and everything is made to order so it is a nice change.

10.description: Dirty, mediocre food, disgruntled employees, cash only, handling food with their hands, smell of garbage.Sounds appetizing!

11.description: Nothing fancy here.. It's literally an indoor window where you order and pay on one side and pickup on the other.  It's a neighborhood staple for hot dogs, beef sandwiches, and ice cream cones in the Summer. I'm pretty positive it's cash only and they have a small counter inside to eat at.

26.description: Just one of the neighborhood joints I grew up with as a kid. But, what's the best? Haha, my favorite... a strawberry sundae and chilli cheese fries! Love Parisi's!

27.description: Alot of 5 star ratings for this restaurant which I can't understand?  The food is good, but it's not one of those restaurants that has that 1 sandwich that keeps you coming back.  The beef is good, chicken sandwich- good, milkshakes are good but nothing I couldn't live without.  The restaurant has been here over 40 years so that in itself is quite an accomplishment.  The workers have no personalities and never add anything more than a robotic order taker could do.  You'll often see them handling your food (buns, chicken breast, cheese, etc. ) with their bare hands.

0.description: A Staple In The Community.I've Been Going Here Since I Was A Kid Ordering Beef Sauce. LOVE THIS PLACE.Rick Is A Generous,Humble,Caring Good Man Who Employs Neighborhood Kids At This Place And He Is As Friendly As You Can Get With Him Being A Business Owner.The Italian Beef-Rocks!Italian Beef Combo-Rocks!Fries-Rock!Classic Chicago style Hot Dog-Rocks!Italian Steak Sandwich-Rocks!Do You See A Pattern Here,Everything Is Good,Tasteful And Priced Appropriately. Clean Environment, Amazing Food,Courteous Staff & Professional Demeanor Make This Place A Favorite.

20.description: Love this place! I've been eating here since I was a kid. Doesn't look like much but has by far the best Chicago style hit dog anywhere.

19.description: I grew up near this hot dog stand. I moved away and still stop here for my dog, beef sauce and fry. The banana shake rules and the beefs are outstanding.

33.description: I used to stop here for goodies when I went to day camp at Hale Park MANY moons ago; didn't even know it was still open till I visited mom last summer and drove by.  I made a hot dog run for dinner that night..still delicious as ever!

2.description: Not as good as I remember as a kid, but still solid. Their Chicago style hot dogs are great, albeit small. Still love the gravy bread and those fries after all these years. The soups are always a crowd-pleaser. I am pretty sure they use frozen beef for their Italian Beef sandwiches, which makes them not my favorite. It's a cash only, divey hot dog stand, so not much else to say. As kids we used to dip the fries in the soft serve ice cream....so try it!

34.description: I've been going to Parisi's since I was a fetus.  Probably my favorite place to eat in the whole world.  Their Chicago hot dogs are top notch.  Vienna dog, steamed bun, mustard, onion, a little cucumber, celery salt, tomato, optional sport pepper.  Fantastico.  Their fries are amazing, their burgers are fantastic, and their beefs are great as well.  Running low on cash?  Try a sauced bread--basically a beef sandwich without the beef (red sauce or gravy, your call).Pepper and egg during Lent is great too.

32.description: I have about a month and a half worth of reviews piling up here thanks to my friends on Facebook who suggest beef sandwich places to try on the south side of Chicago. Afterall, I'm the South Chicago Authority on beef sandwiches.After tasting Parisi's beef sandwich, I knew this one had to be moved to the front of the pack to help warn as many people as possible in these rough economic times. Save your money. I've tasted bad - this is worse.I ordered a beef sandwich, dry with giardinierra peppers - my standard sandwich as defined at JayRodChicago.com. When I said dry, I didn't mean for the meat to be dry, as it was. I meant do not dip the bread. When I asked for giardinierra, that means I should taste the juices - if not the mixture - in every bite. It doesn't mean toss some on top to make it look colorful and pretty! And I won't even get into the bread. There has never been a more true statement than a previous reviewer's post that there is definitely better italian beef in the neighborhood.If I was starving, I probably wouldn't even get a sauce bread, which is what they serve for the low-budget customers. Stick to whatever else you sell, Parisi's, but do us all a favor and correct your Italian beef recipe!

18.description: Two words: PARISI'S FRIES. The only downside I have is that they only accept cash and sometimes it feel likes forever before you get your food. But definitely get a bag of their Fries.

13.description: Maybe it is because I have coming here for years but I love the food here. Here is what I would recommend:hotdogs, italian beef, italian sausage, itslian steak sandwich, hamburgers, ice cream, ice cream shakes and the fries!Yes it's greasy and it's not the healthiest but it is delicious. Most people get the food to go but there is a counter there where you can stand and eat your food. When I am hungry or in a rush I will always go here for some food. I would try to avoid the usual weekend lunch rush because it gets busy. But the food is delicious!and yes the beef sauce and the red sauce bread is also pretty good.

4.description: As I said last time, I have been here for as long as I can remember. I came today for a small lunch. I had a vanilla shake. It was rich and the flavor was great. I also had fries with cheese. A small bowl of cheese is good enough. The cheese is good, and the fries were tasty and good flavor to it. It's only a walk from my house. The service is good. If the guy with the glasses is there and your kids are there (forgot guy's name), he might give you cookies for your children. They don't have a lot of employees, and they are the same almost every year. That is why it takes a little bit of time for your food to be ordered. I will be coming back.

24.description: We who grew up with Parisi's love it, and for you first-timers who have expectations that you are going to a restaurant, I ask what is on your mind when you actually walk into this hot dog stand and don't see any chairs.  If you are that picky, and these negative reviews are probably by non-native Chicagoans, then go to Portillo's, and enjoy another good sandwich that, by the way, tastes exactly like the sandwich at Parisi's.  It's a neighborhood place for neighborhood people.  As kids, we could only afford the 15 cents sauce sandwich, and that probably went a long way to gain our loyalty.  Aren't our favorite foods emotional in nature, taking us to a time when we enjoyed the experience.  It's been there 50 years, probably still closes down in the winter for a few months, but there is no better place on a summer night.  If you are doing the Triple D thing and touring around the city, you may not find Parisi's food to be the best, and truthfully, we only want you to go there so that you spend enough money to keep the place open for the loyal fans.I live in California now, but Parisi's is a stop for us whenever we go to town in summer months.

6.description: Good for getting a quick lunch/munch on the go, but not an everyday thing (ice-cream/sweets, ok, but not hotdogs or burgers). The place seems a bit outdated, and that should be fixed.The burgers and hotdogs here are kind of dry... But the fries are just wonderful.The service is decent, but not spectacular.Over all, just another mini spot to have a food break.

22.description: Maybe it is because I have coming here for years but I love the food here. Here is what I would recommend:hotdogs, italian beef, italian sausage, itslian steak sandwich, hamburgers, ice cream, ice cream shakes and the fries!Yes it's greasy and it's not the healthiest but it is delicious. Most people get the food to go but there is a counter there where you can stand and eat your food. When I am hungry or in a rush I will always go here for some food. I would try to avoid the usual weekend lunch rush because it gets busy. But the food is delicious!and yes the beef sauce and the red sauce bread is also pretty good.

15.description: Grew up off 63rd and this was a part of my childhood. I love the breaded Italian steak sandwich n milkshakes !! Large fry is a LARGE !!!!Long live Parisi's

7.description: Was at Parisi's today for the first time in a loooong time.I live in the neighborhood but Im always busy eating out everywhere else.lol.ANYWAY,I had totally forgot about how good their ice cream and milkshakes are.And I just looooove their Italian steak sandwich.Perfect place to eat on a nice summer day.Im sure I'll be back.And as far as the decor goes,I dont mind it.Just glad they're there serving up those sandwiches and milkshakes to gowith it!!

8.description: I've been a customer since 1957!!  Great Family owned drive in with Great Food. Even though we moved out of the area years ago, We still go back for "Hot Dog Wednesday"!!

30.description: Good food but notice they handle the food and the money without washing their hands.  I have never seen anyone wash their hands in that place.  No gloves either.  Board of health needs to get in there.  GROSS

3.description: I used to come here as a kid when I needed to eat after playing basketball for hours at Hale Park down the street. I haven't been here in almost 8 years and today I had a sudden craving for Parisi's. Well, you know I always follow my cravings and drove from the north side of Chicago to come get some food. I ordered a cheeseburger, gravy bread with mozzarella cheese, and a bucket of fries. A m a z i n g. Reminded me of when I was a kid and it made it that much better to fulfill my cravings. Def need to come here more often!!

14.description: Parisis is the best. Their Italian steak sandwich with red sauce is amazing, you must try it! They're milk shakes are also very tasty. The place is old, they're clearly not trying to impress anyone and they don't have to!!! The food does that for them. As for the people who work there, they work in either very hot or very cold conditions because the place doesn't have air conditioning.... Cut them some slack!!!! Go to Parisis!! Support small businesses!!!

1.description: I been coming to Marcela for 11 years. She is very professional. Everywhere I go I'm asked where I get my hair done cause it's not easy to have my platinum blonde. I now carry her business cards lol. I tried a different place once because I moved far and it was the biggest mistake of my life! Now I don't care about the distance. I will never trust anyone else with my hair!!! She's very honest and you just have to trust her opinion. I have black hair and I'm a platinum blonde and my hair is not damaged. You have to trust her advice always. She's been doing this for many years. She's the best!

2.description: I have been coming here for years and I am always treated like family.  Very small salon, its only Marcela (the owner) and her daughter working there, but its a professional salon thru and thru!  Plus where else can you get an eyebrow lip & chin wax for under 30 bucks?  I LOVE my girls @ Vega Mar!

0.description: My first experience with Marcela was when I was 18.  I had gone with a friend to another salon that was on the same block to get an up-do for my senior prom.  Hours after getting it done at this other place, my up-do was falling and looking bad.  In a panic, I went back to that salon and they said that the person who did my hair went home.  So, I went to Vega Mar to see Marcela.  She saved the day!  She gave me a beautiful up-do, even better than the first one the other person did.About a year or so later, she then saved my hair another time when I went to get it dyed like a red wine color and this other salon messed it up and gave me Ronald McDonald red color hair.  I went to Marcela, and she fixed my hair beautifully without any damage.  I knew that this woman was not only a great stylist , but he was a person with a heart and who truly cared about making sure her customers walked out of her salon looking their absolute best. Her prices are very reasonable and also can do waxing services if needed.  I have done my eyebrows and parts of my face and she know hoe to deal with my very sensitive skin,  She offers other skin care services to help tighten the skin and all sorts of great things.  She always continues her education by going to classes and bringing in new techniques for beauty, which proves her passion for her work.She uses products that do not have ammonia or any hair products that are linked to hair loss or damage.  She knows how to deal with all kinds of hair and skin problems.  Having Marcela in my life has solved my beauty needs in every way.Marcela is stylish and knows how to produce all the trends.  Never look for another stylist again once you are with Marcela.  I love her! Ella se habla Espanol tambien!

3.description: Willie's Wax Works is one of the best things in the Southwest side of Chicago. A candle shop run by a nice and helpful person. The prices are very reasonable. The candles come in all shapes, sizes, and flavors. Willie makes the best candles in the whole city. So if you are looking for a candles or candle related materials, this is one of the best places to go. Plus it is good to support a local business.

1.description: Good place for candles from a good guy. He does know what he's doing.

2.description: I like Willie's Wax Works. It seems out of place on 63rd street, like it should be on the North Side somewhere, but oh well. The candles here are nice and burn evenly and cleanly.

0.description: Hands down the best handcrafted candles made by a passionate expert. Factory made candles do not hold a flame to these artisan candles (sorry). Superb customer service -Willie's passion for his work is evident not only in his creations, but in his interactions with customers- he truly goes above and beyond to make their shopping experience easy, informative, and fun.

4.description: Handmade candles sold by an aging hippie...what's not to like?!  He is very friendly and helpful.  My favorites are his mulberry and vanilla candles.  The candle and scent lover in your life will love a gift from Willie's!

12.description: Tasty sandwiches , but close early :( and the owners are super friendly, everything is very fresh sandwich wise, lol and for those of u wondering , they do not have a parking lot , but the street around there is closed off so u can find parking, I've been there twice and enjoyed the sandwiches unfortunately due to the time they close can't go often , way better than subway

7.description: I received several recommendations from fellow pilots all the way down in Florida, they say "Mom & Dad's deli have the best subs on the south side." I must say I totally agree, great food, friendly staff and excellent view of landing aircraft into Midway! A great stop for aviators, locals, and tourists alike. Enjoy!

3.description: We passed this neighborhood deli a whole bunch of times-and we finally tried it, because of a craving for corned beef and the recommendation of my stepson. Mom and Dad's did not disappoint...rye bread was uber fresh and tasty. The corned beef (we chose the hot corned beef sandwiches) was sliced thin; lean, fresh and tasty. Portion was't huge but definitely enough to satisfy.  They will customize your sandwich-we asked for easy on the mustard, I added a slice of cheese, and it was done up right. Sandwiches were served with a dill pickle spear. Potato salad was obviously homemade and quite delish! We tried to order online via Yelp, some "technical difficulties" and the order was not ready when hubby arrived for pickup. I recommend placing your order by phone! BTW, it was very clean inside, a family operation. There are a few other items on the menu that sounded great, so I am sure we will return. Italian subs, anyone?

1.description: I usually don't give a 5 star rating for a restaurant like this the experience was near perfect - matter of fact first 5 star.There was cases of soda stacked in the corner the entrance door was worn down - really who cares? Not I The bread was fresh, the hot Italian was near perfect the people that worked behind the counter worked to get you fed not to earn a big tip.In my books it was a near perfect experience. After all the meaning of restaurant to me - get the hungry you-satisfactorily fed.I'm sure others will disagree please consider the above just my 2 cents.

2.description: I travel 30 mins+ to go to this must place. You are always greeted at the door and feel like your at home.There homemade daily soups are just incredible. There Italian dressing for the Italian sub is the reason I keep coming back. One time I was coming in on a day were they weren't having their chicken and wild rice soup. I called them to ask them to save me a cup of it and I would be in the next day to order a sand which and get it. The next day when I came in I ordered my sand which and told them about the soup I called in the day before. The lady at the counter remembered and I got my delicious soup. A must stop if your in or around the midway area.

9.description: Fresh sandwiches at a reasonable  price. My favorite is the footlong american. Workers are always super friendly when i call in my order.

10.description: Great neighborhood place for deli sandwiches. If you order the special of the day, the price is pretty good. I can vouch for the Chicken Salad and their Reuben/Corn Beef sandwiches. Very good. Good portions. Mom and Dad are also very friendly.

13.description: Good deli sandwiches. Quick service and good prices.  Had a corned beef sandwich and it was tasty, quick and cheap. A great choice close to Midway. Not much for ambiance, but would be good for takeout.

16.description: Walk into this place and you can't help but imagine how this Midway Airport neighborhood looked in the 1950's.  Actually, it probably looks the same, with the exception of some additional potholes and some cheesy wall mounted billboards.  All in all, I found this place to be a secret (at least for us suburbanites) little gem. Friendly folks at the counter, quality food, and reasonable prices.  I partook of a really tasty roast beef on wheat, and the other stuff looked great as well.

17.description: If you are ever flying Ultimate, and you're starving, and maybe sat I meetings ALL day; then I highly suggest stoping and grabbing a sandwich. This people are very sweet, and the food is good.

15.description: Located in between and down the street from a few dive bars,  an alcoholics anonymous meeting place and more factories than you can shake a stick at,  Mom and Dads deli is always serving it up with a smile,  even though the customers may not.  This is pretty basic fare but in my opinion the only decent sandwich shop around.  Faves are the tuna on wheat,  Italian sub (ask for extra mustard though)  and the roast beef.So if you are broken down on your way to the Airport or drunk at one of those stinky ass bars,  grab a sandwich,  a bowl of soup and give the lady behind the counter shit for charging .25 for a refill on your pop.  She will defend this decision with piss and vigor!

0.description: Amazing. Stopped by for a sandwich while I was in the area and it was definitely quality. I ordered the roast beef with jus and it melted in my mouth. Now i know where my sandwich stop is next time I'm around the area!

5.description: Not the best sandwich and soup combo I've ever had, by any means. However: The service is efficient and friendly. Nobody comes here to admire the décor. But the food was fast, good, and cheap. If that's what you're looking for, this is perfect. If you're trying to have your socks blown off, better try somewhere else. Mom & Dad's is not going to be featured on any Food Network shows, ever. I just couldn't bring myself to knock off any stars because this kind of place simply is what it needs to be and it fits its own bill perfectly. One note: the bread (Italian roll with sesame seeds) was just about perfect.

11.description: Just like Mom used to make! .... *shakes head at own bad joke* Anyways...  I am never disappointed when I eat here. Small family deli with all the fresh ingredients. What's not to like? In a neighborhood flooded with grease traps, expensive restaurants, and bar food, Mom and Dads stands out and delivers.

8.description: If you're around the midway area and looking fresh sandwich and soup stop at Mom & Dad's deli. Have been coming to this place for years and have never been disappointed.
