Your sandwich is made fresh and their potato salad is great. This place makes you feel at home. Their prices are very reasonable. Got to try it.

4.description: I don't think you will be able to find better sandwiches in the area. The soup is also excellent.

14.description: great sandwices

6.description: I've been coming here for 20 plus years. This is a great south side place with good food. The sandwiches and salads are both very good here. There are better places around the city but this is still a quality place. The owners have been here forever and are super friendly. Dont think they have made a lot of changes but it still works. I recommended the italian sub, american sub, garden salad, roast beef sandwich and potato salad.

3.description: LOVEEEE this place!! Ive been to many different tanning salons and this one is the best. The prices are good and its super clean. They also have awesome specials and the girls that work there aren't rude snobs like the other places!! Best salon in Chicago!

1.description: Clean place. a little pricey. I think I paid $6 or $7 for lay down. However, they do offer specials on certain days.

2.description: Great new establishment. New owners are great people, super friendly and accommodating! They've got great competitive prices and good beds. Always clean and stocked with great products. You won't be disappointed with this new salon. Very happy here!

0.description: My first visit and this place is very nice. Prices are affordable, place looks clean and staff was extremely friendly & welcoming. I'll definitely go back.

4.description: Best tanning salon ever!  I've been in a few times now, for the high performance bed and an airbrush tan.  My tan looks amazing!  I was a little nervous because it was my first airbrush tan, Kelly made me feel so comfortable, and it looks so natural.  Definitely buy lotions here, they are cheaper than anywhere else I've ever seen.  Love this place, will definitely be back!

1.description: I love this place. They are so professional, yet caring, compassionate, very knowledgable and helpful. Eileen in the pharmacy has always been wonderful, and has gone above and beyond time and time again. Highly recommend!

0.description: Have been diagnosed with varicose veins so need to wear the support stockings.  I went to a medical supply store closer to home at first to see if they could help.  Unfortunately they were not able to bill my insurance, so, upon the recommendation of the wound care nurses, went to Doubek's Medical supply to see if they could help. Not only were they able to help me out, but they did all the footwork for me, getting the referral needed and working with my insurance, as well as taking the time to show me how to put the stockings on and how to care for them.   These folks are highly recommended.  They are very professional in what they do and as an added bonus, friendly and extremely helpful.

12.description: Was working in area, heard Cafe 63 was a good mom & pop place for a good lunch.   Menu wasn't anything extraordinary.   But the food sure was.   Ordered basic cheeseburger, may be the best burger I have ever had.    My son had a BLT, basic stuff.   Except it had 1 pound of bacon on it!!   12 slices to be exact.   Soup was amazing too.  Ordered basic chicken soup but it was anything but basic.   Had lots of flavor, spices; tasted like a southern jambalaya.    This place comes across as a regular, basic restaurant, it's not.    It's a whole lot more.   Love places like this.

3.description: We tried the newly remodeled place for the first time and indeed it was an excellent experience from the decoration to the stylish plates that they use to serve the meals on, and the food was excellent as well. I tried the veggie egg white omelette and my honey ordered the cheese burger with fries. Nice taste perfectly cook.Friendly atmosphere greeted by one of the owners That came to greet us few times to the table making sure we where doing good.

1.description: Unfortunately I have to update my review. After a recent experience: my grandma wanted to go out to breakfast and we ended up at Cafe 63.It was a Saturday morning and my grandma has her favorite spot picked out at a table since it is hard for her to get in and out of booths. When we went to sit the waitress said sorry you will have to sit in a booth we save the tables for families... Even though there were 2 tables open and the place wasn't crowded... My grandma didn't complain but it was very frustrating that she had to squeeze into a booth and be uncomfortable. Anyways, my cousin ordered scrambled eggs and they came out sunny side up at this point we were already running late and she didn't want to wait to have them remade when they should have been made right the first time. This wasn't that big of a deal until I talked to my other cousin who had been to this restaurant recently and said she ordered a burger and they gave her a chicken sandwich... How do orders keep getting messed up.  The worst part was what my cousin pointed out how the waitress was preoccupied with flirting with a man at the counter instead of the tables.Wouldn't have been so upset with this place if they would have accommodated the elderly better as Cafe Rene used to. The best part is no family came in to sit at the table and all of this could have been avoided. Probably won't be back.

2.description: My husband and I ordered apple pancakes, they were regular pancakes with canned cold apples sandwiched in between.  When  I told the waitress that the apples were cold she brought back new pancakes with microwaved canned apples on top. Our waitress was friendly but odd, she was kinda loud & wore a very strong smelling perfume. She shook her wet hands on us when she finished filling my glass with water. I really wanted to support this mom & pop place but It is below average. I can make a better breakfast at home and with better quality ingredients.

9.description: Went here for breakfast with my 5 year old son. Ordered a skillet and my son wanted the same but I didn't want to pay full price for one, since he will not be eating it all. Checked the kids menu and they have an option to have HALF of anything on the menu for a fraction of the cost. Love this idea and I think more restaurants should be doing this! Great atmosphere, cheap pricing, great food. We needed this in our neighborhood. Will be returning to try out lunch/dinner.

10.description: Very rarely do I give 5 stars. Not many good dining options in this neighborhood so I expected same old same old. Wow. Felt like I was eating in the west or south loop!!  Amazing!!  We over ordered so we can try interesting items-special note goes to: Texas style corn beef hash, biscuits & gravy and praline pecan bacon. Delicious!!Very attentive wait staff  Home made and cooked to order-come when you're not in a big hurry. Can't wait to go back for lunch options!!Came back again 9/4/15-they don't open for breakfast until 8:00-don't get it. Very disappointed. Had to drive to Sammy's. Lost revenue for you.

4.description: Chicken Parma The best in the city. This is what this neighborhood needed, a good restaurant with fresh ingredients, homemade sauces and soup. Try the specials. Very clean restaurant. Has a great vibe to it. You know what I mean? Where the owners make you feel at home. The place gets busy because it's good but if you come at the off-peak times you get more personal service.

6.description: Had the Fiesta Omelette with chorizo, jalapeño peppers, onions and cheddar cheese, hash browns and Texas toast.  Everything was ON POINT! Coffee was consistently poured throughout our meal. Waitress was beyond efficient and courteous. It was a bit eerie because she knew how I'd like things before I even said anything (hash done hard, hot sauce rushed to my table and ice with my daughters apple juice). Chocolate chip pancakes were gone soon after arriving at our table - yummy!

0.description: Nice little spot to eat in the Midway area. Modern style and plating, great food smells coming in.The coffee was decent and they had packets of French Vanilla, and other various flavors for your tastes (alongside regular cream). Boo and I both ordered corned beef sandwiches, one with Swiss and one with American cheese, both of which were respectively good. Fries were also done well, with a flavor that reminds me of Brown's Chicken fries for some reason. Nice little throwback for me.I didn't want a red meat coma but I should have ordered the burger anyway; someone else had ordered it and it smelled amazing, coming on out.Server Rita was attentive (the breakfast sandwich she was eating during breaks looked really good too, actually), and owner Dale made his rounds to make sure everyone was doing okay. That one is important!Only drawback is that given the circumstances (I came around noon and I'd say it was less than a third full) I felt like I had spent more time there, overall, than I usually do at a restaurant or diner for breakfast. I could imagine that perhaps the kitchen is small, given the property's own size. Granted, I have no problem waiting for a good meal. However, I could see this becoming an issue on a busy Sunday morning; especially when people find out about this gem, and want to come back.

5.description: I love this place. Food is always fresh and yummy... A must do people!!!!!!!!!!

13.description: Excellent breakfast. I had the steak and eggs breakfast with an English muffin at no additional charge for only $10. Generally cheap breakfast steaks are a bit chewy and not the best cut. I found this to be the exception. It was very tender and the marinade they used was delicious. The eggs were done perfectly and the hash browns were delicious as well. My co-worker had the oatmeal which came with fruit and and English muffin and he was very satisfied as well.

11.description: Only been here twice for breakfast. Food is top notch, but what really stands out to me here is how nice the staff treats their customers. Service is excellent. Dale the owner is a very cool guy. I mentioned something about a Chicago Fire Dept. Patch that was displayed at the front counter which brought back some great memories of my Dad, a 35 year veteran of the CFD who just recently passed away. Dale offered to get one for me. A week later he called me to come pick up the patch.  Class act right there!

8.description: Went to the southside for brunch on the recommendation of my brother and I'm so glad he told me about this place. It is a perfect neighborhood gem. For a first timer I would suggest the corned beef hash skillet.  Entirely different then the normal canned hash but delicious all the same.  They also sell delicious dip s, try the pumpkin dip for the fall.  The staff is very kind as well.

14.description: Went here for the first time a few days ago.  This place has the potential for 5 stars but they need to work on a few things. The restaurant is small but inviting.  It was clean and sort of cozy.  We were greeted by a very friendly lady at the register and seated immediately. The food all tasted good and the coffee was good. Now for the negatives that only allow me to give this place 3 stars. The table was wobbling so bad that one little bump made me lose a 1/4 of my cup of coffee.  Sorry,  but that kind of stuff needs to be addressed immediately. My coffee went empty and we waited quite awhile while our waitress stood behind the counter and stared off into space.  Finally a different waitress came by and filled our coffee.  My neighbor was dining in there and was seated in the booth next to us.  He ordered the 1lb bacon BLT. It looked great but he informed us that it didn't have any mayo on it and was sort of dry because of that. My wife ordered the same and loved the sandwich,  however,  she had to ask for mayo as well. I've never heard of a BLT not having mayo BUT if you're going to serve one without it,  you need to inform your customers and ask them if they want it because most people expect it. My son ordered the bacon waffle but we didn't see any bacon in the waffle and he ordered praline bacon but was brought regular bacon.  When we inquired with the waitress she said that she never heard of it. We informed her it was on the top of the sides menu.  She went and retrieved a menu and brought it to the table, I assumed to show us that we were wrong but sure enough it was right at the top. She went and checked in the kitchen and informed us it would be a 15 minute wait.  The good thing was that she apologized profusely and did not charge us for our son's order of bacon. If you want 5 stars,  you have to train your servers better. They should at least be familiar with your own menu before you have them waiting tables on their own.  The last bit of advice I could give is that some of the portions are small for the prices. I ordered the skillet which tasted good but looked underwhelming.  For $8.00 you have to serve a bit larger portion than what was in that skillet. When I go out to eat I should never leave still feeling a bit hungry and unfortunately here I did. I hope they take this review for the constructive criticism that it is because the last two restaurants at this same location failed miserably and deservedly so. Café 63 actually has a chance to make it here if they just put forth that little extra effort to make people say WOW instead of it was ok. We unfortunately have enough "ok" places to eat in this neighborhood and this place can and hopefully will be a great place to eat.  I plan on stopping in a few more times to see what happens.

7.description: I feel like I'm being generous by giving them a 2 star review but alas I feel like I must so that maybe they see this review and make some positive changes. The hubby & I went a couple of times and unfortunately won't be back. Here's the short version:First visit: Amazing!Second visit: Total disaster! Strike 1: Still frozen biscuits, returned dish. Strike 2: ONE slice of unmelted Kraft cheese on skillet. Strike 3: Hair in skillet!Strike 4: Reheated mushy inedible biscuits. Strike 5: There won't be one because we're not going back. Our first experience here was wonderful. The place is small & cozy with a small parking lot in the back and the waitress was attentive. Hubby had the Apple pie French toast & loved it. I had the bacon milkshake (amazing!) and the 2 eggs with hash browns and bacon. Service was fast and food was good. We were excited to come back. Our 2nd visit was disastrous and is the reason we won't be back. The whole time we were there for breakfast, there were only 3 other occupied booths, so not very busy. Waitress was nice & we placed our orders, a Cafe Renee skillet & an order of biscuits and gravy. We waited about 15 minutes & the waitress brings out the biscuits & gravy. She apologizes for not bringing out my skillet but says she didn't want the hubby's biscuits to get cold. He starts digging in while I watch him eat & immediately see a look of disgust come across his face. The biscuits were still frozen! Strike 1!Waitress comes around with my skillet & "toast". When it's white & soft it's not toast, it's just white bread. Didn't say anything because well, it's just bread. Waitress apologizes because it took so long to get my food and says the chef made it with egg whites the first time so she made him redo it. Honestly I would've been fine with the egg whites if that meant actually eating together with my hubby. Hubby does tell the waitress about the frozen biscuits & she apologizes & says she will make chef make it again from scratch. Ok...so now I'm eating & he's just watching me eat. As I look down into my skillet there's exactly 1 slice of unmelted Kraft cheese. I realize this isn't a fancy place but really!? Not even real cheddar cheese? And it's not even melted! Strike 2!Alright whatever I'll just mix it together & make it melt myself. I pick up my first bite of food & what is on it??? A hair! Alright, clearly we're not meant to enjoy our breakfast today. Strike 3! Waitress comes around with the "redone from scratch" biscuits. Finally, we get to eat together! Nope! Hubby takes 2 bites and he's done. Biscuits were the same ones just reheated in the microwave making them mushy and you could just taste the freezer burn. Completely inedible. Bleh! Strike 4! We pretty much gave up & didn't say anything anymore. I don't know if the chef was just having a really bad day because some items from the other tables also got returned. Another patron did complain about the toast & another table also got their order wrong and returned it. I'm really not sure what happened between the first time we were here and today, our second visit. Waitress did come around with a small free orange juice for the inconvenience, but I don't think anything could've made up for today's breakfast disaster. We won't be back.

12.description: Wonderful place to eat.  I have never had a bad experience here.  The wait staff anticipates your needs before you do, the food was cooked exactly as ordered and the prices are very reasonable.  You should ask for Bettie to be your waitress, by far the best in the place.

7.description: Bettie is the best, we walked in sat down and she didn't even need to ask and just brought us the amazing cream of chicken soup

3.description: This place has easily become my favorite breakfast spot. I have yet to be disappointed in any of the entrees I've ordered. I usually get a skillet but I haven't  tried them all yet. The soups are all good. My kids love the cream of chicken soup on the weekends. The pumpkin pancakes are phenomenal and my hubby loves the liver with rice. I don't have to drive to surrounding suburbs anymore for breakfast good as this place is great and the staff is super friendly and know how to make customers feel at home

1.description: Such friendly staff! Our waitress and host was very attentive. My husband and I shared a country skillet and biscuits and gravy. Country skillet was good with nice portions of bacon and whole sausage links. The biscuits and gravy lacked flavor and we didn't even finish it. My husband also tried the pancakes and he liked them. I tried a strawberry shake and it brought me back to my days as a little girl drinking Nestle Quick....yum! Overall it was a nice experience and good eats.

2.description: This is a classic breakfast/lunch diner, and a decent choice on Chicago's far Southwest side.  Majority of clientele are regulars, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Food was decent: table ordered skillets and they were pretty good--light on potato (a common sin among breakfast places) and heavy on fixins. TIP: Do NOT order the coffee. I would have given this place four stars, but the coffee was HORRIBLE. Go with juice or soda.

9.description: This place is a gem! It's only downside is that they are only open for breakfast and lunch. But not once did I have a bad experience. The staff is so friendly and he owner is always there to greet you and seat you. You feel like family when you go. Now to the actual meal...The food is very generous! They serve you a good amount so be real hungry when you come. Prices are like any restaurant you sit in. They serve soup with your lunch which is awesome. Not a lot of places do that anymore. If you have breakfast definitely order the pancakes. Sooo good and big!! I also tried corned beef hash and really enjoyed it. A must go if your in the mood to sit and hang out with the family or your best friend!!!

10.description: The service is great! The waitress constantly refills your coffee and is very attentive to how your experience was. The breakfast is a typical diner breakfast eggs, sausage, pancakes ....the only thing I would recommend is finding another pancake recipe. The pancakes are chewy (means they have too much eggs) . A thicker batter with buttermilk makes for a better pancake.

13.description: ABSOLUTELY THE VERY BEST PLACE FOR BISQUITS AND GRAVY THAT I KNOW OF!!!!!!  Great service ALWAYS!! Ive tried their other dishes as well and have never been disappointed.Totally recommend.

17.description: great food...and the service is fabulous...friendly, polite and a nice family atmosphere

15.description: I just had breakfast at this place with my boyfriend. The service was horrible. We arrived before a party of 3 adults and two infants and another party of two and watched as they got coffee first, got soup one minute after ordering it, and got served their meal first. It took 10 minutes just for us to get coffee, 20 minutes to get the 1 cup of soup we ordered and about 35 minutes to get our food. This place was not busy for a breakfast place and now I see why. The owner was informed and was not decent enough to give us a discount. They tried to quiet us by bringing 2 cups of soup instead of just one and then giving us a chicken noodle soup bowl because our food was taking longer than usual. Thanks but no thanks. We werent looking for your free food. We wanted good service with reasonable wait times. Thanks to you I was late for an appointment that I had more than enough time to get to. My problem is that I informed them I was in a rush and they continued to serve other people while getting my check and a box for my food which I could not even finish eating because I had to rush out. I will never go back here and I hope you dont either.

0.description: This place needs no advertisement. People judge places by their exteriors quite often, but in the end, it's all about quality, and this place has exactly that. The staff is highly experienced, and as professionally attentive as it gets.While I grew up coming to this place on occasion, I haven't stopped by in a while, and the only change I've noticed is their care for quality service has grown. (Either that, I just started to pay attention more.) Regardless, I was taken care of as soon as I stepped in, and only waited a short handful of minutes before the Country fried Steak Plate I ordered came out. It was as delicious as I imagined it to be, and they took the time to make it look as great as it tasted.Their prices are remarkably fair, and everything about this place feels like home.I sense this restaurant is reaching the end of an Era, so be sure to stop by before you miss out on an all too authentic and caring experience for a dispensible price.

5.description: It's been at least ten years since I was last here and I really wanted to enjoy this visit due to some Yelp friends convincing me that it was better than I remembered. It is just as I remembered and I doubt I'll be heading back. When we entered the owner greeted us and found a seat we liked. Then the waitress came right over. I can absolutely confirm that service here is great and you feel like a personal friend. We were let down by the food. My friend ordered the Princess Skillet. Seemed to have a great mix of ingredients and was just what she wanted. The cheese was cold and unmelted and the hash browns were unseasoned, unsalted and tasteless. What a huge disappointment.I ordered a simple two eggs over easy with corned beef hash and hash browns. The eggs were good with the corned beef hash just a bit too crusty for my liking but that would have been OK. My hash browns were tasteless and even after I added a good amount of salt they still didn't taste good. I think possibly they were too wet when cooked and with with no salt or seasoning when cooking them they just couldn't be saved. The restaurant is quite clean both inside and out. I was initially worried as the grass outside was overgrown and the parking lot looks quite aged but things were clean and even the bathroom that shows it's in a 30+ year old restaurant was clean and smelled fresh. I wish the food here had been better. This could have easily been a five star review. I hope this information helps improve things there.

11.description: Finally found that breakfast place I have been looking for, in the area.  The owner and staff are so friendly you cannot help but enjoy the experience.  I am so sick of going to other familiar chains and asking why I am waiting 25 minutes for seating, just to eat breakfast. Anyway, at Dallas Restaurant, the food is good; I will be back again and again

8.description: Bettie is the best. Great customer service. Pretty sure she can read minds.

4.description: A great find.  Nice atmosphere.  Very friendly owner.  Superb server.  Ample free parking.  Delicious food. McLean bathroom.  I portions.  Moderately priced.  Clean overall.

14.description: A trip back in time to the late 70s/1980s when more of these Greek-owned family style diner type places dominated the restaurant scene on the southwest side. This place is spic and span clean and neat, the service was friendly, the menu includes traditional favorites like breaded veal cutlet, and the food didn't disappoint -- meaning it wasn't gourmet fare, but was carefully prepared and tasted the way food from these places has tasted for over 35 years!

6.description: A great find-nice atmosphere, excellent food, and very generous portions!!!!  Owner was so very nice and service was superb!!!

1.description: Okay I use to go here when it was el gallo tapatío and it was good then but now when you dine in you get soup along with your chips and salsa. The food here is good nothing too spectacular. I like going to small holes in the wall and this is what kind of place it is. The workers usually only speak Spanish but I'm okay with that because I speak their lingo. It's still cash only. I order here a lot since it close to my house and never had one complaint.

2.description: Previously called El Gallo Tapatio, this place serves up great food, fast service, at very affordable prices.

0.description: ive gone here under the previous name as well. great rice water, salsa (all 3 of em) fresh tortilla chips, and hands down the best pastor. i would drive from mckinley park for the pastor here. they are really nice also. yummm in my tummmm

1.description: So we hopped over here after a few drinks at Twisted Shamrock because I saw this place while driving past it.Monday Night ~8.30p, came in for a drink or two to feel this place out. I parked in front of an apartment building which made me think of zoning issues but we walked in here and everyone in tthe bar, some seven or so jaunty looking men looking at my friend and laser her to a seat.I get the gin n tonic which was super weak. I understand icing down beverages, but when the ice exceeds the bendy straw, I have a problem. This was the case.The regulars seem like neighbors and nothing more.Fly by if need be.

0.description: Happy hour never looked so good. Blink and you might miss it-Helen's Lounge is located at 5942 W 63Rd Pl caters to an anxious after-work crowd but once the drinks start coming, the ties start getting loose.

1.description: Do you like watching planes coming down?  Do you like hunting bargains?  Do you have lots of people to feed?  If your answers are "YES" on all three (3) questions, you need come and check this place OUT!This place is located near the Midway Airport, on S. Cicero.  The planes are coming down fast and furious (not exactly that fast...it's approximately 100 mi./hr....so that they can land at 75 mi./hr. once they reach the ground).  Well, let's forget about the physics for now.  My point is that if you don't mind hearing noise from airplanes constantly, you may shop there.  Fair warning, people: most items are about to expire in the next thirty (30) days or less, so mind your business and be very familiar with your immune system.  Yes, they are cheap, but will you die from consuming those things?  I'm not going to answer this question for you...obviously.  I saw some cookies have turned colors even though they were not yet expired.I personally thought the banquet frozen entrees were over-priced.  For $1.99 on a chicken-finger dinner, I know Jewel-Osco will have better prices and more varieties.  One of the older-lady patrons randomly shout out "check prices before making purchases" after I made a comment on the price of the frozen entree.  I guess she concurred.  They have lots of canned veggies, unknown-brand salad dressings, and unknown-brand spices.  Well, they aren't exactly "unknown;" they were made in Bedford Park, IL.  Hey, that's literally across the road on S. Cicero.  For some reason, their packaging is very hokie.  Based on what I saw, I wouldn't trust on those spices or other Bedford Park made merchandize.  However, I do trust the Miss Swiss marshmallow hot chocolate.  I purchased two (2) pack of the six (6) pouches; each pack was $0.99.  I got some skittles as well: two (2) regular packs for $1.00, about the same price as Walgreens' when they have those on sale.  This is a great place to find bargains, if you're willing to take chances.  They do have household cookware, personal hygiene items, and accessories.  You can tell that they've been circulating around different venues for awhile.  Evidence?  The aquafresh toothpastes were in the late 90's packaging.  Yeah, it means that when I was 14, I used the same version of toothpaste.  I really don't need to imagine what brushing teeth will look like using expired toothpaste.

9.description: Okay let me do this finally!My partner always brings items from this "PLACE". And although the prices ARE cheap, so are some of the items. Well, as some of the reviewers have stated, its like russian roulette, you get various items depending on what is out there, or better yet WHAT'S EXPIRED~! Okay so you can't win em all. Many of the food items are about to expire if not already expired. I for one do not eat expired foods just because of what I do for a living. But you will definitely find yourself bargains here. Maybe your in need of a toilet seat that fits your regular crapper but the hole is fit for a baby. A nice 12 pack of pink snowballs (yum), and a selection of Chicago Memorabilia, well the kind that is lost in the past. I did buy some quirky 5 x $1 postcards with the SEARS TOWER FACTS. Yes, you heard it here, it is the SEARS TOWER and NOT "What cha talking about WILLIS tower" (poor Gary Coleman). But I digress. I was not really impressed, but will say that I was happy with some of the items I purchased.It was an experience and I may try them again in the future because I saw some self stick flooring that definitely will be purchased for a quick do of the hallway of mine. If you like bargains, than yes, get it! But if you are up tight and froo froo about items than this place may not be for you. Oh I did see a lady in front of me who pulled out COUPONS and it was hilarious how they took them, not sure if it was store coupons or sunday coupons but it was still cool to see. Check em' out, on the corner of Cicero and 63rd, they snuck in lights that say Lots for Less, Uhhh no your not, speaking of, I need to comment on lots for less. Here goes.....

23.description: This is an interesting place to visit if you are in the area of Midway Airport & looking for super-cheap packaged foods, personal care items, or housewares.  They sell merchandise that seems to have been unwanted or cast-off by bigger stores due to some sort of damage or irregular condition, there are labels such as "Irregular" or "Salvage" on much of the merchandise, some of the packaging is slightly to severely damaged, but the contents are still saleable (I guess) and prices are marked down in proportion to the condition of the merchandise.  They also carry a few unusual/quirky things, I found a fun item that apparently had a previous life as a promotional hand-out for an intestinal medication, it was a coffee cup in the shape of a smiling human stomach, and it was quite the bargain at only 33 cents!!

12.description: I've passed by this place and finally stopped in. The name says it all. You never know what you may find. With the economy the way it is, bankruptcies are on the rise and the stuff makes it here. The selection includes toys, clothing, food, auto, office supplies, kitchen gadgets, tools. Some of the food is past its expiration date (but is prominently labeled as such). My find on my visit was a 4 foot tall sheet metal frog lawn ornament for $5.00. I did pick up 2 food items: Starbucks coffee ($1.99) and LU raspberry and chocolate cookies (.50). Both had recent expiration dates. I am finicky about the freshness of my coffee but one month past its expiration date versus 80% off of the normal price is a tradeoff I'll accept. On a subsequent trip I picked up some Peet's coffee, even better than Starbucks.I've stopped by here from time to time and my only tip is if you see something that's a good deal, pick up extra because it will be gone next week. I've seen pallets of gourmet or organic items make it here. I've bought (not outdated!) DeCecco products (pasta, tomatoes, olive oil), Cascadian Farms granola bars, organic cashews and other goodies for a half or third of the regular price.Update Dec 2009: Shopping at this store allowed me to be extra generous with donations to food pantries and toys-for-tots campaigns during the holiday season.

21.description: I have been going to Continental Sales for nearly 10 years. I love the store. You can get many useful items for cheap. I love days such as Fridays where 99cent items are reduced to 77cents a piece, this mark down excludes food items. Tuesdays are known as no tax tuesdays  and Wednesdays are great for seniors. Many useful items for a great price, highly reccomend anyone to check it out and see what ya find!

16.description: There should be a sign that says  "come on down and rip me off."I have resisted sharing this gem for quite some time.   In these tough times I must share.I first entered Continental sales when I was about 7.  It seemed odd,  smelled odd and the people there seemed like toothless street urchins.  When I asked my father " why is this place cheaper than da Jewels?"   In his deep South side accent he replied,  "when ders a fire or a train flips over day bring da stuff here."   True enough pops.The parking lot is full of massive pot holes,  you may twist your ankle,  you may get splashed by a car,  and no one really parks squared off.  To avoid these hassles pull in at the south end of the lot.There is no regular inventory,  so a little luck can go a long way.  I will spare you the details of some things I have sold on e-bay from here.  Today I bought an  Indian curry,  three for a dollar,  I am eating it right now and it is better than three Indian restaurants I can think of.  They have three different flavors.  I bought an organic whole grain cereal for .99.  And some pretty stellar modeling kits for my boy,  they were 1.99.Like I say the  inventory is a mystery,  I went there for toilet paper and all they had was single play cardboardy individual pcs.Extra Virgin olive oil $3.99 for a litre  there are 12 different brands,  two of which are excellent.Hostess cupcakes still up to date,  1.991# bags of restaurant coffee packs,  1.99And so much much more.

17.description: Shopping at Continental Sales is a very interesting experience.  It's a blend of about 50% food and beverage and 50% general merchandise.You have to be in right frame of mind to get the most out of your visit.  You can't go shopping there for something specific - you will only be frustrated.  The mix of merchandise changes constantly.  Also, you can't expect the same ambiance as Nordstrom's.  You have to be in a somewhat adventurous mood and looking for bargains.  The prices are rock bottom and some of the stuff is cool.  Remember that toy that people were paying $1000 for on e-bay two Christmases ago - well it's probably at Continental sales for $2.99 right now along with toilet paper from a bankrupt paper products company.  Also, Continental has some items that you cannot get anywhere else.  Once we bought a coffee cup in the shape of a pancreas for a dime.(It was a drug company promotion for doctors and the excess inventory ended up at Continental).

10.description: I love Continental Sales.  Every time I go there are different products.  Always a great buy.  You should sign up for the coupons that are mailed. At the end of the month and sometime during the month there is a coupon for 20% off your purchase. An even better deal.

5.description: Great place to go when you have some extra time and want to save money buying food and electronics. You'll enjoy walking into this place.

11.description: This is a cool place to find some great items at discounted prices!  I frequent this shop often and I am always surprised with what I find here. Some great items that would cost way more at other stores can be found here.  Some are name brand and some are not, but no matter what just stop in you never know what you might find. Manager Rita is also great to deal with, she is outgoing and friendly but as I found out she is only there part time. She is a welcome member to the team!

22.description: Buyer beware.  Big time.  A large, messy, unruly collection of merchandise ranging from a set of four aluminum tire rims for $18 to damaged bags of dog food for under a buck.  What they mean by salvage is items that are the trash items (overstock, irregular, unsalable products, and things like that) from other businesses.  This place pays to take it away, and then sell it dirt cheap to you, the consumer.  OK, maybe for a pair of sweatpants, or a set of starter pots and pans.  But when it comes to food, that's something I would steer clear from.  I have seen some pretty bizarre colored mold growing on the bread here more than once.  They have daily discount specials, like, No Tax Tuesday, Dollar Friday, and Senior Wednesday.  It's an interesting place, because of the weird and eclectic selection of merchandise.  The place is usually quite busy, and is always on the look for new employees, so it is also always understaffed (i.e. really long lines.)

0.description: This place is the best!!!!!  They sell a lot of different things and food some of it expired or almost expired. But don't be so bougie, dry goods don't just magically go bad the date stamped on the box.

20.description: I've passed by this place and finally stopped in. The name says it all. You never know what you may find. With the economy the way it is, bankruptcies are on the rise and the stuff makes it here. The selection includes toys, clothing, food, auto, office supplies, kitchen gadgets, tools. Some of the food is past its expiration date (but is prominently labeled as such). My find on my visit was a 4 foot tall sheet metal frog lawn ornament for $5.00. I did pick up 2 food items: Starbucks coffee ($1.99) and LU raspberry and chocolate cookies (.50). Both had recent expiration dates. I am finicky about the freshness of my coffee but one month past its expiration date versus 80% off of the normal price is a tradeoff I'll accept. On a subsequent trip I picked up some Peet's coffee, even better than Starbucks.I've stopped by here from time to time and my only tip is if you see something that's a good deal, pick up extra because it will be gone next week. I've seen pallets of gourmet or organic items make it here. I've bought (not outdated!) DeCecco products (pasta, tomatoes, olive oil), Cascadian Farms granola bars, organic cashews and other goodies for a half or third of the regular price.Update Dec 2009: Shopping at this store allowed me to be extra generous with donations to food pantries and toys-for-tots campaigns during the holiday season.

19.description: I have been going to Continental Sales for nearly 10 years. I love the store. You can get many useful items for cheap. I love days such as Fridays where 99cent items are reduced to 77cents a piece, this mark down excludes food items. Tuesdays are known as no tax tuesdays  and Wednesdays are great for seniors. Many useful items for a great price, highly reccomend anyone to check it out and see what ya find!

2.description: I always like to come here when I'm in the area. The lines are a long wait but that's because everyone can see how cheap these prices are! If every store was like this, we would live in a better place. But of course, there are reasons for such low prices. Sometimes the food is off days, and occasionally can cause major problems. I don't know, you don't know what you'll find there. One time, I got a large pack of Dove candy bars and some orange Mountain Dew, not expired and at a good price. Another day I just walked out with some hard fruit snacks and disappointed. But it's usually a legit look most of the time. Wish it was closer!

18.description: I have visited this store on several occasions and always find the parking lot packed and people coming and going.  They now have a new sign outside the building which advertises their specials.  We went to the store during the Christmas season and during these tough economic times, it was bustling.  There were toys, holiday items, food and beverages, household cleaners, household items, health and beauty products, auto products, etc.  You never know what you will find but you will always come out with a cart full and the prices are so reasonable that your purchase did not made a big dent in your wallet.They have a mailing list and you can receive a flyer monthly and get coupons for extra 20% off your entire purchase!  Not just on one item like in some other stores.  They have monthly raffles too.There is always an employee on the floor to direct you and answer your questions.  You don't get that in many big retailers today.But what striked me the most was that low income familes were able to purchase  products for their families and the children were so excited to be able to leave the store with a toy, socks, a snack, etc.  I never saw such happiness on a child's face.Keep up the good work Continental Sales and staff and thanks for the great deals!

13.description: DOLLAR BUSTER FRIDAY. (everything 99 cents goes to 77 cents).NO TAX TUESDAY. (self-explanatory).There is a lot of junk here, but sometimes you will find what you need (ex: inexpensive floor mats for your car, rope, misc. items). Good for buying outdated puzzles/activity books/stickers and cheap school supplies (by which i mean of ...okay... quality). My mom won't take me here anymore because she knows we leave with a lot of junk we don't need just because it is so cheap. The food is often expired (I once saw a pack of brownies in the clearance section that were almost a year overdue) so be careful when looking in that section.

4.description: Save your time.  It's not that great.  I stopped in on my way from the airport and thought it was a regular grocery store.  You can buy shampoo, soap and cleaning supplies for cheap, but I'd bypass on most of the food.  I bought some rock hard granola bars, got a good deal on flat sodas and some aspirin that crumbles instantly as soon as you put in your mouth.  If you are looking for a deal, clip coupons or go to Big Lots.   I'm not exactly sure why people are ranting and raving about this place.

6.description: You never know what you're going to find here.  I mean you literally have no clue, but you can be sure that you will find something interesting.  While wandering down the aisles a few months ago, my wife and I found good quality dive fins for an unbelievable price.  We had JUST ordered a pair of the same fins for her to try snorkeling during our upcoming vacation and they cost more than three times as much.  You know I was fuming when I saw these at the store.  I grabbed a pair for myself and they are the best fins I have owned.  There are always food items on sale, some of which come from hoity-toity places like Whole Foods, but have expired or are close to expiring.  There are also great household goods and sometimes decent clothes for great bargains.  Now, just like at the Dollar Tree, you have to understand that the entire store is not full of these gems.  In fact, many of their items are generic and over priced.  I'm sure they make money on these items as well because many people shop there thinking everything is on sale for a fraction of the price they would pay elsewhere, and that is simply not the case.  You have to look for the deals.

15.description: I buy a lot of stuff that is past the expiration date.you are taking a chance but most of the time it has been delicious to eat.i like the store for all the friendly people who work there as well as for all the money I save.if you sign up to receive their add every month you get a sale paper that saves you a lot of money and usually twice a month you get a 20 percent off coupon..you will be doing yourself a big favor if you visit this store.i drove by here for years and I finally decided to stop in and I am sure glad that I did.i stop here at least 3 times a week because almost everyday their stock is bringing out something new.dennis h.

7.description: Listen, I KNOW there are  a lot of things I wouldn't buy in a resale/expiration date place, but there are some damned good deals to take advantage of here!  I frequent this place a lot for party items, office items, last minute gifts, blah blah blah!  It's addictive!

8.description: You can ALWAYS find a great bargain here! Jyst make sure you grab it when you see it because it may not be there tomorrow!

3.description: I checked this place out after reading a few reviews. And true enough you can find a few great deals I like the fact that you can get a few or you can just get the case. Plenty of things to choose from so walk slow.. lolI will be back soon and I will be looking for more great deals..Thank you my yelper friends

14.description: I don't believe in paying "Full Price" for anything so this place is right up my alley.Who cares if the box is ripped I am going to throw it out anyway.Who cares if the labels missing I am paying less than half price.Spices,marinades,canned goods all the stuff that's overpriced in the regular stores can be got at a bargain here.Inventory is different every time you come so it's always interesting.I even found an inflatable John McCain Weeble to punch everytime I read one of Rahul's threads. Awesome!!!!!!!

3.description: Mi Tia restaurant was actually really good when it first opened up in the Clearing neighborhood (about 5-6 years). Health department even shut them down at some point. Not sure what happened but the food sucks now as well as the customer service. I cook way better Mexican food! Will never go back!

1.description: The menudo is not good! It has a layer of grease floating on top. Once you skim it off and try to eat it the flavor is very bland.  I've had their tacos and tortas.....they're ok. El Gallo Tapatio one block down is way better!

2.description: Great food. Love the beef tacos and guacamole. Consistent quality and fast accurate service. Check it out if you live in the area!

9.description: We order pick up here every once and a while. Great tacos, tortas, orchata, but my favorite and hubby's favorite is their chilaquilles with egg and steak. Yum!

10.description: Tacos is delicious and very cheap!

4.description: Nice little family owned spot. Cheap food and quality products.  The quesadillas are some of the best I've ever had...HUGE and cheap! They offer pumpkin flower, which is such a treat! there horchata is always tasty, great gorditas, tacos, and breakfast. My favorite are the tamales de oaxaquenos..filled with chicken mole and steamed in banana leaves, these aren't to be missed. Don't forget the carnitas and pozole on the weekends!

6.description: Don't get me wrong the food is great....But the service really sucks!!!  I've waited for long periods of time just for my order... I figured calling for pick up would be easier...would you believe I still had to wait 45minutes after I walked thier in 10minutes..... REALLY!!!  I will never go back thier again... I even made the mistake of recommending it....now my friends second guess me.....Arg

12.description: I was super pumped to move into Clearing/G-R for the Polish goodies, but regentrification and shifting populations means that the area is becoming a little less anglo and a little more diversified. And that, my friends, is a good thing.La Tia is just a hole-in-the-wall shop that you'd probably miss if you drove by. I discovered it on a walk through my new 'hood and had to stop in and see if this place deserved a return trip or not. When I walked in, I felt like I'd walked into a tex-mex heaven of sorts.Everything I've had here--everything--has been nothing short of excellent. Once again, I have to give some love to their tostadas, because they're absolutely fabulous. Topped with beef, avocado, tomatoes, and some yummy salsa verde (if you ask nicely), it's really just delicious. Their tortas are 'okay' but then again, I don't really like tortas. Tacos are piled high with goodness. Their fries are just okay....it's clear they're not a specialty, so if you can, order chips and salsa instead of fries for your side. And, they deliver straight to me. Anyone that brings me food so I don't have to haul my cookies around is darn good, if I do say so myself. La Tia is getting my repeat business, for sure.

5.description: The meat here is not the best, neither are the bathrooms but it really bothers me when I see them put my order of rice in the microwave. I haven't been back there since.

13.description: I use to go to this place faithfully because their food is good but today I learned that their service really does suck!  I come in place my order, pay and sit down..10 minutes pass and I see a woman place an order and within 15 minutes she gets her order.  She looks in her bag and says to them "Where are my beans" The cashier tells the cook, she gets beans.  Finally I get up and say, "How much longer will my order be?"  Cashier says, um, what did you order.  I tell her she says, soon......I sit down, now after 26 ninutes, I get up and I ask the cashier, "Did that lady get my order?"  Cashier says, Um yeah I think so....Are you kidding me?  So Cashiier goes to female cook and female cook looks at me and says um, we make.......So I say, If its going to take too long I'll just take my money back......They open the register, so I try one last time, and say " Well If you can take something off for me or a break somewhere for my sitting here for 30 minutes, I'll wait.........She goes to the female cook, says something to her, and she comes back and says, no........Unbelievable, I say to her, well you just lost a customer and she says, ok..........Very dissapointed because to me customer service is just as important as taste, so they lost me.........

11.description: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST TACOS, GORDITAS, TAMALES I'VE HAD. The food has ABSOLUTELY no flavor, it is disgusting. I promised I will NEVER EVER go back to this place. The food is horrendous and the service is just ok. It seems like they just cook the meat and chicken and put absolutely no condiment in there. Its just plain Nasty!

8.description: Great little Mexican restaurant!! We get the chicken tamales usually weekly from here! Great family owned business. You can call in your order and they will have it warm and ready asap!  We love stopping here for tamales but we love getting their food to cater all of our family parties.  I love they have the $ 1 taco specials back! They also have a new catering coupon in the local paper !!

0.description: Ok,  I have been a big fan of this place for a long time..  It is a small, quaint, family owned and operated restaurant that fits right into this fast changing blue collar neighborhood.  I sure miss going to this place now that I have moved out of the area. I used to eat at this place at least once a week, mostly would take advantage of one of the daily specials, $1 tacos, $3 tortas or $1.50 sopes.. My favorites were the steak tacos and the sopes (nopales and chicharon con salsa verde).  I also recommend trying their enchilada dinner and their breakfast options..  Very tasty and nice portions. Overall this place is very inexpensive, the service is good, but just a tad slow, so be prepared to wait, it will be worth it.

7.description: The 2 stars goes to service 3 stars for food. Tortas are not that good, how hard is it to make a sandwich,  but somehow it just doesn't work.  I like the Chilaquiles with steak just about $6 for a decent full meal. Try the homemade quesadillas, in blue corn maza also,  SO HUGE and delicious. Get the taco special used to be $1 now theyre like $1.30 but definite improvement on taste and fillings, not skimpy and tasty. Vegetarian gorditas are good also try the nopales or potato ones. I really wanted 2 get them more stars. However it seems 85%of the time I call I get hung up on. Happens so much they must not wanna make $$. My business had gone down the block where they always answer and make my food to order, better more authentic flavors. But what can u expect for this area. You want great mexican with 5 stars head to pilsen or Villita.

58.description: I have been ordering Vince's for years, not sure why I haven't reviewed it until now.Well, Vince's is great. The owner is so passionate about his food and its quality, that he almost comes to tears. They have thin and thick pizza, stuffed, pan,calzone pizzas(up to 18"), regular panzarotti, and even a "Romana Pizza"(thick crust, spiced fresh tom. and sauteed spinach in garlic and olive oil.) The pizzas alone will keep you scrambling for what you REALLY want to order before you change your mind again! 23 toppings(check first--some are premium and dbl. premium).  They have appetizers, salads ,GREAT sandwiches, pasta, seafood, FRESH veal dishes ,ribs, chicken (broiled, fried, sauteed, and var. Italian)and steaks.The only dinner over 10-11 bucks is the veal, so it's great food at low prices. There is almost too much good stuff. It takes me forever to decide what I am going to order.If you took the food and put it in a restaurant up North, in a bland/sterile setting, you would be charged double or triple of what you pay here, and it would be worth it. Instead, the atmosphere is very blue-collar, South side, dark interior. It may seem even more so if you are not from the South side. Big deal. It's clean and the food is great. I mostly have it delivered, but have eaten there. It's laid back service, for sure, but no complaints from me. The stuffed pizza I had delivered this past week came PIPING hot. PIPING! No cold orders here. If you wait a bit longer for delivery, it is because they are actually caring about the quality of how it is made and tastes, not because of some scam delivery dis-organization.[-cough-Palermo's-cough-].The reason why it is not 4 stars because of it's drabness look and slightly slow waiting service is because the food TRUMPS any negative aesthetics here!Try it. Try many things.

56.description: Best pizza around.  Forget all the corporate places like Giordano's and Home Run Inn.  Vince's is not pretty inside.  It's a dive place and pretty run down.  The outside looks kind of like a bar/strip club.  The people are pretty rude when you call to order your pizza and they like to yell at other people when you're on the phone with them.But, this place has been around forever.  With all the other pizza places coming and going - this place stays for a reason.

29.description: Vince's Pizza and Restaurant is hands-down the best Chicago pizzaria.  The homemade pasta dishes and Chicken Scarpiello with marinated peppers are always thoughtfully prepared and upon asking learned that they are also homemade. Since 1972, our family and friends have been enjoying Vince's. Many other places have come and gone but none have measured up to the consistency and flavor of the food from this establishment. We just had a deep dish pizza for dinner and felt compelled to share our review. Again, we were NOT disappointed. Do not leave Vince's until you try the bread pudding. I even have a northside friend who will not open her door unless I bring her a to go container of this heavenly treat.

42.description: My boyfriend and I live down the block from Vince's and we always get our pizza from them. It's always so good and I've never had a complaint. Last night we had 2 friends over and ordered a pizza with sausage, green pepper and mushrooms. First the delivery Guy wouldn't come up to our 3rd floor apartment to deliver the pizza. Then 2 hours after I ate I was super sick and puking! I thought it was aomehong else until today when my boyfriend and our 2 friends were always very sick. So thank you Vince's for the awesome food poisoning, I will never order from them again.

23.description: Im exploring the full menu. I had a bunch of the items and enjoyed every one of them so far. The prices are outstanding for the quality and quantity.

47.description: My daughter and I were making a connection in Midway and learned that our 2 hour layover had turned into 4 hours.  What to do to with that time?  We decided we would try to find some Chicago-style pizza somewhere near the airport, and, through Yelp, my daughter landed on Vince's Pizza.  Tried to rent a car and the cheapest one available at the airport was $112 plus tax.  Guess not!  Vince's is just 3-1/2 miles from Midway so we took a taxi ($11).  We ordered spicy chicken wings, minestrone soup (I love soup and I LOVED this soup at any price, but $1.50 for a cup?!?), deep dish pizza (the smell of the cheese when that pizza hit our table was so wonderful; we just knew the pizza would be too) and some bread pudding (very flavorful but very different from the bread pudding I'm used to).  Also had two glasses of wine (very generous pour) and two coffees.  All the food was yummy and came to $34 including tax.Best part of the whole experience was the waitress Stacy, who is part of the family of owners.  She was super helpful in every way, and got us all fixed up with our return transportation to the airport.  She even walked us out the door and pointed out the bus stop for the bus that would take us directly to Midway ($2 pp and runs every 15 minutes).  We had such a pleasant time at Vince's and it sure beat cooling our heels at the airport.  Try them out if your travel permits.  You'll be glad you did!

8.description: We love their pizza and have it often... So yummy!

31.description: Angel hair and meat sauce is the best I've had in a long time!  Definitely will be going back.

34.description: Stopped in while at the park for just some appetizers.  I guess we should have just stuck with pizza.  The jalapeno poppers were of the frozen variety so not very good.  The chicken wings were terrible.  We did not feel good after we ate them.  The decor and facility looks like it needs a Restaurant Impossible makeover.These other reviews about the pizza being great should have been a clue to just order pizza.  Definitely don't eat the wings!

16.description: We order Vince's pizza for delivery all the time and have never had a problem. The bf loves it, I like it a lot (just not AS much as he does). Last night we ordered pizza as usual but this time a couple of us ordered pasta -- fettuccine alfredo (added broccoli) and linguine with muscles and marinara sauce (added mushrooms). First of all WAAAAAY too much sauce on both. Not sure if it was just the chef that day or what. For me, it made the pasta not taste as good. I was able to remove some of the sauce but there was still so much in between the noodles. Calm down on the sauce guys!! Second, the mushrooms were canned -- if you claim to be "authentic Italian," I think you should use FRESH mushrooms. And third, besides the broccoli tops/florets in the alfredo pasta, they also had the stems, but they were HUGE stalks! Who puts the stalks in pasta? I have never gotten alfredo pasta with broccoli that had the stalks in them, it's always just the tops. I thought that was very weird. So I guess bottom line, stick with the pizza and only do delivery (as I see other people have had problems with the staff and the inside of the restaurant is dirty/shabby).

13.description: I've got to say, if you want a quick regular pizza - Vince's is the way to go! Vince's special pizza is my go-to. This is the type of pizza that leftovers are always great. Not sure what it is in the pizza - sauce or dough, but it's sure a treat!

11.description: I was raised in this restaurant. Seeing how my family owns it..... I live out in the suburbs and take my friends to the city to get the best pizza. I've been all over the world and this pizza is still the best. Like all restaurants it has its high points and low points. No place is perfect.  I saw someone complaining about waiting 25 min for a pizza. You have to be kidding me. That's not a long wait for pizza. Plus all the other food on the menu is top notch. Tried everything on the menu and love it all.  My uncles are always changing up the specials and for the price you get your money's worth.

39.description: The pizza was decent but the service not so much. First off, the place looks like a dive pizza restaurant. Nothing special.The newer waitress failed to tell us the time it would take for us to get the pizza and she also didn't check on us very much. How rude!

37.description: Tried Vince's for first time tonight. Great sauce! Nice sweetness to it! Great dough/crust! Golden! This was delicious!

0.description: Great pizza! We bought it once one day for the first time and order more the next day! The worker I talked too were so nice and told me the menu since I didn't know it my only frown upon them was the shrimp dinner which you only get like 5 shrimp :(

38.description: My husband traveled to Chicago every week for several months and discovered this place and ended up eating here weekly.  I have been twice while visiting Chicago and agree with him that Vince's has great pizza and a friendly atmosphere.

51.description: A-OK for food, I'd give them 4 stars for the food, but the facility is a Dive with dirty bathrooms and sticky booths. Sit at a table, they are the closest to clean. If the food wasn't so good, I wouldn't go here at all. Beer is almost cold, glasses are always warm, bar and bathrooms smell like grandmas basement. Have it delivered or pick it up.

27.description: The pizza is some of the best thin crust I've had in chicago. Generous toppings,  sauce, and cheese. The side salad for 2 bucks is crisp and refreshing. Love this place!

32.description: i have always been a fan of this place. im 53 years old and have been going here 521/2 years. never had the buffet but the pizza is on my top 3 places.the pasta is excellent too. i love the lasagna[$9.00}. other pasta dishes are good too. this is the type of restaurant i love. great food with inexpensive prices.

54.description: The best in town! Heard it straight from the Italiano's mouth & from me mexican pizza freak! I love theIr pizza & everybody I invite for a bite has to have their number & becomes a fan as well! On the other hand, the two brothers who co- own the place are sarcastic rude butholes but who cares the pizza is great the wings are crappy & fries suck as well. I have no complaints about the rest of the menu it is alright but then again it is not called vince wings or crappy fries or alright spaggeht IT IS CALLED VINCE PIZZA SO STICK WITH THE PIZZA! They have a full bar but who wants to hear the two brothers at their best & that's being asses! They know me well & I had to gain their respect so they no longer give me a hard time for nothing! Don't take offense from them taste the pizza & you will see why I put up with their crap! I killed them with kindness but now they talk bad about other customers to me & I feel awkward about it! So just ignore them & remember that you came to eat a great tasting pizza & enjoy!

48.description: I coach Elementary volleyball and we decided to take out team here after out season-ending tournament (and championship!!!!) to enjoy pizza / soda with all of our players and parents. Mikey took us in on a few hours notice and accomodated 40+ people with no problem at all. The pizza is fantastic and came quick, the service was suburb and we were very well taken care of for a very reasonable price. We may make this an annual stop (for our team dinners). Personally, my family and I already order pizza from here as it is. Thanks to Mikey and his staff for being so great to us and our kids. They even cut our cake for us while we took team pictures. It's good to have places like this in Garfield Ridge!!!! Thanks Vinces!!!!! Byrne Volleyball is grateful.

44.description: this place is the worst customer service ever, i called in to ask what time dine in would open and they answered me so rudely by saying i was taking up there time and not to bother them .. Wouldnt go there at all..

24.description: This is my first time here, my bf lives down the block and his roommate is a regular, this was the best pizza ( I got sweet peppers and garlic) they have fresh sweet peppers and everything is homemade! We got tiramisu for dessert and it was the best I've ever had!! Then the super sweet owner Mickey came and told us to try the bread pudding, it is the best bread pudding I have ever had and it's all homemade and fresh, the owner is a really nice down to earth guy, I just met him and I already felt at home. I will definitely be back and we took a pizza and dessert to go!

7.description: Best pizza this side of Midway. You want authenticity, taste, and a real bite for your buck, go here. And if you don't wanna make the drive, place an order for delivery. Some of the nicest, and all around professional drivers are waiting to get you what you crave in a timely fashion.

49.description: Ordered from here yesterday and was very fast with the service. I had questions about pricing since I didn't have a menu and the young lady who answered the phone was very polite and helpful.The pizza got to my house very quick and delivery guy was very nice as wellPizza delish I will be ordering from here again.

40.description: The inside is a little dark and dingy. I called my order in for a P/U. Pretty good tasting Pizza! Will order again.

53.description: The pizza is great, maybe one of the best thin crusts around. I've been going to this place for many years with family and friends. We have always enjoyed the pizza for the many years we have been coming. The sad thing is for all the years we've been coming the dining room experience has always been a bag of blah! You occasionally get good service and a nice waiter/waitress, but the service is always mixed. The owners aren't very pleasant, don't really come out of their way to express their thanks for you coming to their restaurant. Some of the waiters and waitresses over the years have complained to us about the owners as well. The pizza is great and it is a good place to get delivery/pick up from, but I'd avoid the dining area here. If you need to come in early on a Saturday night before 7 and you'll be fine.

30.description: After living in the Garfield Ridge area for almost 20 years, my wife and I decided to try Vince's Pizza for dinner last night. Worst decision we have ever made in our 34 years of being married!  Being gluten free, I was surprised to read that their menu had a gluten free pizza. I read the reviews that were written on this "hell hole", and they were 100% correct ... Terrible food, horrendous service, the restaurant looks like it should be torn down and made into a parking lot!  I won't even comment on the low life "customers" that were seated at the bar!  No other customers were in the restaurant (no surprise there), yet it took 50 minutes for an individual gluten free pizza and an individual regular cheese pizza - and no, nobody was picking up any orders, we could hear the "kitchen staff" yelling and swearing at each other!  Our waitress was a trainee, so her "mentor" was teaching her the right way ... Be rude to the customers and don't give them good service. I was only able to get another glass of wine after I waved my arms at her - my empty glass sat at the end of the table for almost 15 minutes. Our leftover pizza went directly in the trash when we get home. We love our dog too much to even give a taste!  Please close this restaurant, nothing good came out of our experience!

46.description: I bet in its heyday this place rocked. Now, this quaint Italian restaurant is stuck in an ever changing neighborhood trending toward hispanic whom I never see eat in here.Anyway..They have a GREAT buffet Mon - Fri and on Sun for under $8!Now dont think you are gonna expect some professional looking setup like an Old Country Buffet..no..this is more like Family Style from back in the 70s. But dont let that put you off.Their buffet menu is very electic. Where else on a buffet are you gonna find homemade lamb meatballs? (delicious) OR Lemon Risotto? How about Gulash, Stuffed Green Peppers, Baked Mostacolli (sometimes with lamb meat mixed in) bbq ribs, broiled, broasted chicken, mashed potatos to die for! Now this isnt all on there at once, they change up everyday and if you want, you can call at 11am and they will tell you whats on the menu buffet. They also have an xtra large sausage pizza that you can keep going back for. The deserts are great..the cinnamon bread pudding is AWESOME and different! A good change of pace from Home Run Inns buffet which NEVER changes anything up. Oh, Vinces also has fried popcorn shrimp on the buffet as well! GIve this place a try!

1.description: This place is definitely not the same as it use to be. Have been ordering here for years and we stopped ordering because our pizza was cold every time it was getting delivered so we gave Vince's a break and started ordering from a different place instead.  Every time our pizza was getting delivered cold, we never once called and complained about it. Today, we ordered shrimp scampi, (which we've had a million times). It was so disgustingly spicey hot I could not take one bite of it without gagging. Not only could I not eat it, my mother got hives from it!! This time I could not keep my mouth shut and decided to call and let them know it was not edible. I could not get a sentence in with whomever I spoke to on the phone. He was very rude and not professional whatsoever. He kept saying that "it is made every time exactly the same... The cook has been here 30 years..... Maybe your pallet can't handle it today".  I was completely caught off guard. What kind of an owner says that to their paying customers?!? I was always taught when I worked in customer service that the customers are always right. Well, this was not the case at Vince's pizza. They evidently could careless what their customers think and if they are happy with the service and/or food. My entire family has been going here for years. After today, I was so disappointed in how the situation was handled that I will make sure everyone of my family and friends do not spend another dime at Vinces Pizza.  Back to ordering Obbies every Friday night!

55.description: Have you ever wondered where all the Italian buffets are? Well, I've found one at Vince's. On Sunday after church, we can count on them for a fast lunch that is better than fast food joints. Nothing fancy, just good, homemade food, including hot entres, sides, pizza, and sinfully fattening deserts... all for under $10.00 including tax. I think the lunch buffet is available weekdays as well. You may want to check before heading out their way.

9.description: First time here....as we got back into the car....pizza in hand....the aroma engulfed the senses...making our mouths water....we get home....quickly open the box.... and let our eyes make love to this beauty....as we took that first bite.....DAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAMN!  My neighbor was right... Vince's is great!!! That sauce.....so much flavor....everything tasted so fresh... the crust was perfect...the toppings great... we are very pleased....first of many...everyone was so nice as well....

26.description: The best authentic Italian food in this neighborhood, by far! When my family relocated back to Chicago, it was our first meal out. This is always our go to place for pizza!

25.description: More like 4.5 stars. So for ~$12, each person had soup, salad, pasta or potato, and HUGE portions of their dinner entrees. Hands down the best minnestrone ever, cooked with homemade rendered stock and full of amore. So well-seasoned. Salads are iceberg lettuce, but the house vinaigrette is decent. Good homemade bread served with whipped butter. I had chicken cacciatore, which came filling an entire plate with two full chicken breasts and sauce (I usually only eat 1/2 chicken breast at a time, so this is meals for days!). It was rich, briny (love the capers), but not too heavy. Orange roughy with lemon butter was decent (sauce better than the fish), crusted red snapper special also good. One of the highlights the red sauce on the pasta -- heavenly and so fresh. Amazing bread pudding, custardy and just the right balance of cinnamon. Bar is separate from dining area, which looks like a family-style restaurant with booths and tables inside (not what you expect from the outside). The decor is dated, but it kind of adds to the charm of feeling like you're in your friend's Italian grandmother's home having a great meal. Authentic and unpretentious. This is the food of generations -- you can almost hear the years of family celebrations singing through it. There is a wonderful In Memoriam to the original Vince and his wife from decades ago. All the brothers still apparently own and run the restaurant, and one of them took some time to talk with us afterwards. A very homey place. It was the waitress's first night, but she was darling and took care of us. My friend lives in this area and loves the lunch buffet. Recommended.

12.description: Worst experience ever. I ordered pizza ($34) first time for delivery at 7:35pm before it finally arrived at 10:45.  I'm five min away.   I called at 9:45 and they said it's on it way and I called again at 10:15 and they started giving the delivery guy my address.  After asking for a discount management would only give me two free liters of pop which I respectfully refused. At the door I asked the driver to call again for a discount and after a couple minutes he just drove off.  I was very disappointed and hungry.  They never called, apologized or anything.  Very poor customer service.  I visited recently with friends for dine-in and we all agreed at the time it is very dated and dirty everywhere.  I should have trusted my instincts.  They don't care.

59.description: We revisted our local pizza haunt  after several years away. The food was still pretty good, but the waitress and service where not how we remember the place.We asked for diet cokes and she brought us diet rite without having the courtesy to explain  they sold rc not coke products. The place was empty and in spite of that, she chose to chat with the other wait staff as opposed to checking on our needs.

21.description: Delicious Everything!  I have been there twice now for their lunch buffet and it is very tasty.  Both times the restaurant was nearly empty which is surprising given the quality of the food served.  Try it out!

17.description: New to the area but always lived in Chicago, just picked up few friends from airport was told to try Vinces it was terrific. So we stopped in seemed dead on a Saturday night sat at the bar and the reason became very obvious. Seemed very clicky not very friendly at all. Ordered our drinks which were way over priced and light on the pour. Was forced to listen not only to other customers bad mouth the employees but also the bartender who acted as if she was something special (but wasn't) and an older male who looked like he worked there spoke in such disrespectful ways of the employees as he  drank at the bar. Later we found out he was one of the owners. As if the negative atmosphere, foul language, and inappropriate comments by an employer wasn't enough little fly things were all over in the ice, glasses were not washed/rinsed before using again. A side of cheese that came off a table was given to a different table, and as if that wasnt enough I overheard the bartender telling the waitress if the customer didn't bite it, she should place it back into the warmer. GROSS ! Food was ok but did not make up for the initial impression. Not only will we not frequent vinces enough to become regulars, I will not recommended the establishment either. They should be ashamed of how uncomfortable their behavior made others feel. A call to the city about the bugs,filth, and poor sanitary conditions will be the only time I mention the establishment.

10.description: My family has went here for generations, literally. If they read the reviews, the owners should remember the last name LoCoco. We ordered faithfully, always had food delivered, they never even needed our address when we called in.I absolutely love the pizza. I'm simple I like cheese only-crust is perfect, not too thin or thick, always cooked to perfection. My mother loves the antipasto salad with xtra creamy garlic dressing.Anytime I come home to visit, we still make a trip to come to Vince's.Highly recommended.

5.description: Came in with an old friend for lunch today and we really had a good time. Good quality pizzas good service and reasonable price. You should try this place out

3.description: Haven't ordered in a long while so decided to try Vince's again but it wasn't the same maybe because of delivery order. Order the thin crust pizza with pepperoni  but it got to my home cold and placed called to restaurant but person on phone said what do you want us to do make you another one. I told them my kids were hungry so they cooked pizza again in microwave just wanted to let you know but they acted like I wanted something for free. I guess that's why I haven't tried it in a long time.

35.description: I've never had any problems with this restaurant.  I've never gone in.  But everything I ever get delivered is always good. The calamari is so so so good. We're usually fighting over it.  I love the stuffed shells and the appetizers are yummy.  I recommend.

19.description: This is the finest pizza in the area by far. A long time family owned business that serves up the finest Italian pizza-ever. The rest of the country gets Pizza Hut, Dominoes, but i am lucky enough to have them right here. The sausage pepperoni thin crust is heavenly. All guest to my home are amazed by this great pizza. Friendly service for delivery, always hot and the best sauce in town people. Stop wasting your time with the place you order from just because you have forever. Vince's is the finest true pizza on the south-west side!

28.description: I've been eating at Vince's Pizza for basically my whole life. Hands down the best pizza in the city. I have tried multiple pizza places in the past but none of them compare to Vince's. Service has always been excellent , never had a problem. I will eat there for as long as their open!!

45.description: Delicious Pizza. Just ordered a few nights ago. We live in the neighborhood so it is out place to order delivery from. It is always very good, I have not had a bad pizza yet. I have also been there for the buffet during lunch. Place does not get busy, not sure why. It is cheap, maybe $8 a person with out drinks. The food they have set out is great! Vary's daily. I completely agree with the other Yelper.  GIVE THE BUFFET A TRY! IT IS GREAT. And yes, even for us Hispanic people.The only thing I would not recommend is the wings. Ordered them for the first time last week. Not so good. But since they get everything else right they get five stars.
