FYI...I found a coupon for $2 for a pizza on their website that I clicked on through Yelp.

33.description: vince, the owner is a TOTAL ASSH---E! I came to the buffet lunch for the first time.and was told by an old woman unfriendly to sit anywhere I want. I was getting my soup when I hear some one yell you can sit at this table.  when the bill came I took out my credit card and the waitress started laughing at me. go see vince she said. so I go see vince and he starts yelling at me that he is in business and has to make a profir, and can't make money taking credit cards for under $10.  he said there are signs all over the place saying that. NO that is not true.  since I don't carry cash, I had to go to my bank and cash a check, go back, and pay him.  he was so very rude he never said thank you, especially after coming back to pay him  a lot of people probably would not have!  done that.  DO NOT GET THE FISH!!  before I went to the buffet I got the walleye.  I don not know what type of fish it was, it did not taste like walleye. in fact it did not taste like a fish at all.  it was bone dry and had no taste. it felt like I was eating chalk.  it was horrible,  there also is a waitress with a blonde ponytail, who is the coldest unfriendly one I ever encountered, she never smiles or talks to you. she and the owner probably had an argument, because I heard her say to another customer, oh yeah! I can show you what crabby is like.  don't believe all the good reviews about the food. vince probably wrote them himself.  IF YOU WANT REALLY GOOG FOOD GO TO TINAS  SHE HAS A MUCH BETTER STAFF.

43.description: Hale Theatre Company's second home after rehearsals. I come here with HTC after rehearsals and shows. Always greeted with a warm smile by the staff, and their food is delicious, especially the Calzones!!!! Depending on the night, you can catch Open Mic in the bar. It's a great place to come have a casual Friday night pizza date with family, friends, or your sig other.

2.description: It may not look like a pizza place outside and the inside, but there is pizza here! I usually take Vince's for delivery. There is take-out or you can just sit at the restaurant. When I open up the pizza, some of the stuff are stapled. It's hard to open the pizza then if you staple it!The service is pretty good. The staff are nice and friendly. The delivery guy is nice and friendly too! I'm really happy there are nice people in this pizza place!The look of the interior is not too bad. It doesn't like your average pizza parlor interior. There is a bar here, and there is a small and open wall for ordering take-out. The best part about Vince's is the food. I usually get pizza. The pizza tastes really good! It's a different and good taste. The sauce tastes good with the crust and cheese. I also get mostacholi. It tasted pretty good. The sauce had a good taste with the pasta. The mozzarella sticks at Vince's are good too! It's nicely breaded and the cheese has a good taste.All in all, good food, good service, but the stapling on the pizza needs to stop. I will be back here!

18.description: We had stopped here for a quick pizza a couple of weeks ago and were so impressed with the food and service that we decided to host a family party there for today.  Everyone that I spoke to in making our arrangements and taking our order were very accommodating.  When we arrived for our party, our waitress for the night (Michelle), promptly greeted us and never left our side throughout the night.  They had our tables ready and even decorated with balloons.  It was a very nice touch.  All our food was brought out fast and fresh.  We had fried calamari, salads, and a variety of pizzas.  The stuffed spinach pizza was absolutely delicious.  I was very happy we decided to have our party at Vince's and I was very pleased with our waitress.  Best customer service I've received in a long time.  In addition to pizza, they also have a full Italian cuisine menu and a daily buffet.  There is also a full service bar attached to the restaurant and a nice size parking lot.  I would definitely recommend.

41.description: Pizza was delish. I love the thin crust. I got pepperoni and mushroom. Also, their cheese sticks are great. I recommend this place

52.description: Pizza here is pretty good.  I enjoy ordering from this place so I never dine in.  It's a neighborhood hang out for a few so it's like a dive bar/restaurant pizza place but take out is always on time, reasonably priced and feeds the worm.  If you are into thin crust and are in the neighborhood by all means check this place out!

50.description: Pizza and appetizers are VERY good.  I've tried thin, deep dish and love the pizza.  A must try near Midway airpolrt

4.description: what's nice place. they have great service with awesome prices. there is plenty of things to choose from their menu. highly recommend

6.description: Decent little spot near my house.Not bad.They do really try to give the best food and service they possibly can.I've been coming here for years.Alot of memories here with friends.Hadnt been here in a while.Just recently started coming back in.Thats the the thing about being a Yelper.Theres always soooooo many new places to discover.lol.But yeah.Definitely thumbs up to Vince's!!!!

22.description: My family has went here for generations, literally. If they read the reviews, the owners should remember the last name LoCoco. We ordered faithfully, always had food delivered, they never even needed our address when we called in.I absolutely love the pizza. I'm simple I like cheese only-crust is perfect, not too thin or thick, always cooked to perfection. My mother loves the antipasto salad with xtra creamy garlic dressing.Anytime I come home to visit, we still make a trip to come to Vince's.Highly recommended.

15.description: Delicious pizza, decent service.  Would definitely come back and try the other dishes.

57.description: So I was on my way to the Hut, when I pass this joint and it says, lunch buffet. Great, I pull in because I have Yelped enough of those red roofs to choke a horse. I should have kept going. I walked in and the lady behind the bar asked me what I wanted? Ahh! The buufet? As I step into the dining room, I thought that my contacts were on backwards. There was a foggy cloud hovering around. Check one star off for the exhaust hood not working. I sat down and looked the place over and it seemed a bit run down. Again, is it my eyes, or is that twenty foot buffet line slanting? I went and got a plate . (Of course none of them matched) They had a pretty big selection. Fried shrimp, Baked white fish, roast pork. As I lifted the cover of the ribs, they looked a little dark. The mashed potatos were in the same tray. They looked like they had been there for a week. There were scoops taken out of it, but they edges were turing brown. I took a couple of pieces of chicken versuvio and the pizza with sausage and pepperoni. They looked like they had been made that day. I ate the chicken and I had to guzzle my small soda because it was so frikin dry. As I lifted my head to finish the pop, I read the sign across the room. One refill with soda or iced tea. Well, no more chicken for me. It had a crap load of spices on it, yet it tasted like sawdust? The za was actually pretty good. That was probably the freshest thing on the table. They had tiramisu, pumpkin pie and I think bread pudding. But by that time I thought that my luck was about to run out. So I went to the wash room and there was a sign on the toilet that was as old as the building. Brokin! I think the health inspector must have come here and died eating the food. That's why this place is still open. Not to be Rude, mind you. The pizza is the only thing I would come here for and it better be take-out.

20.description: This is the finest pizza in the area by far. A long time family owned business that serves up the finest Italian pizza-ever. The rest of the country gets Pizza Hut, Dominoes, but i am lucky enough to have them right here. The sausage pepperoni thin crust is heavenly. All guest to my home are amazed by this great pizza. Friendly service for delivery, always hot and the best sauce in town people. Stop wasting your time with the place you order from just because you have forever. Vince's is the finest true pizza on the south-west side!

36.description: It's probably been 15 years since I've been here. Baked clams were amazing!!  Breaded cauliflower was ok. Cheese pizza was really good. Our server was great. Waited a while for our food, but our server was always checking in on us. I'll be back again.

14.description: First time was great. Had half cheese and half pepporoni. It was thin and crispy crust, slight hint of a sweet sauce and one of the best pizzas I've had in awhile. Delivery was fast and I can't wait to try again.

1.description: What's the 1st thing you do when you flight lands? Go to White Castle, right? This location is convenient because it's near Midway airport. The food was fast & fresh but the drive-thru employee was not attentive. When we begin to order she rudely said "I'll be with you in a moment!" Huh, why, there was no one in front of us! Then we pull up to get our food & there's onion rings in the bag. WHY? We didn't order onion rings. And when we told her she says "you didn't order onion rings?" Ahhhhh, NO! She goes on to say "we'll have to cancel the order & re-ring it".  The manager then walks up and said "can we just give you a medium fry so we won't have to go through the hassle of canceling then ringing it all over."I'm didn't get to sleep in my flight, I'm tired...so for her convenience we took the fries and left. Will I return, sure the food was good & fresh! Things happen!

9.description: Yep...You just can't eat enough sliders.Those little things are just delicious.

12.description: I tried this place on my way to Midway airport. I love new Veggie sliders. Very nice vegetarian option added to white castle menu.. Loved it.

21.description: Just so happened to be right across the street from Giordianos Pizzeria (literally a 15-20 minute walk from the Chicago Midway Airport), so decided to stop on by after Giordianos. The White Castle burgers are CHEAP and SMALL (I'm talking only $0.61 for a White Castle burger). I can now say I've been there and done that. The burgers are honestly nothing that special or great, just had to try it after watching Harold & Kumar Go To White Castle! :D Fries were pretty good! They put pickles in the burgers, so don't forget to ask for no pickles when ordering if you are not a big pickle fan. Service was fast. Quality of food was poor.

16.description: Waiting for wife.......as she is landing shortly.Have 15 minutes to "waste".It has been awhile since I have had a slider (the original creators!...and creators of the entire hamburger industry!).I had a fish sandwich with cheese. Very tasty. I only had one.Time to go pick up Wifey...so 2 trivia tidbits to readers of this review.** Though WC was started in Wichita KS...there is no WC there today nor anywhere in Kansas.**Every year on Valentine's Day White Castle offers to reserve a candlelit table for two, complete with a server. I think Wifey would kill me if I did that on Valentine's Day.......after she died laughing

17.description: Love White Castle, go once every other week on Friday late night. So far of most I visited around the city, this one takes the longest everytime I go, drive thru, wait for about 10 to 15 minutes. Argh, wish they were faster, happens all the time.

10.description: I give them one star for being open late. However, it's clear they don't have the capacity or expertise to handle their flow of customers at night. Drive thru wait wasn't bad. When I get to the window my bag is ripped up the side. My stuff fit neatly in the bag so I'm confused how it got ripped and why the cashier thought it was OK to give me a ripped bag. But whatever, it was late. Driving past the window there was at least 10-15 people crowded inside the lobby waiting. So I was confused when I got home why ALL the food was cold and stale. I get its late but I ended up throwing the food out, for fear that it had been sitting out somewhere for hours, and they just didn't give a care and threw it my bag to get the line down.

5.description: I've posted a video showing the restaurant and planes landing at Midway Airport. Take a look and like it or let me know if you'd like something different. Thanks. I've been eating at White Castle locations for  over 30 years. And this location was my very first White Castle experience in 1982. Many things have changed since then except for the airplanes landing right outside this location. When this location was rebuilt from the ground up a number of years ago I can say White Castle failed. This building has one small counter (last one had three) and there is very little seating area to handle the volume that uses this location. Recent visits have had very long lines just to order, a 10+ minute wait for my order after paying, and ignorant and unresponsive employees. The tables are always dirty and the rest rooms are disgusting. The exterior is usually maintained by an outside landscaping firm and often looks fairly sharp. Watching the airplanes landing at the airport never gets old for me and that's about the only reason I come back.

11.description: Ok let's be honest here. Yes, the sliders are amazing but damn do they take forever for drive thru and even when u dine in. Sucks this is the only white castle around midway area...

22.description: White castle rocks, and this one not only rocks, but shakes - literally. Pull up into the parking spaces closer to Cicero and you can pretty much be as close to a 737 landing as you'll ever want to be - it's really quite trippy.

0.description: First time and a White Castle. Went through the drive thru and service was very fast. Only disappointing part was the not so friendly workers. Nothing terrible just not very welcoming.Food was hot and tasty.

20.description: Hi my name is Angelica and I'm addicted to White Castle. 12 years ago I moved from Chicago to LA and my addiction has grown stronger. The frozen burgers from the grocery store just don't cut it. You have to get the freshly steamed stuff from the castle shaped building. When I'm back in Chicago visiting, my mom picks me up from Midway and we bee-line it to the 63rd and Cicero location which happens to also be walking distance from the house. I get the #1 with cheese, fries and a coke. I'm torn between the crinkle cut fries and their awesome onion rings so I switch off with each visit. White Castle is definitely what I crave.

19.description: I think the only time I go to White Castle is late at night.  I don't think I ever have the craving at any other time of day.  I'm a simple guy and I normally just go for the cheese sliders but now they have all sorts of options to choose from.  I also enjoy their fries and onion rings and I find myself sometimes only ordering those items off the menu!  I always loved to get a Crave Case (30 sliders) anytime I need to feed large groups of people or if I'm really hungry...kidding.  My new favorite item would have to be the Chicken rings.  You can get a sack of 20 for only $4 and change.  I just love the deal and it fills me up too!  If you've never had some White Castle before, I would definitely worth a shot!  Check it Out!!-Papa Bear

2.description: Living in California, we don't have white castles, but I've always wanted to try one considering how big the hype is. Unfortunately, I was not impressed at all and this place fell below our expectations. I guess you could say it's just like every other typical fast food place. The employees didn't not seem happy to be there, it made me feel really bad for them. As far as the food, it was just ok. I ordered a few different sliders since they are so small and I wanted to try different ones. The patties had no flavor at all and seem like they were microwaved. The buns were super soggy. I probably won't want to come back again, since I didn't find it satisfying.

18.description: I love white castle but the service here is so awful! You can literally wait 30 minutes for a freakin' slider.

13.description: This used to be a regular stop on the way to the hotelSmall burgers, much like sliders.A very different taste and greasy but addicting.

4.description: We don't have White Castle where I'm from, so I had to stop!! Just little sliders, not even the most delicious but something about them makes you wanna fall in love. You can get 4 sliders, fries and a drink for about $6.

6.description: I usually do not write restaurant reviews but I thought I'd I should leave feedback on this one.This place sucks. It was 60 degrees inside and 70 degrees outside.The employees were just arguing with each other.We spent 10 minutes trying to place an order that was way too complicated.All we wanted was a number 9.I literally saw a family with small children leave the restaurant because they thought they were going to get the flu cold it was.

15.description: Really fast service.  That place is hustling like nobodies business.  In N Out Burgers is this busy but takes way longer.  Happy that I finally experienced White Castle!  Beastie Boys and Harold & Kumar.... I've visited and the experience at this location rocked.  Yum x 22.3!

7.description: Waited a long time to get a short interaction with the cashier. The cashier was in such a hurry that she walked away before giving me my receipt. The associates seem to be in such a panic when there is relatively no customers. I have yet to receive my food, but I'm sure I have nothing to look forward to since the customer service left a bad taste in my mouth.

8.description: I've been to this White Castle numerous times. They offer good service at low price. I would definitely recommend this place for a quick bite before taking off at the nearby airport.

3.description: Husband loves White Castle, and I occasionally indulge, but my 2-star rating is for the location, not the food.This location is small, way too small for the volume that clearly comes through here.  Even at 10pm, this place was clearly overwhelmed.  Given what I could see of the building and the size of the dining room, the kitchen is woefully undersized.The staff was neither rude, nor friendly, just indifferent.  OK, fine, whatever.  But SUCH A LONG WAIT.  When you're tired from flying, so hungry, and just wanting to get to your hotel, waiting at this drive-through for 25 minutes was just awful, especially considering we were one of only TWO cars.

14.description: OMG they are so slow here. I've been waiting (wasting gas, mind you) on the drivethru for about 15 mins now. Granted there are two cars in front of me but come on!  The burgers are good though. One of the few places open at 2am. Edit: It depends who you get at the window, some people are very efficient and others are complete lazy bums.

3.description: I have been going to Betty's for 4 years now for hair cuts and every time I go, Betty has cut my hair just as I want, unlike other places that cut it too short or how they think it should look.  Their prices are very reasonable and Betty and her crew are outstanding.   I only go there for haircuts, but they also provide many other salon services.  You won't be disappointed.

1.description: I loved my haircut it was exactly what I wanted! Betty was extremely nice and the price was right!

2.description: From the moment I was greeted at the door by "Rusty" the owner Betty's dog I felt at home. Betty and her daughter Betty are a mother and daughter team of hairstylists. The owner gave me a haircut, color and styled it. She was a nice person to converse with and very knowledgeable on all things and cosmetology. The haircut and color are great and she took her time and paid special attention to details. The price was reasonable too. I'll be back.

0.description: I've gotten tons of compliments every time I get a haircut from Betty. I've gone downtown and people compliment and  walk up to me asking me where I get my haircut ? Betty is amazing and so is her crew. I recommend this place and I've noticed that Betty and her crew are excellent with color for women as well. Betty uses the best hair products in her styles, colors, and cuts.  Betty is also excellent with men's cuts and is always up to date in her styles. Her friendliness and professionalism has led me to come back for nearly 6 years.

1.description: Great neighborhood divey joint. Great prices,  great food. They treat everyone like they are there best friends . Highly Highly recommend !!!!

2.description: BEST BREAKFAST IN CHICAGO.  Mexican and American breakfast,  the food is fantastic.  The super friendly staff serve high quality food at a very reasonable price.  They have breakfast lunch and dinner.  Enjoy.  I always do.

0.description: Love their banana pancakes!! Only a place I have ever been that actually cooks the bananas into the pancake- not just put in top. Have only had pick-up service but will be going back.

Stopped by this hair salon after my commute and I really liked their work. It was not busy and the atmosphere was relaxed. The hair stylist I saw was friendly and executed the hair style I wanted perfectly. Price was very reasonable. Needless to say, I will be coming back.

12.description: They sell pizza by the slice.  Not a chain, local owned.  Freshness, and leach slice made with love.  And it's a great value.  Try a slice of the showcase pizza, I think your going to like it!

7.description: We've been ordering from here for the last 13 years.Great pizza with natural ingredients.  Their chicken parmesan is outstanding!You can't go wrong here.  Say hi to Carmen or Pauly for me.

20.description: By far, one of the best pizzas I have ever had.  I love the showcase style crust.  The four stars are because of the delivery service.  The times when they deliver are strange and the last pizza I got from there, the cheese had shifted to one side because of the way it was handled by the driver.

19.description: Pizza is bland and we normally order delivery, never been in the place. Well after I decided to do pick up one day, I never ordered from there again. Place looks dirty and dingy. I was never really thrilled with the level of service, everytime I called to place an order the guy seemed annoyed we were calling. Really? Too many options in the neighborhood.

1.description: My buddy Steve who grew up near this joint brought us here for a breaded steak sandwhich. Small spot that you walk up and order your food, get it eat it then pay for it(super old school) RC cola kinda spot. We all had the jumbo breaded steak with sweet peppers/mozzarella and hot giardiniera on the side. The price $6.70 ( Ricobenes king steak just under $15)The bread- traditional Italian bread meaning French bread. Good not my favorite but par for the course. The steak - fresh made, light and yet still dense with a hand breading cleary made fresh. Peppers- sweet were very tasty with no acidic after taste. Giardiniera- HOT with big flavor!Over this place is super solid and definitely has a fantastic breaded steak. Carmine is clearly the boss (I'm guessing owner) is old school. My cousin asked for a to go box he replied with a smile ("be a man and finish it") as he handed over the container. I'm a fan , way to go ! I'll be back

2.description: Bad experience yesterday ordered for delivery , I had asked for parmesan and was told they put it on top of pizza, unfortunately when we got pizza it had a rancid smell, I think it was the Parmesan, disappointed I really liked their pizza but this was a deal breaker

9.description: Their sauce is the best in Midway. Not chunky, just the right amount of flavor. Normally order the pizza bread! Delish!

6.description: Hole in the wall neighborhood spot. I usually always get the same thing and it's always been delicious. Slice of sausage pizza and either and Italian Beef or BBQ beef. The pizza is always very good. I'm very picky about my beef and this is one of the better ones I've had in Chicago. It won't disappoint.

18.description: We tried this place based on a neighbor's recommendation. He raved about this place and he's lived in the neighborhood over 30 years, so he couldn't be all wrong, right? We ordered a regular thin crust pizza, and it arrived in about an hour. The sauce was pretty good. The pizza itself was a little greasier than I like it, but overall it wasn't terrible. I liked it okay, but I think you can get better pizza for the same price in this neighborhood. But, some people are diehard Danardo's fans, and that's okay.

10.description: What can I say, I have coming here for years. The slices are great. Delivery is less than an hour to an hour. The pizza is always hot and no matter what kind of toppings it is always delicious. And during lent the pepper and egg sandwich is also very good.

13.description: Hubby has brought me already made slices a couple times before and I've enjoyed them every time. Today ordered their thin crust pizza, was really good. Found my new spot for pizza.

16.description: By far, one of the best pizzas I have ever had.  I love the showcase style crust.  The four stars are because of the delivery service.  The times when they deliver are strange and the last pizza I got from there, the cheese had shifted to one side because of the way it was handled by the driver.

17.description: D'elicious! A friend recommeneded this place so we tried it. The pizza is great the tomatoe sauce is very well flavored with just the right amount of herbs. The delivery fast on off days,on saturdays and fridays it will take longer. The do credit card over the phone. The pizza is the best around garfield park if you like thin crust. The crust it just well toasted and they toss parmesan cheese rigt on the pizza. The fries are great, not greasy or burnt. Try it and you won't be dissapointed.

15.description: When I moved to Clearing in 2006, I was told D'Anardo's was the best pizza in the area. After 5 years, I can tell you this is the only place I call for a home delivered pizza. The pizza is always well made an tasty. Delivery times are pretty snappy too.

0.description: As a over the road truck driver I have tried many pizzas from all over the states. This is my all time favorite place for a slice of heaven. You got to give this place a shot and go for the deep dish. You better be hungry.

5.description: Sandwiches are eh... and the pizza seems to be made from cracker bread not the best and ill probably only go if I get dragged there

11.description: I've gone in for a slice and had food delivered to me. The food is decent nothing bad to say about that but they are pricey considering it's just a small dive looking pizza joint. I called to order and when they gave me the price for a medium pizza I was shocked $15!! That's thin crust with just one ingredient. When I asked the guy what made it so much he gave me a run down in a very annoyed tone. Will I go back ? Yea, maybe for a slice but I won't have food delivered to me. I was able to order from Vince's a few blocks down and it was $13 including delivery.

8.description: Love this place! Stop in for a slice every now and then when I'm on 63rd street. Carmen is a great guy too. If you order a pizza be sure to ask for showcase style to get the real deal. Definitely one of my top 5 pizza spots.

3.description: Amazing Breaded Steak Sandwich! Pizza is pretty good too. Guy that runs the place is personable and funny. A must stop when your in the neighborhood.

14.description: Pizza Slices are always good. Make sure to get the Showcase crust when you order a pizza (same as slices). Great Breaded Steak and Pepper and Egg sandwiches too. Kids LOVE this Pizza.

4.description: I would rate the food so far as okay and nothing extraordinary. The meal portions are big for the price. The pizza was not tangy the way I like my pie but not bad. The people there are very pleasant.

58.description: I hadn't realized that Giordano's was a chain, until I ventured downtown and saw one on every other block. But... with that said, I think the deep dish was pretty freaking phenomenal. I have Celiac Disease, so I have to eat Gluten Free items so I wasn't able to get the deep dish for myself. However, I had a couple bites of my boyfriends deep dish pie and was in love. Trust me, the stomach pains were worth every bite.The gluten free pizza is pretty good as well. I haven't really found a place where I rave over the pizza but I think Giordano's offers a good alternative for pizza, since I can't eat it that often anymore. The toppings are ALWAYS so fresh, with the mozzarella cheese being so deliciously gooey and yummy. I would just recommend, that if you are ordering the GF Pizza to order it "crispy" because the center of the pizza always comes out with half cooked raw dough that I have to eat around.

56.description: Went today. Was great. Got a good table. Mozzarella sticks were amazing. Ordered a small deep dish. Didn't take that long to come out. Service was good. Pizza was out of this world good Everything was great. Went to the bath room. And it was COMPLETELY a mess. There was a crap in every bowl there was a sign not to flush toiletries, to use  the garbage ..but there wasn't one in each stall. So there was pads every where. The bathroom was super dark. Someone could a been in the corner and i wouldn't have even seen them. When I got in there I didn't even have to use the bathroom anymore Everything else was amazing. Sad that I had to deduct a star cos of how well they kept the bathroom. Will be back (the restaurant... not the bathroom)

29.description: Like many others, I flew in to Chicago and was told by locals to go to this place for a real experience.  While it was good food and amazing portions, the problem is this place knows thats they are good and that causes them to miss at a few turns.Service was decent, but with the place so packed, they didnt care YOU were there.Food decent and tasty but without any magic that makes a true 5 star place.While i was hungry for their pizza, I dont Gordano's was hungry for my business.

42.description: Had just enough time to eat at Giordano's before my flight home. Had my usual pepperoni deep dish and ordered on to go which I am eating now one day later.As for our experience at this location. Got a table quick and ordered right away. Our waitress didn't seem to grasp the English language but was able to get our order right. The pie was delicious as expected. Thick with cheese but I wish they could add more pepperoni. wish I could get the dough recipe as I make my own pizza at home. If you are from New York you know what great Pizza is. You must try this as it's totally different from what we get here. Bring a second pie home and have another time. The defrosting and reheating is simple and comes out just as good.

23.description: I wasn't a deep dish pizza fan growing up and way into my adult years moreover I love, adore and would drive out of my way for a Home run Inn pizza (thin crust) . But recently l visited this restaurant on Cicero and l have to say l really liked it. Now, I've had deep dish before, many times, its just not my favorite ,however ,l started my meal with fried squid and cheese sticks and then the main course a medium deep dish. I was impressed at the freshness of the ingredients, the favor and the crust. Crust and tomato sauce are key for me. I found a new respect and admiration for this place and will be back. m

47.description: The deep dish pizza was delicious and freshly made which will hold you back a 45 minutes wait. Recommend a salad as appetizer if you arrive on a empty stomach. A small pie was more than sufficient for me and my fiancé.

8.description: Went today. Was great. Got a good table. Mozzarella sticks were amazing. Ordered a small deep dish. Didn't take that long to come out. Service was good. Pizza was out of this world good Everything was great. Went to the bath room. And it was COMPLETELY a mess. There was a crap in every bowl there was a sign not to flush toiletries, to use  the garbage ..but there wasn't one in each stall. So there was pads every where. The bathroom was super dark. Someone could a been in the corner and i wouldn't have even seen them. When I got in there I didn't even have to use the bathroom anymore Everything else was amazing. Sad that I had to deduct a star cos of how well they kept the bathroom. Will be back (the restaurant... not the bathroom)

31.description: 2 and a half hours waiting for a pizza.. Called to inquirer and was told was delivered to the wrong address. No apologies or thats to long here is a free pizza. No, just the same probably an hour and a half  "all ready delivered once pizza". For $18.35 small pizza I definitely expected more... Never again!!! Taste wise: I have had better (not bashing just fact).

34.description: Great place for awesome pizza! It took awhile for the pizza to cook (we waited an hour) and the service wasn't the best, but the food was delicious! The deep dish is definitely recommended! Must try!

16.description: First place we went as soon as we landed at Midway. It is literally at the end of the runway.  Our first experience with Deep Dish Pizza.  It takes 45 minutes from the time you order it and IT IS WORTH IT!    It is amazing. The service was excellent.  The atmosphere was perfect for a pizza joint.   We had a variety of appetizers while waiting for our pizzas.  All excellent.  Our drinks were constantly refilled.  Great experience.  Thanks for making our first stop in Chicago a good one!!

13.description: Two star for the awesome pizza. 0 for customer service. I couldn't believe my favorite pizza chain made mad. I ordered pizza as usual over the phone. Whom I get to talk? A lady who is already sick of her job. She treated me as I was her employee over the phone. I got mad when she started to scream about my order. However, I had to get the pizza because my wife wanted a pizza at 12.00 am & only giordanos. Unfortunately the only place open around at midnight. And I bought the pizza with angry face.Update 01/20/2016I was happy that corporate giordanos followed up with the issue I had. I take my words back and happy to say I love giordanos. Adding two more ** for pizza

11.description: First time here and pizza was great along with our server who was quick and very happy to serve usThank you!!!

39.description: Wow. I'd always dreamed about what true deep dish should taste like and upon a business trip getting stuck in Chicago, I was finally able to see for myself. The deep dish here was so delicious. I tried the stuffed pizza with pepperoni and everything about it was heavenly. The crust on this pizza was flaky and light, which is different than any deep dish variety you can get out east which is normally dense. The inside of the pizza oozed unendingly with cheesy goodness. I can normally eat quite a few slices of pizza, but here I struggled through two. I won't even think about the potential calories so I'm glad I live far far away. Try this pizza if you're in the area and you won't be disappointed.

37.description: I tried to order online for pick up at midway location  on my phone but I accidentally ordered it at Prudential. I called the Midway location to inform them my mistake but I was told to call Prudential. Prudential then informed me my order will be transferred in the next 5 minutes which I immediately called Midway to inform them & I hope to pick it up as soon as it is ready to catch my flight.  Midway staff said they haven't received anything so I told them I was informed it will be transferred with the next couple minutes. I managed all these calls while heading toward the store to hope to try this Chicago classic pizza.  When I arrived at Midway the only respond I got was "I already told you we didn't get the order, we don't know anything about online order". That is not an excuse to not be proactive to help a customer find out what happen to the order. Is couple phone calls not enough for you to help me find out what happened?  Once it was escalated to the manager, ONE phone call between the stores later it was concluded a "computer glitch". If a simple phone call between the store( just communicate!) can solve the customer's problem who had to call multiple times (and still don't have the problem solve?), I believe it is reasonable to say Giordano's have much much to improve in customer service. My only consultation to this situation is to purchase a frozen pizza. No apologies from either managers. I expressed my disappointment in a calm and professional manner to the Midway manager who then in return half heartily say she will take responsibility for what happened. So much attitude even though I'm not at fault here...It is very very unprofessional and disappointing.

0.description: It was our first time in Chicago this past month for a week long vacation and we decided to try this place first since it was the closest to our hotel.Let me tell you...it's simply jaw-dropping and mouth-watering delicious! This pizza changed my view of "deep dish pizza" and I now completely understand why they call it a "pie"! Patch P. and I ordered a 2 person pizza that came with 6 slices and were barely able to finish 2 slices each in one sitting with some beer! We were greeted by the friendly owner who told us his personal favorite toppings are the all-beef meatballs and the chicken sausage.  We went ahead and ordered half all-beef meatballs with mushrooms and then chicken sausage with mushrooms on the other side. The winning protein topping was the all-beef meatballs! We had to get a personalized 6" pizza combo each before we left Chicago.  Each combo came with a bottle of soda and choice of a side salad or garlic fries for $8.95.  We also ordered fried calamari to-go. Everything was delicious from start to finish! We noticed they do nationwide shipping on their website and will definitely have to try that in the future.Tip: Each pizza takes about 40-45 minutes to make, call ahead and order to go, or if you're dining in, order some appetizers to hold you over! Also, don't forget to join their mailing list as they offer a complimentary appetizer of bruschetta to try!

38.description: WORST SERVICE EVER!  We ordered a pizza before being seated so it would be ready shorty after the wait. We then ordered appetizers since we were so hungry after a long flight from Vegas and let the waitress know we had an order for pizza in. She asked for the name and then left. 45 minutes later, no pizza. I get it these pizzas take a long time right? 1hr 15'min later, no pizza. Now on our second round of waters. Waitress comes by and says sorry it will come soon, pizzas are coming out a little slow tonight. WHAT??? In that time we saw two tables arrive and leave with their leftovers and they ordered Chicago style pizzas too! Alright so now it's 1hr 45min. Waitress says 5 minutes and it will be ready. Sure enough a pizza comes to our table but it's the wrong one!! It had the wrong toppings and looked more like a New York pizza than a Chicago style! Once we tell her it's the wrong pizza she takes it back and doesn't say anything! What the heck?!??? So we wait again and now it's 2hrs waiting. No sign of our server anywhere. So I call for a manager and let him know what is going on. "Ok I'll be back let me see what I can do." NO!!!!!!!!!! We are tired of waiting that's why we called you! So he leaves before we can even say anything and comes back saying there is no order with my name on it in the kitchen. WHAT?!?!? I even pointed to the girl, teenage girl, who took my order! "Sorry sir there's nothing I can do." Our party got up and left and he said we didn't have to pay for our appetizers. Thanks you kind manager. Way to "see what you can do about it." Total waiting time, 2hrs and 20min. We left and I turned back and noticed the waitress bringing out her pizzas in a timely manner to people who were sitting all around us. Mr. Girodanos manager, train your employees not to BS your patrons. I understand people make mistakes but you did absolutely nothing to correct the pizza that never came. We walked outside and noticed the sign said "now hiring cooks." They need to change it to "completely new staff wanted." I highly recommend Portillos just a few blocks south east of midway. Never eating here again!!!

51.description: Be prepared for a long wait! This was my first visit to Chicago, so I had no idea that a deep dish pizza took 45 minutes to make. Seeing as this is the location closest to Midway Airport, I'm sure quite a few tourists will end up here, frantically counting down the minutes till their pizza arrives with one eye on the kitchen and another on their scheduled flight times. Plan accordingly and save enough time so your experience isn't ruined by constantly refreshing the Southwest page on your smartphone to make sure the flight hasn't changed times.As for the pizza itself, it was quite good, but didn't blow me away. Certainly a different type, but I really didn't taste the difference other than a lot more crust. The waitress dropped our pizza when it came out of the kitchen and it was taken care of very well: while we did have to wait another 45 minutes, we were comped for the pizza and an extra appetizer. Kudos to the staff for handling it well.

27.description: I've had Pizza here before.  That's the 2 Stars.  Actually their pizza is amazing!  It's just that you'll need a lot of time.  They tell you up front,"it's going to be 45 mins for your pizza".  The prob is after 1:15 I had to get up and leave.  Then had to make sure I only paid for the salad and drink.  I think they're understaffed and should tell you how long it'll actually take.

32.description: Unlike the other place where we had Chicago style pizza while in Chicago, this place kicked ass!  Super awesome, the entire family agreed, and better than anything we'd ever gotten in our home town of San Francisco.  We'd definitely seek out Giordano's if we came back.

54.description: Always a great place to eat on our way to or from Midway. We have always had very friendly wait staff. Just a tip -If you want deep dish call ahead. We called after getting our luggage and it was ready by the time we picked up our car and got there. Watching the planes go over is an extra bonus.

48.description: Pizza was horrible.  Got sausage on my pizza and it tasted like something you would get on a frozen pizza.  Dough was not completely cooked, thank goodness I had a kitchen in my hotel room.  Mozzarella sticks came out of a bag, have had better at a fast food drive thru.  Tried the deep dish pizza it was bad so being a glutton for punishment I thought I would try a thin crust a few days later and it was even worse.   Crust was tough and cheese had this weird not natural chewiness to it.   The people that work there are so rude as well.  I don't think they care if they get your business or not.  If your a traveler stay away from this place, it's convenient because they deliver but the food is overall bad.  Plus if they forget something on your order and you call and tell them.  They will say no problem sorry we will credit your card back but never do.   Oh well my fault I should have just sent the entire order back.  Would have saved myself from being sick after eating at this place.  Maybe the other locations are better but this was by far the worst pizza I have ever had.  It was expensive and not worth the money paid.

44.description: Hands down, dopest dope. Best pizza (outside of Imo's) I have ever had. Made me a believer in Chicago style pizza.

24.description: Wonderful way to experience Chicago-style stuffed pizza! The pizza is delicious: even the leftover slices tasted good the next day after microwaving. Not usually a fan of pizza crusts, but this crust was flaky and tasty.The atmosphere is informal and they do get busy. Our waitress advised us up front that deep dish pizza would take approximately 45 minutes to prepare, so we ordered an appetizer sampler and drinks while we waited. Wait staff is stretched thin during busy periods, but we managed to get our waitress's attention when we needed her.

7.description: Seriously. This is the first time I've had a problem with delivery being super delayed. I ordered a little before 6pm tonight online and was told my order should arrive between 7-715pm. No pizza or lasagna so I called at 7:20 asking the status, I was put on hold three times. The girl finally told me that the pizza delivery guy had gotten lost but that he was 5-10 minutes away. Pizza guy came 20 minutes after I hung up with the girl. And pizza is now just barely warm and so is the pasta. Awesome -_-

49.description: I'm a New Yorker so the deep dish was not for me. To much cheese and when it got cold it didn't seem edible.  I should have ordered thin crust.

40.description: I had the thin crust the first time I visited this restaurant both me and my co-worker were disappointed. On my 2nd visit I had the clam chowder which was very good and the deep dish meat lovers which was good but not great. The deep dish takes an exceptionally long time to prepare so don't go here for deep dish if you are not prepared to wait for at least 35-45 minutes.

53.description: Came here for Mother's Day with the kids on our way back to midway. Location is great if you are meeting anyone near the airport. We ordered the calamari and Parmesan fries for appetizers and they came out quickly . The Greek salad was outstanding and the family size was quite enough for the 5 of us. We always enjoy the stuffed spinach thick crust and this one did not disappoint . Our waitress was attentive and it was a nice touch that they let us put our suitcases away  near the front desk.

30.description: Ordered pizza at 3:20 PM.  After calling to check status, delivery guy showed up at 5:25.  Unfortunately it was not correct Pizza.  I showed delivery guy he said keep it and call store.  I spoke with manager and he said needed pizza back would send out the correct one.  At 6:28 new pizza arrived and driver took old one back.  No apology, no discount, or offer on future pizza for their mistake.  Three hours and eight minutes to long to wait.  I would suggest ordering from Lena's Pizza same great quality, faster delivery and better customer service.  That's my plan from now on.

46.description: This place is for pizza only. Great pizza, do not order the chicken Parmesan, it's embarrassing. Nice people good service, stick with the pizza.

1.description: I love this place, the food is amazing and it's such a treat to eat here. The reason I did give a three star to this fabulous establishment is because we had the enjoyment of sitting next to two young people. Not only were they loud and rude but the girlfriend was swearing extremely loud. There were kids everywhere, parents and older guest kept staring and the staff didn't seem to care but their waitress seemed annoyed. This shouldn't reflect on how great the service and food are but I hope the staff becomes more aware of people like this in a well respected restaurant.

55.description: We just flew into Chicago today!! Our front desk lady said if you girls are starving go down the street. The pizza place has to die for Chicago style pizza. So we walked the block from our hotel walked right in and got sat in what looked like a small section for out server. We didn't get greeted for about 7 minutes. Our waitress also seemed bugged we wanted to order off the lunch menu. After she took our drink order she walked to another table and discussed the entire menu to this older couple.      Now I'm a server also so I get sometimes you run into that guest who forgets he or she isn't the other one in the restaurant. After about 10 minutes discussing pizza and how it's made and how to order she walks away and I thought she left to put our order in. At the top of the menu it claims it takes 45 minutes to make the pizza. So I'm not complaining about how long the food takes. The food was wonderful!! But our waitress could care less about our experience and how things tasted.       We finally get out sodas after 15 minutes of waiting. Then she comes back to the able to let us know they only have two lunch portion pizzas left. So the three of decide to order an appetizer and split the pizzas. Again we have plenty of food so that's fine.         Once our salads arrive I finally get my beer that took 25 minutes. No apology for how long it took. My friends drinks were empty at the time. Our appetizer makes it in a record time. And finally the pizzas make it. She doesn't offer them another drink and we don't see here again for about 25 minutes. We are done eating now and my friend still wants a drink refill. So I walked up to the front desk I assume I talked with a manager and I asked if I could get a Sierra Mist. The lady told me to ask my waitress. I said I would be we haven't seen her in a while. She then asked where I was sitting I walked back to the table which was in eye view of her and other co workers who were gathered around a computer. She brings me a Sierra mist I pass it to my friend and she takes some empty plates. This is where the manager should probably ask how everything was. But she didn't. Our check comes and then our waitress asks if we would like a refill. Needless to say if we do go back I'll ask for an experienced server.      I've worked in the restaurant business for over 10 years. All you have to do is be honest with your table and say sorry for forgetting to put the order in or your mistakes. This lady didn't care at all about our drinks or what we ordered. And she never said sorry for the extremely slow service.

9.description: I'm a New Yorker so the deep dish was not for me. To much cheese and when it got cold it didn't seem edible.  I should have ordered thin crust.

26.description: This is a dishonest business. I would not be supportive of it.On 9/4 around 10pm, I was charged about 5% more on my total bill. The last four digits of my card was about 4841 (If they want to verify).I am not implying that the restaurant systemically cheats customers in order to boost profits, but it is what I saw on my charges in this case.

25.description: Terrible delivery time and service. I called to place an order on a Saturday night. A woman answered and I asked if they delivered to my home. (First time requesting delivery) after she took my info and verified that my order could be delivered I said I was ready to order. I understand it's Saturday night and it gets busy but if you are speaking to someone on the phone, either pay attention to them or ask politely to place them on a brief hold. I knew she didn't hear me but I thought that because she was listening to someone else she would apologize and then take my order. Instead, I heard a thank you and was left on the phone hanging because she hung up on me. I called back and a man named Danny answered. He was very polite and placed my order. He told me that it would take about an hour and a half or an hour and forty-five minutes for the delivery. I agreed even though it was longer than expected but I was aware that it was a busy time and estimated the time that actually took for the food to be ready. About an hour and forty five minutes I called back to check if the delivery driver was in the area. The lady that answered (didn't understand her name) said that he was already on his way and the pizza should arrive no later than ten minutes.  Still no sight of the delivery, I called back after more than two hours of waiting, more than half an hour more than the estimated time. A lady named Amy answered and apologized for the inconvenience and called the delivery man to see where he might be. She informed me that he was two blocks away and the pizza would be arriving anytime. Even before letting me respond to what she told me, she hung up on me and that was very aggravating. What kind of service is that? I was hung up on twice. The employees never bother to ask if there was anything else and showed they cared little for the customer and their experience. Except Danny and the delivery driver because when the driver arrived he was very polite, apologized, and I was able to tell that he was in a hurry. Giordano's is a well known restaurant and needs to maintain a good reputation. With this, it shows that they are under staff as stressing out their employees, possibly overworking them. If this continues, they will loose their reputation and customers.

12.description: Excellent pie, clean good looking place.

59.description: Holy Cow!I've stayed down the street many times and always wanted to try this. This trip I was working at Midway Airport and the guys asked if I had tried it. I said no, because I always figured it would be too much for one night.Well, tonight I said "what the heck" and had a small Chicago style delivered to my room.(Barely) made it through two slices. That pie  was enough food for a week! Very good, Nice sauce and crust with perfectly melted cheese.Not cheap ($24 for a small) but well worth it.

21.description: On a work trip to Chicago and was told by many to try this place. It was definitely delightful, I had the house salad with deep dish pepperoni pizza both were so yummy. Salad was fresh and pizza very cheesy :)

17.description: The pizza is great. The service is wonderful.

10.description: Chicago-Style Pizza in the shadow of Midway Airport.A work colleague and I had finished a business trip to Michigan City, Indiana and we drove back to Chicago for our respective flights home the next day. Actually, I was going to Des Moines for the weekend to visit my Parents, and Jeff was heading back to Northern California. After checking in at the nearby Hampton Inn, we separately asked for restaurant recommendations and pretty much got the same response (word for word) from 2 different front desk staff. Oh well, beggars can't be choosers, especially since we didn't want to get in the car, Giordano's is one of the Chicago Deep Dish Pizza chains that some people swear by. And so much so that cross-country delivery is available. We ordered cheese and spinach, with a starter salad, and a few glasses of Goose Island beer. It was all delicious and with enough left over for another meal over the weekend. Service was most hospitable for these weary travelers, even though I wish I were a little closer to Chicago proper for this dining experience.

5.description: First time having a truly Chicago deep dish pizza.  I was never really a fan until my friend took me here.  It was really good.  The first time I had a deep dish pizza was one a single serving pie.  I guess, like a burger, the ratio of size to toppings to dough makes a huge difference.  We ordered a half and half which is great because you order 2 different types for share.  Servie is great.  Plenty of parking.  I was forewarned the pies are made fresh so it takes a while for the order to arrive.  If your in rush, it might be an issue.  If you have plenty of time like we did, it was worth the 40 minute odd wait.  A definite must do when in the Windy City.

3.description: Finally had the opportunity to try a real deep dish pizza while visiting from California. I really like it a lot and wish we had them back home. As far as the restaurant, it was very clean and had plenty of parking. Our hostess and waitress were both really friendly. We ordered the garlic parmesan fries and the fried calamari for our appetizers and had a Chicago style deep dish pizza. I would definitely recommend this place based on the outstanding service and great food.

35.description: Busy for the 1st time but I can't wait to come back. Awesome pizza, I tried The Chicago Style", the ingredients were fresh, the pepper and onions were crispy. The pepperoni has a great flavor, and the mushrooms were delicious. Again an awesome pizza.My family was full and pleased. Great place and excellent service.

19.description: In my out of Towner opinion this place was great.... Not just the food but the overall dining experience.

28.description: Great location! Can't wait to go back!!

45.description: This place is the real deal Holyfield. Their stuff pizza weighs about 4 pounds and is chock full of good stuff. Great taste and a very friendly atmosphere. I can only imagine that one of the pizzas is about 4000 cal plus. I had to try this place because there was a lot of hype and it lived up.

33.description: Picture lasagna in a pizza. Gooey delicious mozzarella cheese inside a pie with a buttery flakey crust. The sauce is divine with the perfect amount of sweetness to it. One slice and I was full and between the two of us (my husband and I) we took half of the smallest pie size home. We decided to get meatballs in it which we regretted because they didn't do much for the pizza but wow we thought this pizza was delicious. We also did get a small size of the Harvest Salad to start which was a perfect size for both of us to snack on during the 45 minute wait for the pizza. The wait is typical because they need every minute to make this pizza perfect. I liked the feel of this place. It reminded me of a Friday's meets Italian restaurant so it was casual but nice enough to enjoy a glass of wine with our food. We are not local to the area so we won't be able to return but I'd say this would be the type of place I wouldn't go to often because it is super filling. More of a special treat. Their menu is huge though so there are many other options other than their famous stuffed pizza.

43.description: Went there for a stuffed pepperoni pizza and got a cold stuffed cheese pizza after one hour and 15 minutes of waiting. Stuffed pizza should really only take about 40 minutes. Told the server we had asked for pepperoni and she only apologized but didn't do anything about it. She was very slow. Didn't even enjoy our food. Won't be returning.

2.description: Wonderful way to experience Chicago-style stuffed pizza! The pizza is delicious: even the leftover slices tasted good the next day after microwaving. Not usually a fan of pizza crusts, but this crust was flaky and tasty.The atmosphere is informal and they do get busy. Our waitress advised us up front that deep dish pizza would take approximately 45 minutes to prepare, so we ordered an appetizer sampler and drinks while we waited. Wait staff is stretched thin during busy periods, but we managed to get our waitress's attention when we needed her.

18.description: Customer service was poor my boyfriend and I got sat uncomfortably close to another group and no one approached us at all to take our order or to even say hi after about 10 minutes I got up and asked the hostess if we could be moved to another section she didn't answer just looked at me like she was confused so I decided to move anyway after I was settled in the new area I asked if they could change the channel because there was a Bulls game on they said no finally when I was leaving I asked for a couple of boxes to have the leftover pizza split they said sure yet still came out with one box pizza obviously not split , food was delicious though .

41.description: First time here and pizza was great along with our server who was quick and very happy to serve usThank you!!!

52.description: I really love their stuff pizza..  We celebrated my son's 22nd Birthday we brought his cake here.  We ordered  soup and fried cheese sticks and mushrooms  delicious.  The pizza was very good executed which means it was not raw nor was it over done.  I do not burned crust.  The sauce was just perfect.  The drinks were delicious.  I like coming here because is not too far from my mom's house.  The servers was very nice he helped us with the plates for the birthday cake.  The service was prompt and very nice

50.description: There's a problem... If you've never had an authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza, then it would be unfair to compare these pizzas to any other pizzas you've ever had. Yes the ingredient and circular appearance may be the same, but that's where the similarities end. First off these "pizzas" (for lack of a better term) are about a solid inch thick. Secondly the sauce is poured over the top sandwiching the ingredients between the dough. Lastly the crust of this "pizza" resembles that of the crust of a pie. Not in flakiness, but in tastes... This is why a Chicago pizza is not a pizza, rather, a Pizza Pie. It's in a category on its own. It's oranges compared to apples. 4 stars, because you really come here just for the pizza... Also call in (if you can) these pizzas take 40 mins to make, but are well worth it, just try to keep your idea of what a pizza should be out your mind while you consume this dish!

4.description: Friday night. Seated on entry. Decent cocktails, yummy chopped salad to split between two, and a spinach stuffed pizza. Service was good. Giordano's reliably dishes up the best stuffed pizza in a casual setting. I've been coming here (as well as other locations) for a long time, with no plans to stop. It' a Chicago classic. : )

6.description: Pizza was good. Not as good as I've had in the past though. Service however was FANTASTIC! Our server was great! Everyone was friendly and we had a good meal. The chocolate cake was good but not as good as the last time we were here. Overall, our food was just ok. But I wanted to say Thank You to the staff for making our meal that much better

22.description: I love this place, the food is amazing and it's such a treat to eat here. The reason I did give a three star to this fabulous establishment is because we had the enjoyment of sitting next to two young people. Not only were they loud and rude but the girlfriend was swearing extremely loud. There were kids everywhere, parents and older guest kept staring and the staff didn't seem to care but their waitress seemed annoyed. This shouldn't reflect on how great the service and food are but I hope the staff becomes more aware of people like this in a well respected restaurant.

15.description: Wasn't very busy when we came for a late lunch. We sat for a bit til our waiter came to us, but he was attentive afterwards.Garlic Parmesan Fries were okay.Sausage, Spinach and Mushroom Pizza lacked spices and flavor. I either tasted the sausage or spinach. I didn't even taste the mushroom in it. I like a little more sauce on my pizza.

57.description: Very good Pizza, place was crowded and incredibly busy, so I had my order delivered.  Chicago pizza is Definitely Very good, still not better than NY pizza.  Next time I'll actually try some of the Itialian Food.  But their Deep Dish Pizza was awesome.

20.description: In my out of Towner opinion this place was great.... Not just the food but the overall dining experience.

36.description: Best pizza ever.... And I'm not a fan of pizza!!! So darn good!  We had a cheese and sausage thin crust...ORDER IT! I ate the pizza...our dog ate the crust! Happy wife...happy ...dog?  Whatever!  Good pizza, sweet delivery guy, happy dog! Fanfreakin' good pizza!!

14.description: I hadn't realized that Giordano's was a chain, until I ventured downtown and saw one on every other block. But... with that said, I think the deep dish was pretty freaking phenomenal. I have Celiac Disease, so I have to eat Gluten Free items so I wasn't able to get the deep dish for myself. However, I had a couple bites of my boyfriends deep dish pie and was in love. Trust me, the stomach pains were worth every bite.The gluten free pizza is pretty good as well. I haven't really found a place where I rave over the pizza but I think Giordano's offers a good alternative for pizza, since I can't eat it that often anymore. The toppings are ALWAYS so fresh, with the mozzarella cheese being so deliciously gooey and yummy. I would just recommend, that if you are ordering the GF Pizza to order it "crispy" because the center of the pizza always comes out with half cooked raw dough that I have to eat around.

3.description: I will agree with half of what Robb wrote,  I never made it in at 4am,  so I can only review about the thieves,  robbers,  and seedy characters.There are at least seven bars within walking distance in my hood,  unfortunately three are completely off limits.  This is one of them.I have been here three times,  each time I was the target for snake oil sales,  prostitution for a six pack,  and I've decided I should go somewhere I won't get rolled.In my younger days I would have taken these things as challenges,  but now,  I am usually trying to protect my fragile aging body.  The thought of getting punched used to get me thinking about how I would absorb the blow and counter punch,  now I can only focus on what kind of ice pack I will stick on my head. Or how much a new pair of glasses will cost.Marianna's is a dump,  the same regulars haunt this place,  they are not very welcoming to newbies,  which insures the same crusty scavengers will inhabit this dive.  For me,  I have other choices and will not miss my experiences at Mariana's.One note,  I subscribe to a website called everyblock.com,  each Monday it posts any crimes in the neighborhood,  this address comes up most Mondays,  go figure.

1.description: the ONLY good thing about this place is that it's open til 4am. it looks old and not well maintained inside. smells like an old lady's house. they have carpet on the floor in a bar for some reason. and it probably hasn't been cleaned ever which explains the smell. the drinks are way overpriced for a dive bar.

2.description: How disappointing that this is the closest bar that is allowed to be open past 2AM.Upon arriving I was asked to show 2 forms of ID probably because I look like I am 12 Right??Then  I was frisked rather thoroughly before being allowed to enter this dump which had music too damn loud and it was obvious all the girls where "Pay to Play".I barely got my beer finished before I had enough and left.

0.description: I dont understand all the NEGATIVE REVIEWS.Lmao!!!! Actually,YES I CAN.This is a DIVE BAR.What do you expect from a 4am bar??? SERIOUSLY!!!! Idk.I kinda like it though and am glad they're here.Yep.I dont mind the late night bar fights  that sometimes roll into the street.Doesnt happen THAT OFTEN.lol.One time some guy GOT STANBBED.Daaaamn,THAT SUCKS!!! Why 3 STARS? Cause I have NEVER personally EVER had a problem.I live right across the street.Its mostly a neighborhood bar except for the weekends(which is when I STAY AWAY) because its open till 4am on Fridays and Saturdays and ALOT OF PEOPLE from OUTSIDE THIS NEIGHBORHOOD come in and drink for ONE MORE HOUR.Smdh.Anyways,this is MY NEIGHBORHOOD BAR(except on wekends between 2am and 4am).

4.description: I got searched from head to toe by some over zealous bouncer at 9 pm on a sunday night.  there was 2 customers in the entire place.  I thought that was uncalled for.  drinks seem kind of high compared to other crappy bars in the area.  the clientele on a saturday night is too unruly for me.  gangbangers and douchebags.  I've had problems leavin the place.  people outside by my car that wanted to start some trouble.    long story short, stay away from this place.

3.description: Great atmosphere and great selection of polish appetizers and polish beers. Service is always great. Great neighborhood place.

1.description: So happy to have found this place. Nice little bar with real deal Polish food. Perfect pierogi and cheap drinks...What more could you ask for?

2.description: The people are genuine as is the Polish fare. Polish beer has a malty taste that I prefer over the overt hoppiness of the de rigeur IPA craze reminiscent of the merlot fascination of the yuppies in the late 80's. You don't have to pretend to like this sharp, easy drinking  beer  while meeting and conversing with honest men and women  who are the backbone of our society. Paramedics,  nurses, mechanics, tradesmen and airport employees, they take part in the daily stroll through the  piazza of thus neighborhood. Real life.

9.description: Step into Poland! There is NO OTHER Polish Bar like this in Midway!  Just smile and nod, EVERYONE but EVERYONE speaks Polish here, they dance, they sing, they're friendly welcoming! i love it, i love it, i love it, i love it! what a GEM!!!

10.description: I love this place.Treated like family by all.Inexpensive and fun.

4.description: i feel so embarrassed that i strong-armed my dinner party into driving all the way over here from 63rd and Western for drinks. Maybe I had in mind previous visits to this space, ten years ago when it was the Baby Doll Polka Club and the times were good and the bar was fun. Maybe Friday night is not the night for Karolinka Club.The crowd was sparse and was a blend of neighborhood White Trash and of Poles whose skin was hardened from working the land back home before settling down in America. It was not much of a scene.But the drinks were cheap, and I am always happy to spend a little time in a place that not only has Okocim on tap, but Żywiec as well.I would not go back on a weekend night looking for a good time, but Karolinka's will still probably hold a spot in my portfolio as a place to stop for a quick one in the afternoon or early evening if I am driving nearby. I would not make a special trip.

6.description: If you ever want to be in a dimly lit looking house that has old people doing the polka and also serves liquor, this is the place for you!Not much to say about this bar really, it has a really simple set up and has most types of alcohol available.  Naturally, they also serve polish beers and liquor as well.  Not only do they have the Polish dancing and drinks, but they also have food that you can order and they make somewhere downstairs where there isn't much lighting either.  Haha.  I'll be honest and point out that the only thing that I've tried on their menu, which I hear most things on it are good, is the deli platter.  Pretty basic platter that consists of a few deli meats, cheese, tomatoes, and olives.  Simple, yet very filling, so beware!  I have to just quickly point out that there are no locks on (at least the men's) restroom door.  I was in there once taking care of some business when a highly intoxicated individual came in, after I had made it perfectly clear there was someone inside, to use the sink.  It was a pretty awkward moment for me since I couldn't really move or hide anywhere but the gentleman reassured me that it was, "Ok" and that he was going to be in and out quitter than I can yell for help.  It's a funny now but extremely weird at the time.  I try to go before or after I'm at this place for sure!!.  Lots of locals in here so I think this is more suited for people from around the area.  I wouldn't venture all the way to the South Side just to try this place out.  If you are in the area and can't find a place to settle for the night, you might as well give this place a shot!  Check it out...just don't use the restroom!  -Papa Bear

12.description: Solid meat pierogoies (sorry, been a solid pierogi tear lately) and how can you beat cheap. STRONG drinks at a not-so-loud-bar-on-a-Saturday night?Shit son, I had my mom, dad, and my uncle from Szcezin, tag along and I had heard all the non-coherent blabble from the significant other all.night.long.In short, solid bar for a 3-7pm on a weekend with very solid meat pierogis and strong drinks. Fuck, we even got a shot of Spiritusz with Halena, the barwench (granted the tab for 8 Scotch/7 ups, 3 gin-tonics, a Long Island Ice Tea and 36 pierogis + tea = 60 bucks AND a four shot of Spiritusz; i think this place is well worth it)the decor...well, to put it nicely, smirk as you find yourself back in your Polish grandma's basement- multiple mirrors with designs, fake wood paneling and various teasers around (saloon doors placed before the downstairs?!?!)Repeat, repeat, repeat repeat with a Polish speaking individual, like myself.

5.description: Stopped in here one night with some friends.  Place is nothing special to look at but the food is quite good and the polish beers are a pleasant change of pace from the normal draft selections.  Worth a stop if you are looking for something a bit different.

11.description: I used to work around the area, and stopped in one night after my shift.  I dig this place.  Good polish beer on tap and friendly eastern European service with no attitude.  They have hearty pours which makes for a lot of fun driving home drunk.      I go here a bout once month now even though I don't work there any more.  My Polish buddies don their best jump suits and dress shoes( just kidding) and we head over there to talk, eat, and get drunk.       Side note I was in there once late at night by myself when some guy suffering from "little man syndrome" and "beer balls" sauntered up to me and insulted me and challenged me to fight. I refused.... because he was piss drunk and the size of an 8 year old.  The barkeep, Halina, quickly diffused the situation.  She even said thank you( with a free beer) for not giving in and starting a rumpus in the tavern.  But to you my short, angry,  and ugly friend, make no doubt I would have crushed you, and then crushed your parents(you live with) for procreating such turd. good day

8.description: memories of my afternoon at karolinka club are a little hazy, but i'm pretty sure i ordered several rounds of shots, several beers for myself and others, and maybe even a mixed drink or two, and my wallet barely took notice! the bartender was super friendly and poured some delicious drinks. it was their christmas party that day, so they had a spread of food that was free and delicious. the peirogies were mouthwatering!super clean. super cute. full of friendly regulars who won't judge you for getting (business)drunk at 3 in the afternoon on a thursday. in fact, they'll do shots with you!i will basically be predrinking all my flights out of midway here in the future! my flight last week was smooooooooth sailing!

0.description: A+ serviceA+ perogies A+ atmosphere I'll be back!

7.description: Read my original review of the Bar,  this is for the restaurant.By far the best perogi i have had,  maybe it was my drunkenness,  perhaps my long lost Russian friend who can consume eastern Euro food like a black hole.A paper thin pastry,  wrapped so tight around the filling i was afraid to bite into it.  my fears were based on those Chinese soup dumplings that explode when you sink your canines into them.  These fillings were moist,  rich,  and homey,  not homey like slapped together peasant food,  homey like "I love you,  don't forget to put your hat on,  it is cold out there Sasha."  The Potato pancake,  fried to such crispyness it crunched like panko,  this can only come from mixing the ingredients to order.  The inside was moist,  tender and tasted like fresh potato.  Even good potato pancakes can seem a bit cloying after a couple of bites,  not these,  ethereal and satisfying.  My friend nearly bit my fingers off as I reached for the last one.  I yelled,  "maybe if you didn't live in fucking Elgin you could eat like this more often."  I followed this up by ordering more of everything.The sauerkraut perogis are the perfect balance of sweet and sour.  The meat has a lingering  richness that stays with you,  not that too beefy ground beef funkiness,  a blend of veal and pork,  that balance each other out.  Absolute heaven.Service is more than expected,  if it is your first time there,  someone will ask you why?  If it is a return visit,  you will be recognized and rewarded.

3.description: I can't beleive this place. i really can't believe a place like this exists in 2010

1.description: C'mon This is the Dive-iest Dive in Dive-town. It's small, smelly, the bathrooms are disgusting, the beer is warm, the help is rude. It's only missing sawdust on the floor. My Mrs. could NOT bring herself to use the bathroom (and she REALLY had to go). We walked in after the Sym's carnival last year and asked for a tap beer, which was warm... in dirty glasses. When I complained and asked for replacements in bottles, we were told "no exchanges" and would have to accept another tap... we walked out. NEVER AGAIN!

2.description: This place did not get four stars because it is the nicest or best place in the neighborhood.It got four stars because it's a dive bar and as far as dive bars go this is what you expect.It smells like stale beer and is cheap,just like a dive bar should be.Drunk locals, cheap beers and cheap shots.If the bartenders where wearing bikinis it would have gotten 5 stars.

0.description: It's a local dive bar. The bartenders don't care who you are or what your story is. The beer and mixed drinks are cheap but don't ask for wine as you'll get a bottle that was opened months ago. The place could use a fresh coat of paint and a good interior cleaning. The bathroom could use a good bleach treatment and hose down. You know what to expect here and that's just what you get. No fluff, no smiles, just cheap alcohol.

4.description: Pretty barebones and without fanfare, but the prices are reasonable and there's no hassle at the door.

0.description: This is the south west side's best 7/11.  All the years coming here the staff is always friendly and helpful.  Tip: They get their fresh doughnuts in at just after midnight.

1.description: Friendly employees, good service.

0.description: I am a big fan of owner operated businesses.  From the first time I entered this little hardware store i have been as faithful as I can.There are two gentlemen that are religious,  I won''t or can't speculate on their religion but they where cool beards and that is always a plus with me.On every occasion when entering they ask me what I need and go get it.  This is great for two reasons,  the place is small  and seemingly disorganized.  What appears to me as disorganization is there system,  and it has yet to fail me.  A shower in my rental wouldn't shut off.  Within entering Clear Ridge I had a $30 brand new faucet kit,  it had been in their store for an eon and he gave it to me for cost.  A similar faucet at Home Desperate would have set me back $75,  plus I would have to look for it,  walk a mile inside and outside the store.  Then hate myself for not shopping locally.Many of the "smalls"  you know,  the little hooks,  washers,  and blades are much cheaper than Home deepshit or their equally crappy competitors.Remember kids,  it is way more important that you move your business to a local guy who will actually reap the rewards of your spendings.  When you enter one of these small shops always ask for help,  that is what will separate the men from the boys.

29.description: Great place to stop by after work for a quick bite and decent price on food. They have alot of stuff on their menu from hotdogs, ribs and beer everything is good and the staff is always helpful and courteous.

42.description: this place is awesome.. Ive been coming here a year now and they have never disapointed! their chicken kebabs are on point every single time I get them. 5 stars on the chicken kebabs!!!!!!!!!!!!

23.description: Good food and at an affordable price. Staff is friendly and they do not take long for your order. I always order their gyros.

47.description: i love this place i used to go at least once a week! my favorite thing to order is the Italian beef it's so good! I've also had other things like mozzarella sticks and the pizza puff also good. and i always remember to get a cup of cheese to dip my fries in also the prices are pretty cheap and the portions are big.
