8.description: Anthony's is an awesome place. I went right when they closed up the store and still hooked it up with a delicious super sub and hot dogs. I'd recommend anyone to check it out and get your grub on. Excellent service, free wifi, clean, and most importantly, delicious.

31.description: I love this place; close to home, cheap, good junk food; always full of cops; dead giveaway it's good cheap eats!

34.description: For a quick tasty meal this place is always on the top of my list.  Everything is always good and made to order. Chicken gyro my fav

16.description: This is the place to go!!! super fast service and the food is delicious!!!

13.description: This place is great!  Best Chicken Kebabs around.  All around great service with a friendly staff.

11.description: Pretty damn good food with decent prices and a very diverse menu. Decent place to swing by for a big baby and fry.

39.description: Classic South Side Dog!  It is real beef red hot, not vienna, no tomato,  no cucumber, no neon relish, and they have regular no spicy pepper.  What they do have is incredible flavor that does not have to be hidden with all of the aforementioned crap!!

37.description: Super clean, good service and reasonably priced food.

0.description: Stumbled upon this lil gem while searching on yelp during my visit here from California. The gals at the front were super friendly and helped me decide on a menu item, since they have so many good looking choices. They offer burgers, to gyros, to tacos, to ribs. I  ordered the bbq rib tips, which came with a side of cole slaw, garlic bread and your choice of a baked potatoe, fries or rice. I got the baked potatoe with butter and sour cream. I will definitely return before I head back home and anytime I'm back in the area.

38.description: Excellent grecian chicken. Gyros r excellent. Decent prices. Definitely will leave u full.

51.description: So-so food. Employees are your typical low wage teens. Lots of soup Nazi like signs inside. "Absolutely no substitutions" ,"if it's not on the menu we don't make it", "don't stand in line until you are ready to order", and my favorite, on the gumball machines... "CAMERA IS WATCHING YOU!"

27.description: After 16 hours of being stuck in standby @ MDW, Anthony's made the extra night out here enjoyable. Definitely the highlight of my entire day. Maxwell dogs & a pitcher of beer did their job washing away the stress of the airport. Hopefully Southwest will train wreck everything & I'll be back again tomorrow!

32.description: This is one of those places that has 5 million things on the menu from gyros to ribs to roast chicken. Everything that I have tried (gyros and the hot diggities) have been pretty good. Prices are right with easy parking and fast service. Monge!

48.description: The most delicious chicken gyros!!  Service is quick, prices are reasonable, and they have ice cream for dessert (not that you'll be able to fit it in your belly on top of all the chicken deliciousness).Only one caveat...don't plan on kissing anyone...or standing within breath-smelling distance of anyone for about 24-48 hours.  The cucumber sauce is delicious, but the garlic will stay with you for quite awhile.  I've tried many ways of removing it, brushing teeth, mouthwash, 8 cinnamon altoids in 1 hour, numerous pieces of gum...they may make it slightly better, but it's still there, there's no escaping it!But I promise, bad breath and all, the gyros are definitley worth it!

44.description: Now you know, Chicago's South West Side is not known for Chicago Style Hot Dogs and such, But Anthony's puts me in the mind of a nice and old fashioned grease spot on the north side. But that is totally a compliment. The place is really clean, and pretty well taken care of. It was 12 AM at night and I wanted a Gyro, now you know, here you can get it your way. And they don't even have a Burger King Symbol. Gotta love a spot that sells burgers and beer. You wont be sorry, this place is pretty good, 1/2 block East of Cicero near Midway Airport.

24.description: This place is great.  They have good food at a excellent price.  The Grecian half chicken dinner is awesome, I would highly recommend it.

7.description: One of the best Hot Dog stands on the Southwest side --and I've been to most of them.  They have quick and efficient service, the same employees everytime you go there, and the same great greasy food you enjoy at a Chicago Hot Dog stand.  The have a huge leg up on the competition by being open until 1am, and it's been my savior a few nights. There's nothing like a gyro at 1am,  when you reaaaaally want one.  Word must get out, because late at night the place seems to be filled with every cop, railroad worker and airline worker on the southwest side.

49.description: This place is top notch. I have been eating here since I was a kid. They have a few employees who have been around for a long time, give you the head nod of approval when you come in the place. I so looked forward to it when flying into Midway, and now that I live in Chicago again....Im hooked again. Big Babys, Beefs, and dogs. Fries always hot, service always smilin at the register.

40.description: Fast food.  Cheap prices, fast service.  Had Chicago hot dogs w/ chili... not too bad, the hod dogs were small though.  Another in my group had a gyro.  He said it was kinda bland.

53.description: Great italian beef and homemade icecream...If you like soft serve make sure that you get the peanut butter flavor!

30.description: Wow, only 1 review?. I saw this one the way to gas up the rental car before tomorrow's flight. and had to check it out.What a menu! Everything from burgers to dogs to gyros to ribs to salads, chicken and more. I wanted to try everything.I finally decided after quite a few minutes to try the ribs (I know, doesn't sound like a place for decent ribs).Wrong! The Baby Backs were better than MANY BBQ places I've been to, including Texas. They fell apart with just a touch of the plastic knife and the sauce was good (not the best I've had, but very good). The coleslaw was very good (not quite excellent) and the garlic bread (half sandwich roll) was good as well. The fries were fair, not my favorite, but once you have had fries at Burney's in Auburn all other pale in comparison.They also passed the beer test (I could finish a beer while waiting for my food).I will be back when I return next week to finish this job.

46.description: Anthony's is great!  I love there 5 Hot Dogs and Medium Fry deal for 6 bucks... cant beat that!  The place serves beer which I think is pretty cool although I dont drink.  Its nice to sit outside with the kids during the summer. The service is quick and staff friendly.

1.description: First time at Anthony's great food.I had the chicken kobob it was delicious.Very nice and friendly cashier.

9.description: 2 Polish with Chopped Onions and Mustard PLEASE and a large RC!!!! I love this place, been coming here since the mid 90's. Great staff that seems to not have aged a day.

26.description: Fast service, had a gyro it was pretty good, did the Grecian chicken, was a little too charred for my taste. The burgers are outstanding. Staff was friendly. I would eat here again.

25.description: Anthony's restaurant has a Great variety of food at a affordable price, ideal for picking up a quick meal. They give more than enough food per plate and the good tastes great.

12.description: What can I say, good food, not great food, but good food at reasonable prices and the customer service is top notch. A friend got some chicken and found it was not cooked all the way, the next time he came in one of the guys asked him how  he liked the place. He said it was good except for the chicken he got the one time, the cook told him next time to call him and let him know and he would send him a replacement, and he gave him a replacement right then! Good service!

21.description: One of the best Hot Dog stands on the Southwest side --and I've been to most of them.  They have quick and efficient service, the same employees everytime you go there, and the same great greasy food you enjoy at a Chicago Hot Dog stand.  The have a huge leg up on the competition by being open until 1am, and it's been my savior a few nights. There's nothing like a gyro at 1am,  when you reaaaaally want one.  Word must get out, because late at night the place seems to be filled with every cop, railroad worker and airline worker on the southwest side.

17.description: Fast Friendly service, Food was like a Chicago specialties Restaurant.  All the food unique to Chicago you can find at Anthony's. And you can walk across the street for some good pizza.

10.description: I have been coming to Anthony's since I was little! Always great food and always great service.The Grecian chicken is amazing and the portion is for more than one meal. Gyros are fresh off the spit and authentic with great sauce. Hot dogs are your typical GREAT Chicago style hot dog. I would recommend Anthony's to EVERYONE and I will continue to come back year after year!

5.description: Standard neighborhood fast food place with the usual greasy menu. It's okay. Skip the salad, as it's pretty much what you'd expect from a salad served at a fast food place. The chili cheese fries are decent.

3.description: The prices are decent here, it can be very busy some times. But the wait isn't long at all. They give you a lot of fries with any of the combos it comes with. The food is good, they also serve alcohol at this location.

35.description: GREAT PLACE!GREAT FOOD!GREAT PEOPLE!!!!!I recommend the Grecian Chicken Dinner!  OMG!!!!!

19.description: Best place in area for burgers, hot dogs, gyros, polish, pizza puffs, fries, etc. Worth the stop if you have a layover at Midway Airport.

28.description: The quality of food here leaves a lot to be desired. The place is clearly ran by a cheapskate owner or family.  It's fast food with no thought put into it other than saving the owner as much money as possible. They're too lazy to even brew iced tea here themselves.I had the perch dinner, SO had chicken gyro.  Perch quickly became a cold soggy, greasy mess.I went up to the counter, waited about 6 minutes for someone to approach the side where you pickup food, and asked for the completely nasty iced tea they had forgotten to give me, as well as a takeout container to throw the remainder of the gyro/fries into. I was told they don't have takeout containers. She offered to give me a box, I said "sure" and she brought me this giant cut open cardboard box.  The thing was, I was literally staring at the takeout containers as she said this, they were literally within an arm's reach.It's not that they don't have takeout containers, again it goes back to the owner being extremely cheap.  So, I was forced to wrap my food in the paper they put on the trays so they don't have to wash them between customers.If they're this cheap on the obvious things, imagine the not obvious things like the quality of beef they're buying.   If you eat here, enjoy your pink slime.That anyone thinks this is good or even average food is evidence of how screwed up our food system is in America. The only redeeming factor here is they sell beer.

45.description: Good God this place is amazing!If you didn't think cheap could be good you were wrong sister!This place is awesome they have pretty much anything you could want and it's super super cheap! I have been searching and searching for a place like this on the northside and it just does not exist! Anthony's is a Southside treasure!

33.description: I love this place. Almost everything they do here is really good. Ironically I hate their burgers, and I have read good things about them on here. Best bet is the beef, fried polish, or the beef gyro. So cheap too

43.description: I've been coming to AV Anthony's for a few years now.  This is a good place near Midway Airport.  I've never had anything bad here, everything is at least a "good" rating.  The hot dogs are good, they use Red Hot Chicago dogs, good stuff, although the dogs aren't prepared "Chicago Style."The Italian Beef is good, nothing great.  Gyros are great.  I like the hard shell tacos, they are tasty and filling.  You should try the $1.00 option of making your burger into a Gyro burger, with the toppings and sauce of a gyro.Don't have time for dinner?  You can get a whole chicken to go, I recommend the Grecian, it's delicious.The review about the "Soup Nazi" like signs is right on.  It if says "no substitutions, no exceptions," that is what they mean.The only downfall this restaurant has is that they need to get with the times and have bacon, to at least offer a bacon cheeseburger.  Lastly, there are some specials that aren't on the menu, but on signs outside of the restaurant.

2.description: A Neighborhood ClassicEverything Is GoodIf Your Hungry,Really Hungry ...Order The Gyro Platter With An Extra Pita.Your Welcome In Advance.

18.description: My family and i like this place. They have good services. the girls taking the order are really nice. and the food is always on point.They have your basic quick food hotdogs,burgers and all that good stuff. we love their rib tip dinner some times are better than other but you know everyone has their down days. Over all we love this place they even have ice cream which is always good on a hot day.

41.description: Good food. Usually get the Gyro meal or the big baby..... the only thing that I do not like is the chili. it is not all that.

52.description: Employees are very friendly. Food is superb! Love their hot dogs and big baby's! When ya order from Anthony's you get the works.Their subs are great, love their shakes. Desserts can use a little help, not too fond of the little slices of dry Eli's chocholate or apple pies.I'm ordering a shrimp basket from them as we speak. I KNOW it'll be tasty ;)

50.description: Good spot near Midway Airport if your looking for some non-chain foods like the White Castle across the street. I have been back many times since then and always order the Gyros, which are very good and reasonably priced. There alot of signs that are kind of in your face about their policies but you can look past them when ordering.

4.description: I recommend this place to everyone! This is the best place to eat at anytime of the day. I wish I could rate it more than 5 stars! Thank you for the fantastic service and food! Will be back soon

6.description: Visiting Chicago and was on my way to White Castle when I saw this little place. And what a gem it turned out to be. Small joint, but busy. When you see all walks of life in there, plus Police Officers, you know it's good. I had the rib plate. It came with fries, slaw and garlic bread. I threw in a Chicago dog as well. Everything was hot and fresh. Food tasted great. Will go back next time I'm in town.

22.description: Yay for fat kid late night central! They are fast and delicious. Place is pretty clean as well. They have messed up my order but they never have a problem fixing it. All the staff is pretty nice and they also give me extra pickles! Beware of the high traffic of police and kids being high off their asses. Other than that, yummy hot dogs and gyros and fries!!!!!!!!

15.description: Best chicken gyro around. Everything I have ordered there in the past has come out superb. For being a neighborhood spot, def one of the best. They also sell an assortment of alcoholic beverages.

20.description: I have been coming to Anthony's since I was little! Always great food and always great service.The Grecian chicken is amazing and the portion is for more than one meal. Gyros are fresh off the spit and authentic with great sauce. Hot dogs are your typical GREAT Chicago style hot dog. I would recommend Anthony's to EVERYONE and I will continue to come back year after year!

36.description: Walked down from my hotel around 9pm for a late night snack/meal.  Wanted to go to Tony's Italian Beef but it was much too far a walk, so after reading reviews I decided to try Anthony's.  Got the Italian Beef sandwich and a chili dog.  Started with the beef.  About $4.55, good roll, good hot peppers, and not so good beef.  I didn't care much for it.  It basically just tasted like heated up roast beef.  It actually had too much of that regular deli sandwich roast beef flavor, just hot.  Not good.  I had one at a Portillo's Hot Dog place about a month ago and that was really good.  Maybe Tony's tomorrow, but never Anthony's again.  The chili dog ($1.79).  To be honest I can't tell you how it tasted as it ended up in the trash without a single bite eaten.  When I unwrapped it from the paper first thing I noticed is that the "chili" looked like that nasty bean paste you would get from a microwave burrito.  It had that ugly light brown color, pasty texture and that awful smell.  It was a nasty mess.  I couldn't get it past my nose to even take a bite.  Walking out I grabbed a chocolate/vanilla swirl cone.  The kind you get anywhere out of a soft serve machine.  Was the best thing I ate there.  I should have tried the gyro I guess.  I won't be back.

14.description: They have the best chicken gyros ever this meal is enough for two if you order another piece of pita bread loves this place

3.description: I want to give them NEGATIVE 10 stars but the app won't let me. Hired their taco cart for my daughter's 16th birthday party. They came recommended by a friend. 30 + kids for my daughters party and Marios Tacos NEVER SHOWED UP !!! They ruined my daughter'a party. I scheduled them for 6pm and got a big story from Albia that they weren't busy on Friday nights and she'd make me a "special " deal. She asked me to text her my address and I did. She confirmed that she received it. I confirmed again before the party. At 6:45 I started calling them. The driver called me back and said he "was here" ! Really ??? I was standing in the driveway - he wasn't there. Every time I called him , I got the same story- "I'm here" ! No you're not !!!!! I called the restaurant and no one cared. The party was Friday and they have never called me to explain or apologize, it's been 4 days! Worst experience ever! 30 + starving kids and no food. I was in embarrassed and my daughter's  16th birthday was ruined. DO NOT HIRE THEM OR GIVE THEM ANY BUSINESS

1.description: Oh Mario'sNice service but the food needs a lot of improvement. I had the .......  so bad forgot the name.  Alambre Marios???Grilled steak, onions and peppers, not again not again. Got to taste a couple of dishes from what my friends ordered and they were just as bad.Four of us that left that place feeling cheated.

2.description: I was at a party this weekend where Tacos Mario's was set up in the garage. What a cool and fun idea for a party. The two people running the show were very nice and smiling the whole time. The tacos were really yummy. The two salsas were delicious and a prefect compliment to the tacos.  Everything was fresh.  Everyone was raving.

5.description: Well,  after visiting an unrelated restaurant named Marios tacos in Blue Island and being so repulsed,  I am lifting this Marios one star.  Yay for mario.

6.description: I went here for lunch with my husband he ordered caldo de res 2 tacos and orange juice. Jarrito de mandarina once we left the place caldo de res full he told me. What I loved from there was only the jarrito de mandarina I laughed but how sad he still paid $30.06. The only decent thing was the taco de suadero.

7.description: We only had  a couple of things here, but enjoyed them all. The atmosphere is very casual, but pretty warm for a taqueria making for a restaurant. The tacos were good. The "al pastor" in particular. Tasty. My margarita was blended (not my style usually) and quite tasty. Not a bad margarita price either. A good, solid place to get some food.

0.description: Well, dealing with them over the phone since the beginning was pretty painful. I needed a taquero to come out for a graduation party. Everytime I called they would change the price. So I didn't get that. Anyways, finally decided on a price and we were all set to go. The day of I called to confirm, come to find out that the lady didn't know that Lombard was next to Villa Park. Seriously, we're in the year 2010, Google that shiz ok. Obviously I'm not going to tell you not to come!!! So she charged me $10 extra. Whatevs. A man and woman duo came, set everything up and It. Was. Awesome! We had tacos de pastor, carne asada, and lengua (tongue) for you vegetarians. Lol I haven't a clue how the lengua tasted cause there was no way in hell I would want cow tongue going down my throat. Like my friend say, I don't want "it" liking my throat on the way down. Hahaha Anyways, getting the taco guy to come out and make you tacos was the best idea eva!! Price was about $7 per person. Well worth it though. :)

4.description: Nice place, Good Food, nasty bathrooms

3.description: If you are the type of person who would be turned off by this place, you probably shouldn't shop here anyway.  This store has an ever-changing stock, sometimes they are swamped with vinyl sometimes not.  Lots of hidden gems, if you look hard enough.   The rarer more collectible records are behind the counter and are worth a look if you collect old garage rock, rockabilly, instro etc 45s.   They also have lots of different collectibles, comics, sports cards and more. Staff is friendly and helpful.

1.description: The selection of LPs here is average. They have a decent selection of LPs in areas like classic rock and pop, but the selection is limited in other areas beyond this. Condition of the LPs in the areas they carry is fair and tends to be accurate.Overall, there's just not much for me to say one way or the other about this shop. When they've got the goods, they are fairly priced and fairy rated in terms of condition. But the selection is also pretty average. You are more likely to find rarer things and more catalog selections for artists at Reckless or Dusty Groove, but they do well on bringing forth copies of more "run of the mill" LPs at a good price here.

2.description: Clearly the place to find records. If they dont have it they will get it. Reasonable prices and fare prices to sellers! Includes comic books and trading cards among other things.Its not pretty but it is a diggers paradise.

5.description: The guys that work there are great.  They're very helpful and friendly, which isn't always the case for people working in record store.I went there for soul 45s and was pretty happy with the selection.

0.description: I was heading east on 63rd street and noticed this place.  At glance it didn't look at that interesting but as u walk in and see what they have then u realize this place rocks.  I love 45's.  I have never seen this this massive selection before.  The owner Steve rocks.  Gave me a break.  Bob one of the workers there is a wealth of knowledge plus a DJ.  They had a bunch of regulars that came in and they chatted like fam.  I will be back each chance I can.

4.description: There's so much stuff in this place that it's overwhelming, but most of it just isn't that interesting.  When I turned 16 and got my first record player I thought that this was heaven.  Hell, my first trip in there I scored original MDC and Damned 7"s for under ten bucks each!  However with each successive trip I realized that it was always the same things so I stopped going in.I went in this past December for the first time in at least two years and found a couple of decent things but many of the records that I remember seeing six years ago are still there.What they have a lot of is the standard fare stuff, the ones that sold millions of copies back in their day but then were sold off when CDs took over the market place.  It's a room full of collections of casual music listeners with the extremely occasional gem.The old guys that run the place are amazing and will talk your ears off about anything and everything.  They know their music better than anyone and are always in good moods.  There are also many old comics, magazines, sports cards, memorabilia, etc.  I want to give it a higher rating but I don't really know if I can.

58.description: Located in terminal A.  it's a decent sandwich, pasta, pizza place where you can purchase alcohol-full bar.  Close to $9 for a panini.  Do not make my mistake of ordering their special paninis.  It's was premade and a rip.  Create your own and it's cheaper with more ingredients.  Their pasta didn't look that good and neither did their pizza.  but if you are stuck in Terminal A with little time, then I guess it's oki.  Walk over to Terminal B.  There's so many more choices. And yes, they also ran out of chicken for their pasta.

56.description: TERRIBLE customer service and over-priced. I paid $20 to get rigatoni (decent), a TINY soda, a scoop of gelato, and a hot tea.When I asked if I could have a refill of my diet coke they said "no free refills" despite the fact that the cup was literally only 8oz. So then I asked if I could have some additional hot water for my tea and they said again "no free refills. We'll have to charge you for another cup". I explained that I didn't want another cup. I just wanted them to take my cup and put it under that spout I could see on their coffee machine where hot water comes from to refill it with water. They said "It is policy. No refills". I suggested they tell their management what a terrible customer service policy that is to not allow refills of water into the same cup that cost $2 for tea originally. Ugh! I will never patronize Tuscany again.

29.description: This place has it all. So-so food and surly help. I'm sorry I can't give less than one star.

42.description: Super slow and no care in the world. Will never eat there again. Bad idea go to a different stop to eat. Trash full, tables dirty and took to long.

23.description: No gluten free. No special orders. Everything pre made. They do not like their jobs. I will not go back and do not recommend. Choose another restaurant nearby.

47.description: The coffee is vile. And, it's the same coffee and pastries at every airport concessionaire in the terminal. Barista by gate A4A has the same crap. Stay away, not worth the cost of a cup. The best you can say for it --- it's hot.

8.description: Honestly save your money and just go to McDonald's next door. I had a 2 hour layover and was hoping to find someplace to sit, kill some time before my flight, and (of course) eat. I walked past this place and saw their advertised panini (turkey, veggies and feta cheese) and figured it sounded pretty good. Well they pre make all of their sandwiches and then put them on the panini maker. When I opened my sandwich, there were 2 slices of turkey and most of the bread had disintegrated from the moisture of the fridge and the immediate heat from the panini grill.  Thank you Tuscany for my $8 sandwich. If you can even call it that. More like burnt crumbled toast with some stuff on it.

31.description: Pizza tasted freezer burnt and the girl poured my beer in a cup (they were required to) but made it foam and didn't pour it all in. By the time I got it it was flat. They also put the slices in individual boxes and didn't have bags or trays... Even if I didn't have a suitcase and a laptop bag it would have been difficult to carry. Staff was not very nice either and need to speak up more. Would never purchase again.

34.description: Neat looking airport decorum that failed to deliver on even my meager expectations for airport food.  Panini was bland, pasta was properly cooked but the meat sauce was borderline unedible, cold cut sandwich was worse than a gas station sandwich to go.   For $40, I expected more.

16.description: Worst service ever. Three people behind counter and no one working. When one finally asked what I would like they proceeded to tell me it would be a ten minute wait for an Italian Beef. I was already waiting at the counter for ten min. Thanks for the no service.

13.description: Just ridiculous. Never mind that the ordering and paying process is a confused mess, and that the sandwich maker has know idea who gets whatever she is cooking or that it takes 20 minutes to get a prebuilt sandwich. The food itself is awful. This place doesn't deserve to be in business.

11.description: Nasty rude surly woman behind the counter. Look I know it's hard to work the Sunday after Christmas and I know travelers can be rude. But some of us are traveling today because we had no choice.  Stopped in for a beer and for a cup of tea for my wife. But did not expect so much attitude. This is someone who should not make her career one that requires interaction with people.  Not clean. Beer was fine. Tea was hot. One star.

39.description: Food was reasonable, a little pricy as expected for an airport.  They added onions to my $8 panini for free, which was nice, and the sandwich filled me up.  Pizza was decent, it was definitely worth the extra $.30 for a supreme slice ($5.30 slice)  but one slice isn't quite enough for a meal.

37.description: What you want. What's in your cheese pasta? Look at the menu. Ok I'll take that I guess. What you want. Chicken panini. Move to the cashier. That will be $33. Awesome customer service interaction by Chef Sucks and Cashier McSmarties. Concourse A lacks selection but this place is the worst. WORST. I should have taken a pic of the 2 slivers of chicken paste in between my cheese and butter sauce bread. Avoid this place at all cost. Unless you enjoy  talking to extremely disinterested people. Things better than Tuscany at MDW:A4B carpetTelling me to remove my liquids Double wide baby strollersSpirit AirlinesNot having your boarding passSnack wraps from yesterday and the rancid Merlot served in a solo cup. Happy Thanksgiving. I'm thankful for knowing I never have to go back to Tuscany.

0.description: Stay away.Don't even stop here for coffee in the morning.I watched my buddy buy a cup, walk out, take a drink and drop the cup into the trash...I am guessing eeeeew!

38.description: Good god this place is worthless. As an airport restaurant, the bar is set really low but this place still fails. Fail fail fail. And I fail too for not reading the other yelp reviews before walking into it.  All I wanted to do was watch Monday night football and this place was relatively empty so I asked them if they could change the TV to espn. They said sure, and I ordered the Italian beef sandwich. 5 minutes later they still hadn't changed it so I asked again and this time they said the remote was broken and had been for some time so they couldn't change it. I asked if someone could reach up and do it and they said no, they're not allowed to. I wonder how they turn the tv on and off. Lying lazy bastards. I asked for them to pack the sandwich to go in that case so I could find somewhere else to watch the game. It was wrapped in foil, wrapped in foil again, and then put into a brown bag. Before she could even hand me the bag it was already drenched. I figured I'd have to eat it there before the bag dissolved so I took it out immediately. It looked like 2 soggy wet sponges barely clinging to this cat-food smelling greasy soaked beef. Nastiest food I've seen in a long long time.The only positive part of this experience was that they couldn't force me to actually eat the food. I got chicken mc nuggets from the McD's next door instead.  TV on mute that only plays talk shows, no free wifi, and soggy wet disgusting food. How can this miserable place still be in business?

51.description: Foolishly, I thought the other posters over-exaggerated their complaints...alas, not so. I've never seen worse service, EVER. The "servers" have achieved the "Leave me alone" mark of excellence. If you can put up with that, you'll find the food ain't bad. I had an omelette that was terrific. So, bottom line, smile a lot (you don't want them spitting in your food - something they seem very capable of doing) and leave plenty of time. Could be worse...

27.description: Just ordered a chicken pesto panini. Would you believe very little chicken and no pesto? Add surly help and dirty tables, and you have a total waste of your money. Avoid this place!

32.description: If I could have rated this 0 stars, I would have.  It took almost 20 minutes to get through the line, which wasn't all that long.  Service was friendly but ridiculously slow.  Further, they didn't seem to follow their own signs telling you where to go based on what you were ordering.To top it off, the food was very bland.  I ordered the rigatoni with mega sauce.  Blah.

54.description: This place sucks. Even for an airport establishment.Paid $6 for a slice of sausage pizza that was stale, cold, and tasted like dishwashing soap.I highly do not recommend this place for their pizza slices. If you are forced to come here with some friends, try the pasta. They looked a bit more appetizing.

48.description: Took a chance dining here as I was in the mood for pizza and I had time to spare between flights.The combination slice of pizza was priced fairly ($5) but lacked freshness from staying out under the warmer too long.Unlike the other reviews, I had no issues with the customer service as they addressed me by "Sir".  Tuscany offers a private dining area for their customers with a nice view to people watch.

44.description: Better off at McDonald's. The food here was absolutely horrible, even for airport food. The pre made sandwich in the case was almost inedible. I would highly recommend eating your hand before eating here.

24.description: If I could give it zero stars I would... You are far better off ordering McDonalds next store... Better service and food. Order/Pay system is terrible and the woman taking the food orders and cooking clearly hates everything in her life including you and the omelette she is having to make for you... The result? Bland boring food that will take 20 mins and will probably give you a stomach ache! That paired with fact that her grumpiness spread to me means I'll never be back. Wish I would have read the reviews before coming here...

7.description: Worst airport food spot I have visited in awhile. Terrible food, service and atmosphere. Workers promote a losing money culture. If this place wasn't in an airport, it would be out of business in a couple short weeks due to purely their workers

49.description: coffee was good. not crazy expensive. service was fast and friendly. bagel was not too shabby and cream cheese was kept cold. A-oK.

40.description: Okay I didn't even look at the reviews but $13 bucks for tiny cup of soda & sandwich sucks. The service was pitiful too.

53.description: Why 4 stars?  Because I appreciate a good fruit smoothie in a time of need.   ---   ---   ---Sure, the fruit smoothie is only a small part of the menu at Tuscany.  Their food might be awful, it might be heavenly.  I don't know, but that strawberry smoothie was a life saver.After eating Potbelly for only the second time in my life, I did not know that the hot peppers were such serious business.  I have no tolerance for spicy food.  Well, my mouth doesn't mind it, but my esophagus simply cannot handle anything above a level 2 of 10 on the hotness meter.  Upon finishing my sandwich and hovering over the lone free power outlet for a desperate iPhone/MacBook charge, I realized that I needed to douse my gullet with something cold in order to not be a basket case of acid for the rest of the night.  I was flying Southwest and was passenger B8.  They just called the A's to start lining up.  I quickly unplugged my custom Apple Center (damn, only 31% on the phone and 53% on the laptop) and rushed down to an area that looked promising.  Unfortunately, nothing ice cream or smoothie related was that-a-way.  I was running out of time.My last chance was to head East.  It was a metaphor that was meant to be, considering the entire reason I was in the airport was to head east to Florida.  Tuscany came into my view and looked like a place that did not represent "quick and on the go."  However, my first impression did not prove correct.  The next thing to pop into my vision were a couple of fruit smoothie makers.  A sight for sore and heart burned eyes!  My choices were Strawberry or Mango.  I love Mango, but Strawberry felt less acidic for such a time like this.  As I was checking out, two employees were finishing an interesting conversation.  I thought they were talking about day care in some form, but I was more concerned with checking-in on my Yelp app than I was listening to the specifics of their convo.  What I did hear was:Girl A: "I don't look good in orange, knaw whadimean?Girl B: "Haha, watchumean you don't look good in orange?"Girl A: "You know how they make you wear orange jumpsuits when you in the pen?  I don't look good in orange, so I can't be doin' that."Girl B:  "Ahhh yeah, I feel that."Good talk girls.  I gotta run.I got to the boarding line and asked the next woman in line which ticket she had.  She looked at her boarding pass and said, "B9."  Yes.

30.description: How is this place still in business?  Lousy food, terrible service (slow and borderline rude), and they were out of one of only three meats they offer for paninis (turkey).  The only other option in this part of the airport is McDonalds.

46.description: Pizza sounded great, and I figured it would be hard to mess that up... even for an airport restaurant. Behold: Tuscany has found a way. It tasted like frozen pizza that had been heated up and left under a lamp for hours. I mean, I knew that's what it was, but I hoped it wouldn't taste like that. They have an oven that they toss pieces into to heat them up, but they still came out lukewarm. The gal working there seemed like she really didn't want to be there and was rude. All around, this place was a failure.I thought Chicago was supposed to be known for its great pizza. Tuscany does serious damage to that reputation.

1.description: My sister and I wanted to purchase iced lattes, and when we asked one of the employees, she made it quite clear she gets a zero for customer service. We'd barely started to say what we wanted when she interrupted us to take a call that rang in the back room. When she returned and we gave her our order, she actually rolled her eyes, shuffled slowly over to start making them and said, "can't I ever get a moment to myself?" We said never mind and walked out. I can't remember the last time I've experienced such poor customer service. We didn't get her name, but she was working the drink side of the cafe on 1/12/16, around 2:50 pm. Based on all the other negative reviews I see, it's a wonder this business is still open. Since the reviews are nothing recent, it seems the owners could not care less to improve the face of their company. Pitiful. Don't give them your money!

55.description: This place blows hard.  I had a connection in Midway, which is always a bitch in the first place, but eating at this rip-off iced my unfortunate cake of a night.  The pizza was cold, my bottled water was hot, the lady working there was a bitch, and the eight televisions were all playing an Osama bin Laden documentary -in a fucking airport!I hope to never get shafted into a connection in Midway again, but if I do, I won't be eating at that dump.

9.description: If I could have rated this 0 stars, I would have.  It took almost 20 minutes to get through the line, which wasn't all that long.  Service was friendly but ridiculously slow.  Further, they didn't seem to follow their own signs telling you where to go based on what you were ordering.To top it off, the food was very bland.  I ordered the rigatoni with mega sauce.  Blah.

26.description: Very dissapointed in the service at this place! I skipped McDonalds to come to what looked like a little nicer place. There were only 4 people in line and I had a good gap before my next flight. I ordered an omelette and the immediate response by Shahidah was that it was going to be at least 10 minutes or more, did I want to wait. Not sure if this place has become transactional over time or if its just a person who is not happy with their job, whatever it is, I now see the reason no one was there. I ended up eating at Mcdonalds next door, waited 15 minutes and was greeted with a smile. I really wanted that omelette! Lol

25.description: Terrible!!! Sign says they close at 9 therefor at 8:15 they can only offer the premade sandwiches and pizza slices? Had to wait 10 minutes for the cashier to come back from her "bathroom" break since the cook didn't know how to work the register. I saw many people walk away and I was about to as well! On top of it the pizza isn't worth it... You're better off at McDonald's next door! Too bad I love to support the local restaurant branches in the airport.

12.description: Pathetic. I think that says it. Ordered during a non-busy period. They "forgot" to make my sandwich so 25 mins waiting for a mediocre meatball sandwich. Most tables dirty. Floor dirty. They should be embarrassed.

59.description: Um - So I wish I could tell you what the food tasted like but the service - oh my gosh - please don't eat here!I peruse the menu - I decide to order a garbage salad, teh cook behind the counter instructs me to go to the prepared food - I do go - NO garbage salads - oh we must be out -Oh 530 pm on a Friday night and you are out of food - oh smart!Okay I will take the pasta with grilled chicken  - oh we have meatball we are out of chickenLOLOLoh my goodness really - wow - next time I am packing granola bars - so sad

21.description: Don't eat at this place, it sucks!! Service is horrible and the Panini with egg and ham is disgusting.  Had a short lay over and thought I would grab something, sit down and relax. Nope, rude counter people and even worse food. Avoid at all costs!!

17.description: Wish I read reviews before coming here. One slice of turkey on a panini which was really just a toasted ordinary sandwich minus any flavor. Avoid.

10.description: I was lured in by the sign promoting "healthy" options. Then I forgot that I was still in the Midwest where-- if judged solely by this place-- "healthy" means doughy cheese pizza and butter- and cheese-laden sandwiches and salads.I wanted the Children's Combo for my six-year-old (advertised in no less than four places within this tiny café). At first, the woman at the counter knew nothing of this Children's Combo and then declared that it was not available, no more were left (?) although all the components of the Combo (sandwich, fruit, milk) were available and visible to me and the two other parents in line who also wanted to order it.Flight boarding soon, options scarce...So, my child ended up with a disgusting slice of nutritionally suspicious cheese pizza and I purchased a ten-buck "Garbage Salad" which looked innocent in its plastic bowl, until I sat down and opened the lid. It had easily a half-pound of ham and salami in it. More fatty meat than lettuce, people. And I don't eat red meat. Is "Garbage Salad" a regional thing, that every Chicagoan knows? Because nowhere was this salad written up or described for unsuspecting travelers who may not have the x-ray vision to see through the pile of croutons (see-- croutons... healthy?) underneath the lid.Get me out of here.There's no place like PDX, there's no place like PDX. *clicking heels*

5.description: Avoid at all costs. If you want shitty frozen pizza that's stale from being in the reheater too long come here. Staff was pretty slow. Even though there was only 2 people in front of me. Any business that keeps its fountain beverages behind the counter is CHEAP, in the most negative connotation possible. A business that won't even refill your beverage after you wait in line again is pathetic. I am sure this places make boatloads selling its shitty products to weary travelers at outrageous margins, that's a business to be proud to own for sure. Whatever organization that owns this is exactly what is wrong with corporate America restaurants.

3.description: Love spending $12 on a cheap ham and bread sandwich only to listen to the woman helping me make rude jokes and complain about me to her coworker as I walked away. I should have dropped my food and walked out. Thank you Tuscany worker for kicking my holiday weekend off in a "positive" way. Hope your day gets better.

35.description: I wish I had read the reviews before eating here. I was impressed with the friendliness of the people working- that was a nice surprise. But my sandwich was pretty dry and bland and I didn't even finish it. My husband was disappointed in the panini. Ordering was very confusing- there were a lot of people ahead of us but no one knew where to order what- it seems like you order sandwiches in one place and pizza in another and gelato in another place, but it is a small restaurant and there were no clear lines and there wasn't someone at all the stations. Anyway, the food all sounded really tasty and appealing but just wasn't that in reality.

19.description: Wow... I was suprised at how good the Cuban sandwich was here... and I got a double shot of wine while I waited on my flight.  Seating is tight though.

28.description: The service here is so awful that I had to create a Yelp account just to warn other patrons against coming here! I unwittingly ate here on the morning of 8/16/14 and witnessed the woman making the paninis being extremely rude to every person she came in contact with. The woman at the register wasn't much better. Please don't spend your time or your money here.

45.description: $6 for lukewarm cardboard cheese pizza.  Enough said.  Not many veg-friendly options. :(

33.description: Looking at other reviews I think either something major happened between my visit and the last reviewers or I experienced an anomalous event! The cashier was nice and didn't charge me for a shot of expresso in my coffee. Against all odds and expectations the panini actually tasted pretty good. I told my wife it was actually one of the better breakfasts I've had in an airport that wasn't a chain and she agreed. True, the place did seem like it would buckle under a stream of customers and there was a distinct sensation that the place was not kept up as well as it should have been, but it wasn't the horrid experience everyone else mentioned. Perhaps it was because it was a pre-7 am visit on a Thursday.

43.description: Suprised to see prices this cheap for the portion they serve you. The only reason I'm giving 3* is because of a lack of customer service. The person that was cooking the food was very friendly and polite. The cashier seemed like she just didn't care to be there

2.description: It nearly gets two stars for the hot Italian beef sandwich, but I'd be hard pressed to be overly positive given the entire experience.I don't expect airport food to be gourmet cuisine.  At best, I can expect the big chains to have their usual offerings available.  What I have not seen a lot of, though, is a barely phoned in effort with minimal care put into the food or service.  When I'm shelling out $15 for a sandwich, a drink, and a dessert, I think you need to do a little better than 'inedible.'I had a slice to start, and it was worse than my recollection of cafeteria pizza.  The pies are clearly pre-made (several were sitting atop the oven still wrapped in plastic), and the flavor and texture prove this through.  The crust is reminiscent of cardboard, and the cheese and sauce taste like nothing. The Italian beef was decent, but the bun disintegrated quickly with too much juice.  Also, instead of the giardiniera I'd asked for, it was hot peppers.  Too hot for my liking, but half-way tolerable.Everything was overpriced, which again I think is somewhat expected in an airport, but still was beyond reasonable markups in my opinion.  The seating area is pretty limited and very cramped.  To top it all off, the service was lifeless and uninspired.  They were going through the motions and borderline rude.If I had to sum up the experience in one word, it would be "uncomfortable."  Everything about my visit there made me feel unwanted and awkward.  I will not be returning, and I find myself going through Midway at least once or twice a year these days.  There are just far too many other options available to repeat this experience.

18.description: This place SUCKS. Tried it two times and same bad experience. Rude staff, out of stuff on menu, long wait. Don't bother.

41.description: Okay, I know this place is in an airport and I shouldn't expect 5 star dining, but I did at least want my meal to be edible!.  We stopped here on a short layover on our way to Florida.  I had a slice of pizza. It was overpriced, overcooked, and underwhelming.  I want to go back to Chicago and try some really good pizza to erase the bad memory (and taste) of this experience.

52.description: If you're looking for the prestige of a job at Midway but the TSA rejected you for being too nasty, get a job at Tuscany.  They ignore the customers or shout incomprehensibly ("gah peh fuss" means pay at the cash register and leave us alone), and lose your order while you're waiting.All of us who were waiting to eat looked at each other in disbelief but the other reviews here tell me that it was just another day at Tuscany.

50.description: Great service and good food every time!

4.description: Wow. The two women who worked the counter hated their jobs and made it known to whoever came in. They need to close the store and start over if that's their perspective of customer service. The drink that they made was pretty good, the pizza was very industrial (melted goo with three small chunks of bland protein), and the decor was above average. But the scorching I got from the staff makes me think that I'd rather have plane pretzels next time.

6.description: So bad so rude. Here it takes two people not to wait on you. Then when the do give you the time of day they will not have what you want.

22.description: Stay away.Don't even stop here for coffee in the morning.I watched my buddy buy a cup, walk out, take a drink and drop the cup into the trash...I am guessing eeeeew!

15.description: If I could give negative stars I would. DO NOT get the healthy turkey panini! It is disgusting and I would bet that items, such as the turkey, were expired. One bite of my $8.99 sandwich and I spit it out and threw it away. So gross!!!!

57.description: By virtue of another Midway Airport delay, you the Yelp massive are now the (un)lucky beneficiaries of hearing a review on Tuscany @  Midway...not to be confused with Corner Bakery, as Tuscany offers nearly exact same menu items, replete with textbook black and white striped awnings.  The Turkey and (green) Apple Panini was good enough to sate the appetite but ran into a familiar issue common with these café's...the sandwiches at CB, Panera, ABP, etc, always seem to have an obtuse meat to cheese/bread ratio.  That is to say, where's the meat?  Ok, so it was actually there but in this case, if I wanted a grilled cheese, I would've ordered one.Last gripe.  At $8 the sandwich does not include chips, they are an extra buck sixty.  Now many won't care much on that note, but for one who maintains eating a sandwich without potato chips is akin to having sex without a partner, well, let's just say the experience is diminished a hundred fold.  All totaled, "tax and chips", this turkey sandwich rang in at over $11.

20.description: Service super slow with only one customer ahead of me. Waited 10 minutes for a panini and then they called me to come pick it up rather than walk a few feet to bring it to me. If they had been serving others, I would have understood. Staff is clueless. Chicken sandwich was tough and greasy. I won't be back.

36.description: Horrible service and they only had two items on their menu - paninis and pizza. They even lacked items from their panini menu.

14.description: Awful.  Worse than a middle school cafeteria that serves booze. Pizza frozen and chewy, meatballs from the can, "airport is out of mozzarella", Beringer cab sauv stale, trash on seats...don't make the same mistake we did by stopping here. Go back to the area where the concourses intersect, I repeat, go back now!!!
